job_description: We are a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company committed to developing innovative therapeutics to improve the lives of patients with neurological disorders, including rare central nervous system (CNS) conditions. Xenon is advancing a novel product pipeline of neurology therapies to address areas of high unmet medical need, with a focus on epilepsy.We are seeking a Project Manager – Drug Discovery to join our team.RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage the Company’s discovery-stage Contract Research Organizations (CROs) under both FTE and fee-for-service arrangements. Perform contract-related activities (drafting, contract change control, monitoring for performance, accepting deliverables, managing invoices and tracking accruals) relating to same within the scope of the Company’s contact management systems and policies.Coordinate project team, project subteam, and functional group meetings for the Company’s discovery-stage programs. Track action items and timelines. Schedule internal and external studies, as required.Manage compound logistics for outbound (e.g., preparation for shipment, tracking) and inbound (e.g., compound receipt and registration) shipments with CROs and partners.Manage data workflows and progression of compound through program flowcharts. Ensure the timely distribution of externally-generated data and reports to appropriate stakeholders.Serve as the point person for the Dotmatics Browser software platform, through which the Company’s compound and assay data are managed.Manage drafting and approval of Discovery preclinical reports to support regulatory filings.QUALIFICATIONS: BSc or MSc in the fields of chemistry or biologyAt least 3 years experience in drug development in the biotech or pharmaceutical industryExcellent communication skills, both oral and writtenHighly organized with keen attention to detailStrong desire to manage projects to timeline and budgetAbility to interface with internal and external stakeholders including scientists, executives, and members of the finance and legal departmentsExtensive intermediate to advanced computer skills (Power Point, Excel, Word, MS Project, SharePoint)Knowledge of project management methodology, including developing Gannt ChartsAbility to influence colleagues in a cross-functional team environmentWilling and able to learn new skills to meet changing needs of the organizationExperience with Dotmatics Browser and/or Electronic Lab Notebook implementation preferredTo apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter and include “Discovery Project Manager” in the subject line. We are a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing innovative therapeutics to improve the lives of patients with neurological disorders. Building upon our extensive knowledge of human genetics and diseases caused by mutations in ion channels, known as channelopathies, we are advancing – both independently and with our pharmaceutical collaborators – a novel product pipeline of ion channel modulators to address therapeutic areas of high unmet medical need, such as pain and epilepsy.We are in search of a highly motivated and creative electrophysiologist who will contribute to characterizing and elucidating the effects of novel agents on the function of target ion channels. The primary role will be to develop and run electrophysiological assays using techniques including automated high throughput planar patch clamp systems and manual patch clamp electrophysiology. In addition, this scientist will devise and conduct experiments to deepen our understanding of compound mechanism of action on our targets of interest. Our intent is to identify a scientist with the potential to actively and independently evaluate and drive new avenues of research. Expertise in electrophysiology and biophysics is essential. The successful candidate will join a passionate, diverse, and dynamic team focused on developing treatments for epilepsy and other neurologic indications. This position is located in our Burnaby, BC office.RESPONSIBILITIES: Creating, implementing and validating new assays of ion channel and or excitable cell function both independently and as part of a larger team.Timely delivery of data and interpretation to drive and inform project team directions.Active participation in and presentation at group and project meetings.Coordination and documentation of datasets to support internal decision making as well as external publications and regulatory filings.May supervise research associates.QUALIFICATIONS: PH.D. or commensurate experience in ion channel biophysics, neuropharmacology or related field with an in depth knowledge of electrophysiological techniques essential.Experience investigating ion channel function and or pharmacology electrophysiology and creatively quantifying effects in these assays.Excellent analytical skills allowing for qualitative and quantitative evaluation of complex systems and datasets and distillation of that data into clear, insightful interpretations.Experience handling and managing large datasets.Enthusiasm for laboratory work, good problem solving abilities.Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.Excellent record keeping, attention to detail.An adaptable mindset, able to adapt to rapidly changing projects and priorities; takes initiative.Ability to work in a dynamic and enthusiastic team environment is critical.To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter and include “Electrophysiologist” in the subject line. All attachments must be saved as one file and be named: “Your Full Name – Electrophysiologist.” We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the volume of applicants, only those chosen for interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

We are a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company committed to developing innovative therapeutics to improve the lives of patients with neurological disorders, including rare central nervous system (CNS) conditions. Xenon is advancing a novel product pipeline of neurology therapies to address areas of high unmet medical need, with a focus on epilepsy.We are seeking a Research Scientist to join our team. We are in search of a highly motivated and creative individual who will be part of our in vitro biology team to design and implement new assays to both support medicinal chemistry and explore and enhance our understanding of early and late stage neuroscience based programs. A primary goal will be to develop functional assays using emerging technologies that can provide translational insight into efficacy of compounds in neuronal networks. Likely technical approaches may include, but are not limited to multi-electrode arrays, high-content imaging, iPSC, organoids, and optogenetics. Our intent is to identify a scientist with the potential to become a thought leader at Xenon, actively and independently evaluating and driving new avenues of research. Expertise in neuroscience is essential; experience in drug discovery is preferred. The successful candidate will join a passionate, diverse, and dynamic team focused on epilepsy and other neurologic indications. This position is located in our Burnaby, BC office.RESPONSIBILITIES: Creating, implementing and validating new assays to support medicinal chemistry and inform the translation of target based interventions on neuronal function both independently and as part of a larger team.Timely delivery of data and interpretation to drive and inform project team directions.Active participation and presentations ingroup and project team meetings.Coordination and documentation of datasets to support internal decision making as well as external publications, patents and regulatory filings.May supervise research assistants.QUALIFICATIONS: Ph.D. in neuroscience, neuropharmacology or related field.Postdoctoral training and/or experience establishing and validating in vitro assays of neuronal function and quantifying pharmacological effects in these assays.Excellent analytical skills allowing for qualitative and quantitative evaluation of complex systems and datasets and distillation of that data into clear, insightful interpretations.Experience creating functional assays with native or IPSC derived human neurons preferred.Proven interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively as a member of a dynamic and enthusiastic cross-functional team. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.Enthusiasm for laboratory work, good problem solving abilities.Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.Excellent record keeping, attention to detail.An adaptable mindset, able to adapt to rapidly changing projects and priorities; takes initiative and acts proactively.Demonstrated leadership and supervisory skills preferred.To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter and include “Research Scientist, In Vitro” in the subject line. All attachments must be saved as one file and be named: “Your Full Name – Research Scientist, In Vitro.” We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the volume of applicants, only those chosen for interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

glass and polymer/plastic sheets or roll to roll films.Specific Duties:The principal duty of the position will be to undertake laboratory research, developing the assigned program (see above), in a assist with experimental and validation procedures, when and where necessary.General Duties:Plan, prepare action plans, daily action lists aligned with 3E Nano Inc.’s overall project/program equipment and facility usage and costs per 3E Nano Inc.’s guidelines.Keep up to date with specific and professional issues, in particular developments, in this specific technology area.Undertake regarding potential projects.To supervise and train where necessary new members of 3E Nano Inc. and UofT research teams.To assist in drafting budgets and applications for potential research programme funding and grants.Undertake such other duties as may be reasonably expected by the Sr. Scientist, CSA, and CTO.These duties will be subject to review in line with the changing requirements of 3E Nano Inc., and with the development needs of the postholder as identified through regular review/appraisal processes with the CTO.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Hands On + Theoretical: 7 years Montréal-Est, QCDescription de posteTITRE DU POSTE : Inspecteur ou inspectriceDivision : Services pétroliersLes inspecteurs et inspectrices des produits pétroliers se rendent chez les clients pour réaliser des mesures de différentes marchandises et des inspections sur les produits pétroliers et pétrochimiques. Ils ou elles inspectent des bateaux, des bacs à terre (Shore Thank) et des camions-citernes. Ils ou elles récoltent aussi des échantillons pour des analyses en laboratoire.TÂCHES ET RESPONSABILITÉS ESSENTIELLESD’autres fonctions pourraient vous être attribuées.Recevoir les commandes, collecter l’information et recueillir les documents des superviseurs et superviseuses des opérations sur les déplacements.S’assurer que tout l’équipement est en bon état de fonctionnement, qu’il est étalonné et qu’il est propre, y compris l’équipement de sécurité et de surveillance utilisé dans le cadre de ce poste.Se présenter ponctuellement sur le chantier et observer tous les règlements et normes applicables de Bureau Veritas, des gouvernements fédéraux et provinciaux, ainsi que les exigences des terminaux, des raffineries et des navires, y compris les normes de qualité, de sécurité et d’environnement.Respecter les exigences des certificats de l’ISO et aider à mettre en place les mesures correctives ou préventives.Lire tous les documents du système de gestion des affaires, y compris les politiques et les procédures en matière de qualité, de sécurité et d’environnement, les comprendre et les suivre.Participer aux réunions importantes avec le personnel externe dans les différents lieux de travail. Représenter Bureau Veritas dans son apparence et sa conduite. Agir selon l’éthique en tout temps.Communiquer sans délai tout problème, anomalie ou autre incident digne de mention au superviseur ou à la superviseuse des opérations ou au répartiteur.Collecter les échantillons des bacs à terre (Shore Tank), des pétroliers, des véhicules automoteurs (wagons) ou des camions-citernes, tel que spécifié dans l’ordre d’exécution des travaux.Étiqueter les contenants d’échantillons avec tous les renseignements d’identification nécessaires et exacts, y compris le point d’échantillonnage, le matériel utilisé, le type d’échantillon, les renseignements sur la sécurité, l’heure du prélèvement, etc.Calculer rapidement et avec précision les quantités, remplir tous les documents requis et en distribuer les copies comme il se doit.Livrer rapidement et en toute sécurité les échantillons à un laboratoire Bureau Veritas pour analyse ou les remettre pour conservation, ou aux installations du client pour analyse ou conservation.Examiner le bon de commande, le signer et le retourner. En cas d’incohérences, consulter le superviseur ou la superviseuse.Être disponible, sur appel, 24 h sur 24. Respecter le système de gestion de Bureau Veritas et y participer. Participer aux réunions de l’entreprise au besoin.EXIGENCES DE QUALIFICATIONLa personne qui occupe ce poste doit être en mesure d’accomplir chaque tâche essentielle de façon satisfaisante. Les exigences énumérées ci-dessous sont représentatives des connaissances, des compétences ou des aptitudes requises. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation peuvent être prises pour permettre aux personnes handicapées de s’acquitter des fonctions essentielles.Diplôme d’études secondaires ou certificat d’évaluation en éducation générale. Connaissances des procédures en environnement, santé et sécurité de l’entreprise et des règlements gouvernementaux connexes.Capacité de lire et d’interpréter des documents tels que les règles de sécurité, les instructions d’utilisation et d’entretien et les manuels de procédures. Capacité de rédiger des rapports de routine et de la correspondance.Capacité d’additionner, de soustraire, de multiplier et de diviser dans toutes les unités de mesure, en utilisant des nombres entiers, des fractions ordinaires et des décimalesCapacité de faire preuve de bon sens pour exécuter les instructions fournies sous forme écrite, orale ou schématique. Capacité de faire face à des problèmes impliquant des variables dans des situations normalisées.Le candidat ou la candidate doit avoir un permis de conduire valide.Il est nécessaire pour ce poste d’avoir un véhicule bien entretenu et en ordre qui puisse être utilisé sur les différents lieux de travail.CONDITIONS DE TRAVAILL’employé ou l’employée travaille régulièrement dans des endroits élevés et précaires, à l’extérieur, exposé aux conditions météorologiques, et près de matières inflammables.Il ou elle est régulièrement exposé à des conditions mouillées ou humides, à des fumées ou des particules en suspension dans l’air, à des produits chimiques toxiques ou caustiques, à un froid extrême et à une chaleur extrême. L’employé ou l’employée pourrait avoir à travailler dans des espaces clos.L’employé ou l’employée doit régulièrement soulever, déplacer ou faire monter jusqu’à 25 kg et occasionnellement soulever ou déplacer jusqu’à 45 kg avec de l’aide.l’employé ou l’employée est régulièrement appelé à se tenir debout, à marcher, à utiliser ses mains pour manipuler ou sentir des objets, des outils ou des commandes, à tendre la main et les bras, et à grimper ou à se tenir en équilibre.l’employée doit souvent se baisser, s’agenouiller, s’accroupir ou ramper et il ou elle doit pouvoir parler, entendre, goûter et sentir. L’employé ou l’employée sera parfois tenu de s’asseoir.L’employé ou l’employée doit souvent monter et descendre des escaliers et des échelles, ou grimper sur des passerelles et en descendre.Les capacités visuelles requises pour cet emploi comprennent la vision de près, la vision de loin, la vision des couleurs, la vision périphérique, la perception de la profondeur et la capacité d’ajuster la mise au point.Le niveau de bruit général est généralement modéré.Ce poste requiert des heures de travail flexible sur différents quarts de travail ainsi que du temps supplémentaire.Bureau Veritas Commodities Canada « BVCC » aussi connu sous le nom d’Inspectorate, offre des services d’inspection, d’échantillonnage et d’analyse en laboratoire de l’essence, du diesel, du mazout lourd, de l’éthanol-carburant et du biodiesel pour les avions, les rejets provenant des bateaux, la cession oléoduc et plus encore. Bureau Veritas opère à Montréal, au Québec, et à Hamilton, en Ontario.Rejoignez notre talentueuse équipe de scientifiques et d’experts en postulant dès aujourd’hui!EMPLACEMENT : Montreal-Est, Québec, H1L 3R4Job DescriptionJOB TITLE: InspectorDivision: PetroleumSUMMARY: Oil and Petroleum Inspectors visit client facilities, including barges and ships, shore tanks, railcars, and tank trucks for quantity surveys of a variety of commodities including petroleum and petrochemicals inspection and collects samples for laboratory analysis.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Include the following:Other duties may be assigned.Receives orders, obtains information, and gathers paperwork from Operations Supervisor(s) on movements.Ensures that all equipment is in good operating condition, calibration verification, correct and clean. This includes safety and monitoring equipment appropriate to the job.Reports to job-site punctually and observes all Bureau Veritas applicable federal and state regulations and standards, Terminal, Refinery, and/or vessel requirements; including quality, safety and environmental standards.Support the ISO certificate(s) and assist in the corrective/preventive action process.Read, understand and adhere to the company Business Management System; including Quality, Safety, and Environmental policies and procedures.Attends “Key Meetings” with external personnel ashore and/or abroad. Represents Bureau Veritas by appearance and conduct. Behaves ethically at all times.Communicates any problems, discrepancies, or other noteworthy incidents to the Operations Supervisor and/or Dispatcher without delay.Obtains samples, gauges shore tanks, vessel(s), barge(s), railcar(s), and/or tank truck(s) as specified per job order.Labels sample containers with full and correct identifying data, including location of sample, material, type of sample, safety information, time collected, etc.Promptly and accurately calculates quantities and completes all required paperwork and distributes copies appropriately.Promptly and safely delivers samples to a Bureau Veritas laboratory for analysis or turn in for retain, or client facilities for analysis or retain.Reviews any discrepancies with Operations Supervisor, signs and returns job order form.Maintains a 24-hour on-call status. Supports and participates in Bureau Veritas’s Business Management System (BMS). Attends company meetings as required.QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: High school diploma or general education development certificate (GED).Knowledge of company HS&E procedures and associated governmental regulations.Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divides in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagrammatic form.Ability to deal with problems involving variables in standardized situations.Valid driver’s license required.It is required for this position to have a well maintained & in order vehicle available to use on job locations.CONDITIONS: Performs work in high, precarious place, outdoors (all year round) and near flammable material.Regular exposure to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold and extreme heat; possibility of working in enclosed spaces.Regular lifting/climbing and/or moving with up to 50lbs; occasional lifting of up to 100lbs (with assistance); may involve long periods of standingRegular walking, use of hands to handle or feel objects, tools and controlsRegular reaching with arms, climbing and balancingFrequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, talk, listen, taste and smell.Frequently required to climb and descend stairways, ladders, and gangways.Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Requires flexible working hours, overtime and shift workBureau Veritas Commodities Canada (BVCC) also known as Inspectorate, offers inspections, testing and laboratory services including vessel discharge, pipelines transfer, sampling for gasoline, diesel, aviation, heavy fuel oil, fuel ethanol, and biodiesel. BVCC operates in Montreal, Quebec, Sarnia and Hamilton in Canada.Join our talented community of scientists and experts and apply today!*LOCATION : Montreal-East, Québec, H1L 3R4Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

Laval, QCLe Chercheur Scientifique agit en tant que Directeur d’études dans la conduite d’études non-cliniques et travaille en étroite collaboration avec les autres scientifiques dans des projets de recherche spécialisés selon l’orientation de la compagnie.ÉTENDUE DU POSTELe titulaire du poste joue le rôle de Directeur d’études dans la conduite d’études non-cliniques sur les animaux (toxicologie mais aussi pharmacologie, toxico/pharmacocinétique ou d’efficacité selon la charge de travail). Le candidat travaillera d’une façon autonome en tant que Directeur d’études sur tous types d’études de base et spécialisées, avec la collaboration (si nécessaire) des scientifiques plus expérimentés. Le candidat aura une compréhension suffisante de la pharmacologie, toxicologie et des aspects réglementaires, afin qu’il soit en mesure de conseiller le client sur le protocole d’étude et les spécifications réglementaires.ÉLÉMENTS MAJEURS DE RESPONSABILITÉDéveloppe et approuve les protocoles d’études en collaboration avec le client et les scientifiques, afin de s’assurer que les études sont planifiées de façon efficace selon le nombre d’animaux requis, le nombre et les compétences des employés, les applications informatiques liées au domaine de la pharmacologie, le bien-être des animaux et selon les lois en matière de santé et sécurité.S’assure que les études sont menées en accord avec le protocole d’études, les procédures opératoires normalisés (PON) de l'entreprise, les bonnes Pratiques de Laboratoire (lorsque requis) et les autres règlements et directives. Documente et autorise les changements dans les protocoles et les PON lorsque nécessaire.Exécute l’implantation des procédures afin d’assurer l’exactitude des données et supervise adéquatement les contrôles d’évaluation.En travaillant chez Citoxlab, vous allez non-seulement avoir une carrière stimulante, mais vous bénéficierez :D'un esprit de famille;D'un salaire compétitif;D'être un facteur important dans le développement de la recherche médicale;D'avancement à l'interne;De 3 semaines de vacances après un an de service;D’une banque de journées de maladie et des congés fériés additionnels;D’un programme de REER avec contribution de l’employeur;D'une assurance collective avec un module payé par l’employeur;D’un programme d’aide aux employés;D’activités sociales organisées pour les employé(e)s;D'un accès facile en transport en commun (métro Montmorency);et de bien plus encore!Si vous croyez que vous êtes la personne que nous recherchons, faites une différence aujourd’hui en envoyant votre candidature dès maintenant!----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ENGLISHThe Research scientist acts as a Study Director in the conduct of pre-clinical studies. The selected candidate will work in close collaboration with the Director of Toxicology and other scientists for specialized projects according to company guidelines.The selected candidate will work as Study Director in the conduct of non-clinical studies with animals (toxicology but also pharmacology, toxico-pharmacokinetic or efficacy models depending on workload). The candidate will be required to be autonomous as Study Director on all types of specialized or basic studies with the collaboration (if required) from other more experienced scientists. The candidate will have sufficient knowledge in pharmacology, toxicology and regulatory sciences to provide advice to clients on experimental protocols and specific regulations.MAJOR ROLESDevelop and approve study protocols in collaboration with clients and other scientists to ensure studies are planned efficiently with the required number of animals. Ensure study conduct by appropriately trained technical staff.Ensure compliance with animal well-being and occupational health and safety regulations. Ensure that studies are conducted according to company Standard Operating Procedures, Good Laboratory Practices (when applicable).Interpret data from pre-clinical studies in the form of study reports for clients. Contribute to scientific development as a member of the scientific team.By working at Citoxlab, you will not only have a stimulating career, but you will also benefit from:A family work environment;A competitive salary;Being a key player in the development of medical research;Internal advancement opportunities;3 weeks of service after one year of service;Paid sick days as well as additional floater days;A pension plan with employer contribution;Group insurance with a module paid entirely by the employer;An employee assistance program;Activities organized for the employees;Easy access to public transportation (Montmorency metro station);and much more!If you think you're the person we are looking for, make a difference by sending us your CV today!Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

Contract, InternshipAbout CmdWe’re a Vancouver-based cybersecurity startup on a mission to transform the way enterprise businesses secure their cloud-first Linux environments (learn more at cmd.com/about). We have an exciting year of growth ahead of us and are eager to add to our talented team. Does the idea of team-wide trust and taking on compelling challenges daily excite you? Read on.Our valuesAt Cmd, we’re changing the way that the world thinks of security. This is no small undertaking and comes with great responsibility. Building and maintaining a groundbreaking security platform is only possible with a dream team in place, individuals who push us to consider problems from different perspectives and infuse the spirit of innovation into our day-to-day operations.To achieve these lofty goals, we hire subject-matter experts: individuals with a specific area of focus capable of providing tremendous value to the team. In order to achieve success, it’s essential that we work together as one cohesive unit. What ties our team of valuable contributors together? We are deeply passionate about the problem we're solving. We back our hunches with data. We always pursue improvement. We help out our teammates, even if it's sometimes outside of our job description. And, perhaps most of all, we believe innovative ideas can come from anywhere and anyone.About the roleAre you passionate about the field of security and the process of pulling insights from raw data? company_name: Ludmer Centre for Neuroinformatics & Mental Health
job_description: $50,000 - $90,000 a yearWe are seeking a creative and broad-thinking data scientist to collaborate with a dynamic team of early career investigators within the Ludmer Centre for Neuroinformatics & Mental Health (www.LudmerCentre.ca), at McGill University. The Centre promotes the application of interdisciplinary, neuroinformatics approaches to research into brain development and neurological disorders and mental illness. You will be embedded within a global collaborative network in an open, dynamic, collegial and team-oriented environment. You will contribute to analyses of multi-omic datasets, development of new data integration tools and help advance pan-Ludmer research collaborations.You will have a solid foundation in biostatistics and an interest in applying your statistical expertise across diverse datasets to answer fundamental questions on the developmental origins of mental health. The role is best suited to someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment tackling varied challenges, with an abiding curiosity for neuroscience and mental health. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated commitment to mentorship and a talent for engaging trainees to bridge research domains.REQUIRED: Comprehensive training in neurostatistics as evidenced by a PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, Quantitative Life Sciences, or a related field. Proficiency in R and Bioconductor libraries in addition to expertise in shell and scripting languages (Bash, Python)HIGHLY DESIRABLE: Knowledge of next-generation sequencing data sets, as well as retrieval of public data, file formats, reference genomes, etc. Experience with functional genomics including RNAseq and DNA methylation analysis pipelines.  Experience with microarray-based data normalization/analyses. Familiarity with Linux environments, specifically scientific computing clusters and scheduling systems Adeptness with data visualization, database management (e.g., Hadoop) consideration of individual differences Data Integration expertise and use of publicly available datasets or genomic resources  Foundational knowledge of neuroscience conceptsSend a cover letter, an academic CV and contact details for two references in e-mail with subject line: ‘Neurostatistician job’ plus your name. The position will remain open until filled. Check Ludmer Centre web site: http://ludmercentre.ca/research/careersJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year

job_title: Data scientist in Computer Vision and Deep Learning
job_description: Toronto, ONPart-time$42,000 - $60,000 a yearRMA Laboratory at Ryerson University, Toronto, Canada*About the employerThe Robotics, Mechatronics and Automation Laboratory (RMAL) was founded in 1997 and since then has been an active entity of Ryerson University. It is an interdisciplinary laboratory bringing people and projects related to Mechanical, Aerospace, Industrial, Biomedical, Electrical-Computer Engineering, Mechatronics, and Computer Science. Its objective is to design and build in synergistic manner systems for advancing robotics and automation. The laboratory takes a broad approach of what constitutes good research and education, all measured by their industrial and social impact. The ongoing research spans from the applied to basic research. The output from the lab research ranges from ground-breaking papers to ground-breaking prototypes. The usual team of industrial partners, faculty members, postdoctoral fellows, graduate and undergraduate students creates unique opportunities for furtherance of the education, research and technology transfer goals. The contributions in the lab can span from developing core engineering techniques and theoretical analyses of robotic algorithms, to working closely with existing companies and health organization, to engaging in entrepreneurial activities. RMAL also welcomes inquiries from companies interested in participating in our research and development works as industrial members. The lab has pioneered the development and commercialization of Robot PbD (Programming by Demonstration).Learn more at: www.ryerson.ca/~rmalOpportunities: The opportunities provided to the programmer will include improving his/her real-time programming skills in Deep Learning and Computer vision; hardware and software design experience, potentially publications record, experimentation skills, teamwork capabilities, communication skills including documentation and presentation skills Additionally, the lab promotes entrepreneurship opportunities through Ryerson Digital Media Zone (DMZ) and Ryerson Entrepreneur Institute. The lab has catalyzed employment of former programmers and alumni in prestigious academic and industrial organizations.Job Description: An open position for a data scientist in Computer Vision and Machine Learning is available through NSERC funding. The project goal is development and commercialization of a Visual Learning System for Robot Programming by Demonstration. The leaning system employs a vision system for using machine learning (and in particular, deep learning) methods to estimate a 3D object pose capturing tasks demonstrated by a human expert. The project involves close collaborations with industrial partners.Responsibilities and Duties:Candidate will aid in the design, implementation, testing, and documentation of machine learning algorithms relevant to the project. The candidate is expected to contribute to the project for visual robotic learning from human demonstrations by improving the existing system developed in RMAL through coding and documentation of the algorithms. The candidate is expected to possess knowledge of machine learning and, in particular, Deep Learning algorithms in Linux using GPU. The ideal candidate should be highly motivated and dedicated to the project. He/she will be expected to work collaboratively with a postdoctoral fellow, and as a team, they will put efforts into commercialization of the developed software package for robotic visual learning.Ability to work independently, and in a teamKnowledge in Robotic Operating System (ROS) and C++ will be considered as advantageExperience in using OpenCV is an assetAbility to work in a team, serious, reliable and responsibleBenefits: The position will be for 12 months with the potential for extension, subject to satisfactory performance and availability of funding.Anticipated starting date is as soon as possible.Salary is competitive ($3,500-$5,000 a month) and depends on the previous experience of the candidate.Preference will be given to Canadian residents.RMAL is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information.For more information you may contact us at, https://www.ryerson.ca/~rmal/contact.htmJob Types: Full-time, Part-timeSalary: $42,000.00 to $60,000.00 /yearExperience:Programming in Python: 1 year (Required)Programming Deep Learning algorithms: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Required)Location:Toronto, ON (Preferred)Licence:Work permit (Required)Language:English (Required)

job_description: $100 an hourContractData Scientist- AML Analyst – SAS ExpertData scientist position supporting analytical and reporting activities of Anti Money Laundering and Economic Sanctions data for Consumer and Small Business. This position will help analyze and influence data-driven efforts required to identify and mitigate risks of high risk customers, products, and transactions to enable increased oversight and management of the portfolio. In addition, he/she will support Customer Due Diligence (CDD) and Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) processesTo perform this work, the person in this role will be required to understand key AML customer and transaction data to provide actionable intelligence to various levels of management - including senior management and risk leaders. As such, the analyst must be able to influence business partners through strong communication skills and an ability to “translate” business and analytics requirements.Specific duties for this position include, but are not limited to:Analyze and monitor unusual customer behaviorDevelop analytical methods to identify new customer types that require enhanced due diligence, as called out in the CDD StandardImprove false-positive rate through ongoing analysis of existing AML customer type logicResponsible for Basic CDD/Know Your Customer (KYC) analytics & reporting efforts to drive data qualityDrive Analytics Strategy levering new methodologies and emerging technologiesBuild strong partnerships and collaborate effectively with business, risk, and technology partnersSummarize and present analytical findings clearlyPresent results of analyses and recommendations to senior managementRequired Skills:Expertise and knoweldge in SASMust be proficient in R and PythonDegree in Analytics or at least 7 years of similar work experience in analytics driven fieldMust know Mantas or ActimizeAbility to interpret data and synthesize it into value-added information for leadersSelf-motivated with excellent follow-up, resolution, and able to work independentlyAccustomed to multi-tasking and manages time effectivelyDemonstrates strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively partner with senior leaders and build rapport with business partners and peersStrong organizational skills, detail-oriented, with drive towards continuous improvementJob Type: ContractSalary: $100.00 /hourExperience:SAS: 6 years (Required)Data Modeling: 4 years (Required)AML: 5 years (Required)Data Mining: 5 years (Required)Mantas: 2 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Required)Licence:SAS Certified Statistical Business Analyst Using SAS 9: Regression and Modeling (Required)

$52,284 a yearThe FILTER (Fipke Laboratory for Trace Elements Research) Coordinator position is essential for the technical operation and maintenance of the facility at UBC’s Okanagan Campus. The laboratory currently consists of a ThermoFisher Element XR ICP-MS, Photon Machines Analyte 193 Excimer Laser, ThermoFisher X2 Quadrupole ICP-MS, Cameca SX% EMP, Tescan Mira3 SMU SEM, AND A Thermo Fisher iCAP 6000 ICP-AES and other related equipment. This facility functions as a research and teaching resource for the Irving K Barber School of Arts and Sciences and the School of Engineering, as well as outside clients and other on-campus faculty.The incumbent is responsible for the technical operation and maintenance of the Electron Microscopy and Inductively Couple Plasma Mass Spectrometry instruments, providing qualitative and quantitate chemical and isotopic analysis, and preparing results in the form of reports for facility users and administration. The FILTER Coordinator is responsible for specifying, monitoring, modifying and maintaining laboratory infrastructure and services, including reconstruction and modification should reorganization to the facility be necessary.In addition, the incumbent ensures that the facility is operated and maintained according to appropriate safety rules and regulations and is required to provide the University administration with input and advice with respect to the purchase and upgrading of lab equipment. The FILTER Coordinator is an expert in their field and can independently perform highly skilled technical tasks with specialized analytical instrumentation.The position requires knowledge of the University of British Columbia financial management system for the purpose of ordering operational supplies and arranging service and repairs. The role holder will place orders and reconcile invoices.WORK PERFORMEDResponsible for the general operations and maintenance of the FILTER facility by: Develop operations policies and procedures to Position: Post-Doctoral FellowGroup: Photonics, University of TorontoOpportunity: The Photonics Group at the University of Toronto is currently seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral fellow to work on “Ultra Efficient Flexible Silicon Solar Cell Technology” project recently funded by the Ontario Research Foundation – Research Excellence (ORF-RE) Program. The program is led by Professor Nazir Kherani, Director of the Advanced Photovoltaics-Photonics and Devices (AP2D) Labs in the Departments of Electrical & Computer Engineering and Materials Science & Engineering, in collaboration with Professor Sajeev John of the Department of Physics, both at the University of Toronto.The candidate is required to have a strong background in silicon photovoltaics (preferably amorphous-crystalline silicon heterojunctions), photonic crystal fabrication using various patterning and etching methods, carrier selective contacts as well as hands-on experience in designing various tests and characterization techniques for surface passivation and other related parameters for solar cells. Candidate is also required to have practical knowledge of semiconductor device modelling (for example, Sentaurus, Silvaco) and photonic/optical modelling. PhD degree with expertise in more than one of the following disciplines is required: device physics, electrical engineering, optical physics, photonics, materials science, standard semiconductor fabrication methods and processes (including, plasma enhanced chemical vapour deposition of amorphous silicon), data analysis, and reporting.The postdoctoral fellow will join a team of researchers and graduate students at the University of Toronto. The research program also involves dynamic collaborations with engineers/scientists from multiple groups and industry partners (North America, Asia, and Europe).The successful candidate is expected to start in early 2019, and ideally no later than 1st of May 2019, His/her primary responsibility will be to accelerate the further development and optimization of in-house developed surface passivation techniques and incorporate these in the various thin solar cell structures. Additionally, the candidate is required to advance the fabrication of photonic crystals on large areas using various wet-etching methods and combine these with surface passivation techniques to fabricate the next generation of high-efficiency ultra-thin silicon photovoltaic devices. The candidate will apply problem-solving skills including the use of innovative approaches to translate the technology into practical devices. Further, the candidate is expected to exercise lateral out-of-the-box creativity for the production of novel/patentable/marketable ideas that will further enhance the objective of the development and deployment of next generation solar cells.Specifically, the candidate will:Facilitate the fabrication of and optimization of surface passivation techniques using a unique PECVD facility.Fabrication of various silicon photovoltaic device designs and their optimization thereof.Develop innovative solutions to further improve surface passivation and fabrication processes.Provide research planning and allied guidance to graduate students with experimental fabrication, simulation/modelling and testing of photovoltaic devices.Deliver clear and concise written and oral presentation of data, analysis, and internal/external reports – including preparation of high-quality manuscripts for publications.Collaborating with participating scientists and engineers, delivering and reporting on project progress, and receiving guidance on new directions and assignments.Assist with regular laboratory up-keep and management.Assist with various organizational activities including coordinating of regular research meetings, workshops, and conferences.Interested candidates are encouraged to send their CV, a brief statement of qualifications, 3 research samples, and 3 referees’ contact information to Professor Nazir P. Kherani.Job Type: Full-time

job_title: Intern opportunities for students: Data & Applied Sciences
job_description:
Data Scientists at Microsoft help to improve the quality of experiences on our devices and services. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate Data Scientists to apply rigorous scientific methodology and algorithms to data in order to improve Microsoft’s devices, operating systems, and services. As a Data Scientist, you will provide unique insight into business and customer scenarios that cut across organizational boundaries and lead the growth of a data-driven culture within Microsoft.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.
Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Data & Applied Sciences intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship or college student position, you need to be enrolled full-time as a student majoring in an applicable field.

Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, you will formulate approaches to solve problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources. You will incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data. Successful Data Scientists will interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.

You will engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers. As a Data Scientist, you will also engage in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Applied Sciences like Biostatistics, Physics, Chemistry, Computational Neurology and or other quant-focused field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc.
Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#.
Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS.
Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems.
Some A/B Testing or experimentation (this can be from conducting real life science experiments, hypothesis testing in stats etc.) Not required but ideal.
Some experience or course work applying basic ML to a type of data and or used algorithms to conduct experiments on data. Machine Learning strongly encouraged.
Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain.
Ability to interact with peers and stakeholders to drive product and business impact.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. We operate in more than 60 countries, employing around 60,000 people, with revenues of over $10 billion. We provide performance-driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets, including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear, and general industrial sectors. www.woodplc.com

job_title: Data Scientist, Product Intelligence (CBC Digital Products)
job_description:
Toronto, ONData Scientist, Product Intelligence (CBC Digital Products) - TOR06831


Job Family Media Production
Primary Location Toronto
Position Language Requirement English Only
Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) - - -
Status of Employment Permanent
Work schedule(s) Full-time


Description

CBC Digital Products is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team.

Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about.

The opportunity
At CBC Digital Products, we are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join our Digital Products team in Toronto - someone with strong mathematics knowledge and outstanding data engineering skills with a focus on cloud computing. Your mission is to help CBC increase audience engagement. You will be using your previous in-depth technical expertise in data management and technology to help improve the effectiveness of the CBC. You will find a collaborative environment where you can channel your passion for asking complex questions that require you to root through and dig deep into data to find the solutions, satisfying your curiosity and search for knowledge.

Who you are and where are you now?
This is an opportunity for a genuine scientist. Someone who generates hypotheses, follows a methodology, tests scenarios, meticulously documents results - and then does it all again. Someone with a passion for research, formulas and algorithms. And yet, a Data Scientist who has the confidence to take calculated risks, innovate and be creative; someone with outstanding communication skills. You have experience building an end to end data science pipeline from data collection to model deployment. Whether you are a recent grad with strong academic project experience or you have several years of experience in the field, joining us now is a chance to make an impact on the way Canadians access personalized news, information and entertainment content.

What’s in it for you?
Clear conscience. You will use your expertise to enhance the CBC personalized experience. Your work will be all about the Audience: understanding who they are, what they want and what they do not want. You will be the catalyst who improves targeted content making a positive impact on our user engagement.
Belonging. You will be part of the DMP Product Team that collects and organizes additional data points. You will influence the choice of cutting edge technologies and techniques used to reach the optimization objectives. You will collaborate with multiple stakeholders from across the organization to provide them with better insights about our audience, empowering them to make informed decisions.
Career growth. You will deepen your skills as you change the way we analyze and use our raw data and data models to further understand the millions of Canadians across the country that access our content. You will be given the opportunity to further develop through internal and external learning opportunities.
What our new Data Scientist will do:
Develop and deploy statistical, predictive and machine learning models for audience acquisition and retention.
Understand the user actions being stored in our Data Management Platform (DMP).
Recommend additional clickstream / behavioural data points to be captured.
Analyse both pre-classified and raw audience traits to identify patterns and insights.
Identify and implement addressable audience segments for content and ad targeting.
Identify content targeting opportunities on our audience facing products.
Measure and modify the impact of targeting on the optimization objective.
Qualifications

Why join us?
CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We strive to represent the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. Our values - collaboration, learning and continuous improvement- embody who we are as a people-focused, digital-forward employer. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with flexible schedules, an excellent benefits package; we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office.

Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression.

Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled. Our team members are given opportunities to learn and work cross-functionally across multiple projects.

Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. From prototyping new UI/UX to setting up dev environments to experiment on and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. Wherever your interests lie, your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.

What you bring:
The title - and the science behind it. You are a Data Scientist. You have used an open source data set to post something to github, bitbucket, or an open source contribution. You are continuously seeking answers to satisfy your curious nature. You want to break open data and build meaningful models or solutions with it.
The education. You have a Bachelor or Graduate Degree in a related field or relevant experience with a scientific background.
The knowledge. You have proven ability to engage data using programming languages and tools such as SQL, Python, and libraries like NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn in an integrated development environment. You know how to test results and models for accuracy.
The experience. You have hands-on exposure to cloud computing and data engineering.
The desire to learn. You can quickly learn new technologies and respond to change by adapting.
The communication and presentation skills. You have a deep understanding of your audience (both business and technical) and you can communicate effectively with them, providing the right amount of details. You know how to listen and relay empathy and understanding for diverse perspectives. You enthusiastically share knowledge and encourage others to do the same.
The confidence and the adaptability. You are comfortable working autonomously with a certain amount of ambiguity as you define your role. You can confidently discuss Glen Urban et al. “Morphing Banner Advertising”, Marketing Science (2013).
The creativity. You can adapt quickly, innovate and embrace the new. You enjoy taking calculated risks and testing theories.
The Agile experience. You believe in the Agile methodology and you are flexible and open to the real world twists and turns.
To apply:
Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. You can read about the various backgrounds the talented people that make up our team bring to us here.

Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here.

In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.
