company_name: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
job_description:
Job Number: 838522
Category: Research
Positions Available: 1
Years Experience Required: 3 years
Location: Toronto, Ontario
Posted Date: Mar 6, 2019
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Project Scientist
Clinical Research in Addictive Behaviors
Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is a dynamic, academically oriented hospital that promotes integration of research and clinical care. Fully affiliated with the University of Toronto, CAMH is Canada’s largest mental health research and teaching institute and a World Health Organization collaborating site. Research at CAMH aims to translate understanding of the causes of mental illness and addictions into more effective treatments.
The Biobehavioral Alcohol Research Lab is seeking a highly motivated Project Scientist to contribute to clinical, laboratory and epidemiology-based projects research focusing on etiological and clinical aspects of substance use disorders. Reporting to the Principal Investigator, the primary roles of the Project Scientist will be to assist in the management and coordination of ongoing research projects, contribute to the development, preparation and submission of funding applications to external agencies, and contribute to data analysis and publication efforts. The Scientist will have the opportunity to take a leadership role in mentoring trainees and research assistants. This is a full-time, contract position with an initial funding period of 12 months, with the opportunity for extension following the initial evaluation period. The position is based at the CAMH Queen Street site and will include occasional work at the CAMH Russell Street Site.
Qualifications
Requirements for this position include a Ph.D. in clinical, cognitive or health psychology (or a closely related discipline), plus the completion of three years’ post-doctoral training in an area of research related to addictive behaviors/substance use disorders. Of particular interest are applicants whose research experience and skill sets bridge at least two of the following domains of substance use research: clinical/intervention research, psychopharmacology/human laboratory research, neuroscience, epidemiological research. A demonstrated record of independent scientific productivity, as evidenced by a strong history of first-author, peer-reviewed publications, is required. Experience in leading or assisting with the development of funding applications is also required. 3 years’ experience conducting human subjects research is required. Applications that do not meet these primary requirements will not be considered.
Preferred qualifications include evidence of success in obtaining grant funding and strong writing skills. Proficiency in advanced statistical modeling (for example, structural equation modeling, growth mixture modeling, hierarchical linear modeling) is highly desirable. Clinically oriented training, including experience with clinical assessments, structured interviews (e.g., SCID), self-report-rating scales, personality inventories, and/or neuropsychological testing, is also desirable. The successful candidate will possess excellent attention to detail, strong communication, interpersonal and leadership skills, and a strong ability for self-directed learning and production of independent scholarly work. The successful applicant will also possess a track record of success in the independent design and management of research projects, including study conceptualization, management, and data collection. The ability to work effectively in a fast-paced research environment is essential, as is the ability to effectively lead and direct other project assistants and to collaborate effectively with a multidisciplinary research team. The successful applicant will be expected to support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and compiles with all applications and regulatory requirements. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated to obtain an independent scientist or faculty position within the next 3-5 years.
Please note: This full-time, contract (1 year) position is NOT part of any bargaining unit.
Salary Range: Competitive salary and a benefits package.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.
CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

Vancouver, BCJob Description Summary
As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be partnering with Department leaders to strengthen financial results, effectively manage STEMCELL’s financial assets and provide senior management with required information and analysis to make informed business decisions. This position will also responsible for supporting and enhancing key Financial Planning and Analysis processes with a focus on analysis, forecasting and reporting. You will leverage your experience and thorough understanding of structure and processes required for scalable and sustainable business support. This position is based at our West Pender office in Vancouver and reports to the Manager, Financial Planning and Analysis.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Prepare monthly financial reviews to analyze department results compare to Plan, Forecast and historical results, and proactively identifying opportunities for improvement
Develop and manage financial tools that provide visibility and transparency into department costs
Enhance Finance Planning and Analysis (FP&A) environment and support business units with analysis and forecasting activities
Identify, recommend and implement improvements to financial planning and management reporting processes, to align to global best practices
Align financial plans with key departmental business activities and drivers; promote finance knowledge
Develop and prepare relevant reporting that measures the performance of the department’s objectives, projects and initiatives
Apply previous / current experience and knowledge of best practices, lead development and rollout of training and other support materials tailored to the business user groups
Collect relevant information for monthly accounting close, forecast updates, and annual budgets byworking closely with the business units, and continuously driving improvements in the associated processes
Provide support for special projects including developing financial modeling and robust business analysis to highlight financial implications and support key decisions
Skills & Qualifications
Ideal candidate will have the following skills & qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in relevant field (finance, accounting, business); accounting or related professional designation
Previous experience in Biotech industry and Science background will be an asset
Minimum of 5+ years of relevant FP&A experience in a large, global organization
Demonstrated understanding of business processes, finance systems, and related financial controls and governance in support of policy and procedure development and implementation
Ability to quickly grasp and with minimal supervision address the implications of a full range of financial, business and economic issues in a rapidly changing environment
Technically savvy, able to quickly learn new systems, self-serve, drive automation in reporting and data preparation
Clear, concise, articulate, professional verbal and written reasoning and storytelling skills to communicate effectively to audiences at all levels of the organization
Comfortable conceptualizing and logically applying concepts to concrete user cases
Ability to translate previous experience into applications that fit the current organizational needs
Self-starter and active listener with a keen interest in and commitment to personal growth and continuous learning
Flexible, genuinely curious, and able to continuously adjust/adapt in order to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Experience with finance information systems projects; Project Management, Business Analysis, 6 Sigma, and/or other similar experience are assets
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.
To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

Winnipeg, MBWhat is Bold Commerce?
Bold Commerce is a software company located in Winnipeg, Manitoba. We specialize in groundbreaking eCommerce applications and tools. Some of our clients include Shopify, LA Lakers, Cirque du Soleil, The Chive (and many others). Bold is one of Manitoba’s fastest growing tech companies, with a unique company culture that encourages and rewards creativity. We’re looking for Builders, who are dedicated to doing an amazing job, who want to stretch the boundaries, who are eager to impress, and who thrive on standing out from the crowd.

What are Builders? Here at Bold, we live by the Bold Builders Code. The Code is our shared set of practices, beliefs and values that help to shape this amazing company. Each employee is a Builder, and we are all dedicated to growing Bold to be the biggest, best company it can be. We employ people who want to do their very best work for our customers, for their co-workers, for the company as a whole, and for their own personal satisfaction and growth. We believe in accountability to one-another, in innovation, in being transparent in everything we do, and in measuring success through results.

We offer an Employee Share Ownership Program, so that everyone in our company has a voice. Collaboration and teamwork are paramount at Bold, which is why we offer daily catered lunches for all employees, staff parties, and beer on tap!

The Bold team is looking for a full-time Machine Learning and AI Developer to join our Data and Research team. The ML/AI developer will work closely with Bold’s Data & Research Scientist to support and contribute to data projects. The ideal candidate will be an experienced programmer with SQL and Python experience. The candidate should also have a strong desire to learn new skills, particularly relating to analytics. Primary duties will include writing queries for analysis projects, and creating repeatable processes that support self-serve analytics of Product Teams. In addition, this role will be responsible for:
Working closely with our Developers to identify opportunities to improve our dataBuilding components of our data pipeline to enable analysis of many data sources
Prototyping and evaluating new data pipeline solutionsIntegrating 3rd party APIs with our data pipelineTranslating business questions into relevant queriesWriting and optimizing data queries for repeatable analysisWorking with Product Managers and App teams to ensure they have relevant data. This could involve procuring additional data, or ensuring that apps collect relevant data from inception In the future, this role might involve machine learning and other advanced data-processing techniques

We believe in providing our teams with a lot of responsibility and autonomy, so we offer a casual and fun work environment with flexible work hours.
Here’s what we need from you
Desire to get shit done
Belief in our core values
Post Secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent program and/or related work experience
2 - 5 years of relevant work experience SQLGoPython, R or another data processing language
Desire to both teach and learn about new technologies
Understanding of databases (MySQL, Neo4j)
Strong communication skills
Effective problem-solving skills
An understanding of how data analysis translates into business decisions
A strong grasp of GDPR and user privacy
Being a generally awesome human being. We want someone cool to work with. It makes the office a better place for everyone!
Other skills that will get you far
Experience with writing algorithms
Understanding of statistics
Experience with data analysis packages in Python (e.g., Scikit, Pandas)
Experience creating repeatable queries in Jupyter
Experience with JIRA & Confluence
Impress us with anything else you can do! Juggle knives, make a killer mixtape, or baking delicious pastries
At Bold, we work hard and we play hard! If you are a potential Builder and think you've got what it takes to be Bold, we encourage you to apply. We promise it will be a career like no other! What it means to be Bold.

We get a lot of applicants so we encourage you to do something that stands out. Go above & beyond when you apply so you don’t get lost in the mix. Talk about a cool project you’ve done, link to your github, or just impress us with your personality.

Show that you have what it takes to be Bold.

Insight is looking for a dynamic and driven Program Director to lead our Toronto Insight Artificial Intelligence Fellows Program. The program, an intensive 7-week fellowship, helps top quantitative researchers and software engineers located all over Canada to transition to careers in applied machine learning and machine learning research. Fellows from the Artificial Intelligence program have joined top teams in the last year, working with Canadian companies like Borealis AI, Scotiabank, Dessa, Layer6, Element AI, and many more in Silicon Valley, New York City, Boston, and Seattle. Insight's program helps Fellows to build on their existing expertise while learning industry best practices from our mentor companies and our network of 1600+ Insight alumni.

The Artificial Intelligence Program Director will be responsible for continuing to define and expand the Artificial Intelligence Program by bringing the best Fellows to Insight, providing an amazing fellowship experience, sourcing and onboarding new mentor companies in Toronto, and working with every Fellow to find a position that's right for them. To succeed in this role, you must be a proven leader, an excellent communicator, and have a background in machine learning/deep learning, the tech industry, and/or academia. The Program Director will work primarily with the Fellows in the Toronto Program, but will be on a collaborative team distributed across North America. While minimal travel is required, Program Directors often spend time at other Insight locations.

Responsibilities
----------------


Work directly with the program leadership to further define and expand Insight's Artificial Intelligence Program in Toronto.
Learn how the application of machine learning is evolving in Toronto, consulting with top teams to understand their current and future goals.
Oversee the progress of the AI program in Toronto, taking responsibility and action for any adjustments necessary to ensure success.
Lead by example to create a fun, positive atmosphere in which Fellows will thrive.
Facilitate Fellows self-directed learning of machine learning and deep learning tools and techniques while tackling innovative deep learning and engineering projects, pushing the boundaries of the field.
Drive recruiting strategies to attract outstanding and diverse candidates.
Share knowledge and expertise with the broader data community and Insight's alumni via blog posts and other social media, speaking at conferences, universities, or meetups, participating in hackathons, and/or publishing open-source software.
Build strong relationships with data scientists, AI researchers, software engineers, founders, and recruiters at mentor companies to establish trust, communicate expectations, and advocate for Fellows.

Skills and Experience
---------------------

Leadership: Whether you've managed a team of researchers, founded your own startup, or brought a new product to launch, you have demonstrated strong leadership and people management skills, and are comfortable planning, managing, and evaluating success. You're also eager for the challenges and opportunities that come with being part of a small, fast-growing team.

Communication: The AI Program Director will be the face of Insight in many forums, including: internal and external emails, website content, public speaking, interviewing, advocating for the program to potential mentor companies, advising Fellows, and facilitating group discussions and presentations. You should have excellent communication skills, including the ability to deliver thoughtful feedback.

Education/Background: You have a scientific or software engineering background and can effectively empathize with and work effectively with Fellows. Additionally, you have sufficient experience with deep learning to facilitate their self-directed learning and screen candidates who can succeed at Insight.

Insight has a strong commitment to diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. Hiring, promotion, and compensation of employees are conducted without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

Whitehorse, YTExplore a different kind of company - one that offers exciting challenges and fulfilling rewards. We provide world-class engineering and scientific solutions to our clients in the Mining, Energy, Transportation and Development sectors. Our people come from a wide range of backgrounds and fields of study. They represent the best in their respective disciplines and specializations. Together, they make it possible to assemble multidisciplinary teams that provide clients with a full-service approach to their unique needs.


From our roots (as EBA Engineering Consultants), and now Tetra Tech Canada, we have progressively expanded since our inception in 1966 and, today, clients are served by more than 1000 engineers, scientists, technologists, and support staff from offices across Canada. We are a values-based consulting engineering and sciences company that offers exciting challenges and fulfilling rewards to our employees. Since 2010, we are part of the Canadian family of Tetra Tech (NASDAQ: TTEK) companies, with over 16,000 employees worldwide.


We are currently looking for an Intermediate Hydrogeologist or Environmental Engineer to join our Whitehorse office. This position will work within our growing group of groundwater professionals working across Northern and Western Canada.
Responsibilities


As an Intermediate Hydrogeologist or Environmental Engineer, you will prepare project plans, supervise field teams, collect and analyze field data, communicate and coordinate with contractors, prepare reports, write proposals and build high quality service-based relationships with clients.
Assisting in managing work schedules, controlling budgets working within a multi-disciplinary team.


Qualifications

Minimum of 7 years related experience in the areas of physical and contaminant hydrogeology
Environmental consulting experience in groundwater source well design and installation, aquifer testing and analysis for estimation of hydraulic properties and potential yields and contaminated site assessment including monitoring well network design and installation, contaminant characterization and delineation and remediation action plan preparation
Experience on mining projects would be an asset
A minimum Bachelor’s degree in engineering or geosciences, a Master’s degree is preferred
Current standing (or eligibility to apply) as a P.Eng. with Engineers Yukon, or as a PGeo/PGeol in another Canadian province is a requirement.
Familiarity with territorial regulations, combined with a willingness and aptitude for project management and business development.
Strong work experience on field-based investigations in physical hydrogeology, contaminated site assessment and remediation, groundwater supply and hydrogeological assessments
Some mechanical aptitude would be an asset for trouble-shooting and problem solving equipment in the field.
Demonstrated competency in soil and rock sampling and geotechnical soil and core logging, drilling, test pitting, monitoring well installations, monitoring well investigations, water level and, water quality sampling and hydraulic response tests (e.g. slug, step, pumping and packer testing).
Experience in analyzing groundwater flow and aqueous chemistry data, and assessing contaminant behaviour in groundwater
Experience in analyzing and interpreting slug, step, pumping and packer test data and solving analytical equations for aquifer characterization, potential yield and plume migration.
Experience in hydrogeology related software AquiferTest or AQTESOLV, and familiarity with Surfer
Experience in numerical modelling and familiarity with MODFLOW and Seep/W will be considered as an asset.
Excellent communication skills; both oral and written including the quality to produce highly professional reports and proposals.
Travel will be required in this position, and candidates must be prepared to undertake field assignments, generally throughout western and northern Canada


Additional Information:


A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.)


To meet the physical demands required of some positions, candidates must be in good physical condition and willing to work in all weather conditions. Clearance on pre-placement medical and drug and alcohol testing may be required.
All qualified candidates will be considered for the role and will be eligible for relocation allowance if selected (and are located outside of Whitehorse).


Apply Now!


This is a permanent full-time, salaried position. We offer a great place to work, and an engaging culture that is based on innovation, collaboration and integrity. Our compensation plan includes a competitive salary with a comprehensive benefits package, and excellent opportunities for growth and advancement.


Online applications are preferred. Tetra Tech is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

To be considered for Research Affiliate Program (RAP) work opportunities, you must meet the following criteria:

Important messages
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.

The inventory will be updated every 60 days. You will receive a notice in your applicant account 10 days before the end of your active period to determine whether or not you wish to keep being considered for an additional 60 days.

As positions become available, the applicants included in this inventory may be contacted and referred for further assessment. Please ensure that your information is updated and remains current in your applicant account.

Should you be contacted for further consideration, the hiring manager will provide a copy of the complete 'Statement of Merit Criteria and Conditions of Employment' for the position being filled. You may be required at that time to provide additional information to be used for screening.

For further information on the Research Affiliate Program (RAP), please visit: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/recruitment/students/research-affiliate-program.html

Students working in Geological Survey of Canada labs and offices will be responsible for their own living expenses and accommodation.
Duties
Field work anywhere in Canada; Lab work and office work at Geological Survey of Canada offices in Dartmouth (NS), Quebec, Ottawa (ON), Calgary (AB), Vancouver, or Sidney (BC), and areas of the Yukon, British Columbia, North West Territories, and Nunavut for fieldwork, depending on the location of the Geological Survey of Canada supervisor.

Field-based: Much of the field work will be led by research scientists of the Geological Survey of Canada, commonly in partnership with territorial and/or provincial partners. Field seasons generally last 2 to 2.5 months, depending on weather conditions and climate. Accommodation is generally under canvas with rudimentary conveniences, hence a strong desire to experience and enjoy the outdoors is essential. The work itself commonly involves foot traverses, hence a high degree of physical fitness is required. Commonly helicopters and fixed wing aircraft are part of the daily routine. In some cases work may be ship-borne.

Other field work may be undertaken in areas where more infrastructure is available, mostly in southern Canada. Work conditions will be variable depending on local circumstances.

In general, undergraduate assistants assist the research team. Senior undergraduates may undertake work towards a BSc thesis. Graduate assistants are generally responsible for a specific body of research related to the outcomes of the program offering the assignment. Assistants with substantial GIS training will be required to maintain the field databases in some field camps.

Lab and Office based: Lab and office based assignments are variable. They could include geochronology, isotope, geochemistry, geophysics, remote predictive mapping, GIS and other support work.

In particular, projects will be seeking GIS support of all kinds at various levels of proficiency. This may include cartography, image analysis and interpretation, database construction, and data management and interpretation.
Work environment
At Natural Resources Canada, a Federal government job means developing leadership skills, fostering teamwork, and supporting creativity and innovation. We know it takes people from diverse pools of talent to make this happen. That is why we are looking for people like you.

The Geological Survey of Canada is a part of the Lands and Minerals Sector of Natural Resources Canada. It is Canada's premier agency for geoscientific information and research, with world-class expertise focusing on geoscience surveys, sustainable development of Canada's resources, environmental protection, and technology innovation by acquiring, interpreting and disseminating geoscience information concerning Canada's landmass, including the offshore.
Intent of the process
This inventory may be used to staff various full-time and part-time positions in the Research Affiliate Program within Natural Resources Canada in the Lands and Minerals Sector with various language requirements, various qualifications and conditions of employment and for various locations.
Positions to be filled: 15
Information you must provide
Your résumé.

You must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. Other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. Some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. It is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. Failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
Registered in an accredited post-secondary institution and recognized as having full-time status by the academic institution.
Degree equivalency

The following courses and/or programs must have been completed in a recognized post-secondary institution:
Enrolled as a full-time student in an undergraduate program.Enrolled as a full-time student in a Master's program.Enrolled as a full-time student in a PhD program.Graduation with a Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Geoscience.Successful completion of courses in environmental science or environmental technologies.Successful completion of courses in geology or earth science.Successful completion of courses in structural geology, bedrock geology, surficial geology or geomorphology.Successful completion of courses in sedimentology such as clastic, carbonate or fluvial.Successful completion of courses in hydrogeology.Successful completion of courses in hydrocarbon systems.Successful completion of courses in geochemistry or geophysics.
Degree equivalency

Speak or understand an Indigenous language.
License(s) and/or training such as lab safety, WFA, wilderness survival, WHMIS, First Aid, water safety, driver’s licence, PAL, ATV, boating, small engine repair, prospector’s licence, heavy equipment operator, predator defence, helicopter safety).

Vancouver, BCSTEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. job_title: Senior Aseptic Technique Engineer, Product Engineering - (Toronto)

Finn AI is an award-winning, AI-powered virtual assistant built for personal banking and finance. We put a personal banker in every bank customer’s pocket, helping them to manage their money wherever they are, whatever they need - via a simple, natural conversation.

The Food Scientist operates as a key team member to support business initiatives and drive profitability for the organization. As such they are responsible for:
Developing new products and line extensions to meet internal and external customer specifications and company requirements
Leading the development of product optimization projects including ingredient consolidation, product line rationalization and cost reduction projects
Leading the product development process through:
gold standard development
formulation development
bench top testing
sensory evaluation
sample preparation
customer presentation
Setting up and maintaining product formulations and creating product specifications
Initiating the specification approval process, gathering required information from suppliers
Facilitating the commercialization process by working with Manufacturing to conduct line testing and ensure recipe, specifications, and process settings are followed by the Production team
Supporting the product improvement process by leading product evaluations, collecting, interpreting and communicating data
Providing technical support &/or training to Marketing & Sales and other stakeholders on issues pertaining to product composition, preparation and conformance as requested/required during customer calls/presentations, product cuttings, etc.
Preparing presentations for assigned marketing business units bringing forward new trends & innovative new product ideas and leading innovation sessions with internal stakeholders
Working closely with our suppliers to deliver new products and product optimized products on time, within cost and quality
Participating and leading customer presentation meetings
Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Food Science or related field, or equivalent experience within the food industry, preferably seafood-related
Minimum five years’ experience in product formulation/development within the food industry, with knowledge of nutrition, ingredient functionality and processing techniques
Project Management competency
Self-motivated, with ability to work independently under minimal supervision
Must be able to participate in team-based project management and product development activities
Knowledge of sensory evaluation

Working conditions
The position involves daily or frequent contact with satellite R&D groups, operations, business channel managers, sales, procurement, purchasing, regulatory, and quality assurance managers. It also involves external contact with suppliers. The position requires travel, domestically and internationally.
Physical requirements/Allergens

Kitchener, ONAccount Executive (Technical Sales)
Sales & Marketing

Job Description

Position: Account Executive - Full-time
Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Experience: 2-5 years of sales experience
Education: College Diploma or Undergraduate Degree Preferably in Science and/or Sales/Marketing/Business

About Us:

Nicoya’s mission is to extend human life by enabling a deeper knowledge of the biological world. We are based in Kitchener, Ontario - Canada's Silicon Valley. Our main product OpenSPR, is a scientific instrument for the biotechnology research and development industry. It provides detailed information on molecular interactions using optical nanosensor technology known as localized surface plasmon resonance. It is the most affordable SPR instrument on the market and will disrupt an industry that has been primarily dominated by highly expensive and complex instrumentation.

About the Job:

We are looking for a passionate and coachable individual who has a desire to be part of a growing early stage company. At Nicoya, we love to work hard and play hard. Our team is expanding and we need more talented people to join our mission! We are looking for an energetic and driven account executive to help ramp up sales of OpenSPR. Don’t be fooled though, this isn’t your average sales position. We are looking for an educator. Our ideal candidate has a combined science and business background and 2-5 years of experience in a sales or customer service role. Our ideal candidate will have experience selling a technical, scientific piece of equipment to academic labs, government labs, and businesses, but candidates with all levels of experience will be considered.

Who you are:

You love a challenge and you’re a life-long learner. You want to provide researchers with tools that will make research simple for them and help them get the data they need to make a difference in the world. You love stepping out of the comfort zone while also keeping track of your day-to-day tasks. You want to be a part of a thriving small team and you have great communication skills. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging problems. You’re a quick learner and you know when to move on from something when it isn’t working. You are looking to grow your career at an exciting biotech company!

Duties:

Close qualified deals for the OpenSPR product
Aggressively work through entire sales process (sale to purchase order) to exceed revenue targets and maintain a healthy pipeline
Work with SDR team to streamline lead transition process
Make smarketing a priority - collaborate with marketing department on projects and goals
Manage and update the CRM database - take accountability for your numbers
Contact leads via phone and email, perform web demonstrations and presentations (in-person occasionally)
Research and build new accounts (i.e.sending emails, strategic calling, LinkedIn)
Travel to local and exciting places! Represent Nicoya at international conferences and product shows
Collaborate with sales director & CEO to research and evaluate new markets and business opportunities, prospect for new leads
Work with Customer Success Scientist team - contribute to a successful buyer's journey
Achieve monthly quotas of closed sales
Understand our customers' research and apply SPR to their unique research area
Our Ideal Candidate Has:

Excellent communication and customer relation skills
Able to operate with minimal direction and supervision
Hard working, enthusiastic, and outgoing
Loves challenges and is motivated by numbers
Formal training in science, biotechnology, Lifesciences, chemistry, materials science, or related fields
Previous experience in an academic or industrial research or development setting
Previous experience in a sales role for scientific instruments or other technical products is a plus
Experience with CRM software
If we've described you, we’d love to hear from you! Please apply directly through this portal to the attention of Tijana Matovic. Applications that do not exist in the portal will not be considered.

job_title: Le Scientifique Du Langage - Speech Scientist
job_description:
Company Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Chez Nuance, nous donnons aux gens la possibilité d'interagir naturellement avec leurs divers appareils connectés et le monde numérique autour d'eux. Nous créons un monde où la technologie pense et agit de la façon dont les humains le font en concevant des modes d'interaction avec la technologie plus intuitifs.

Notre technologie agile utilise des analyses et des algorithmes avancés pour transformer l'inanimé en animé et transformer des processus complexes en processus simples.

Joignez-vous à notre équipe mobile ... où les systèmes intelligents sont maintenant prêts pour la route. Nous sommes passionnés par le développement d'interfaces intelligentes qui permettent aux gens de parler à leurs voitures, leurs téléphones et tous autres appareils intelligents.

At Nuance, we empower people with the ability to seamlessly interact with their connected devices and the digital world around them. We are creating a world where technology thinks and acts the way people do by designing the most human, natural, and intuitive ways of interacting with technology.

Our nimble technology uses analytics and advanced algorithms to transform the inanimate into animate and reduce complicated processes into simple ones.

Join our Mobile team…intelligent systems now ready for the road. We are passionate about developing intelligent interfaces that enable people to talk to their cars, phones, devices, and other smart “things”.
Job Summary / Sommaire du poste:
*English will follow *

Le scientifique du langage travaillera auprès d’équipes de projet des Services professionnels automobiles qui intègrent et livrent les produits de reconnaissance de la parole et de conversion de texte par synthèse vocale de pointe de Nuance aux plateformes intégrées des principaux constructeurs automobiles. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec nos équipes d’intégration clientèle pour les aider à inclure les technologies de Nuance dans les produits de manière efficiente et fructueuse. Vous serez responsable de l’analyse de rendement de la reconnaissance vocale automatique (RVA) et de la compréhension des langues naturelles (CLN) ainsi que de l’optimisation des systèmes de reconnaissance intégrés et infonuagiques. Vous travaillerez directement avec les membres de l’équipe de projet et le personnel technique du client.
Travailler avec les équipes de projet internes et les clients finaux pour assurer le meilleur rendement possible au chapitre de la reconnaissance vocale et de l’expérience utilisateur dans les systèmes déployés;Analyser le rendement du système de reconnaissance; déterminer les domaines où le rendement est insuffisant; optimiser les processus en améliorant les grammaires, les modèles sémantiques statistiques et les configurations de reconnaissance;Fournir les résultats et les recommandations de l’analyse aux équipes internes et à nos clients;Élaborer des méthodologies, des scripts et des procédures qui amélioreront l’efficience et la qualité;Définir les plans de mise à l’essai des systèmes de reconnaissance et les rapports de mise à l’essai des clients;Travailler avec les spécialistes langagiers si nécessaire pour résoudre les questions ou problèmes liés à la langue;Fournir de l’information sur la conception des versions de produits futures, en collaborant avec l’équipe de produits, de R et D et avec d’autres groupes.

Études : Baccalauréat ou diplôme d’études supérieures en ingénierie électrique, ingénierie informatique, sciences informatiques, linguistique informatique ou dans un domaine équivalent.
Années d’expérience au minimum : Au moins deux ans d’expérience.

Compétences requises :
Expérience éprouvée de la reconnaissance vocale des langues naturelles (vocabulaire étendu);Solides aptitudes de programmation et maîtrise d’au moins un langage script (Python, Perl);Quête inhérente de perfection et de créativité;Capacité de réflexion à la fois technique et créative pour aider à résoudre des problèmes techniques complexes;Excellentes aptitudes de communication écrite et verbale en anglais et sens de l’organisation;Capacité à déterminer, à trier et à régler les problèmes de reconnaissance soulevés par les clients;Grande indépendance et capacité à remplir simultanément des engagements multiples en matière de projets;Capacité à bien travailler en équipe et dans un milieu où les activités se déroulent à un rythme rapide;Initiative et persévérance afin d’obtenir des résultats de haute qualité.

Compétences privilégiées :
Le candidat idéal possède également les qualités suivantes :
Maîtrise d’une deuxième langue (langues européennes ou asiatiques);Connaissance d’un processus de développement de logiciel (p. ex. Agile);
Expérience en sciences des données ou dans un domaine connexe;Expérience en linguistique;Connaissance des algorithmes de l’apprentissage machine.

-
The Speech Scientist will work in Automotive Professional Services project teams that integrate and deliver Nuance state-of-the-art speech recognition and text-to-speech products to embedded platforms for major automotive companies. You will be closely working together with our customers’ integration teams to help them include Nuance technologies into successful products in an efficient way. As a Speech Scientist in the Professional Services team, you will be responsible for ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition) and NLU (Natural Language Understanding) performance analysis and optimization of embedded and cloud recognition systems. You will work directly with members of the project team and customer technical staff
Work with internal project teams and end customers to ensure best possible recognition performance and user experience in deployed systemsAnalyze recognition system performance; identify areas of underperformance, and optimize by improving grammars, statistical semantic models, and recognition configurations.Deliver analysis results and recommendations to internal teams and our customers.Develop methodologies, scripts, procedures that improve efficiency and qualityDefine recognition system test plans and customer facing test reportsWork with language specialists as necessary to resolve language dependent questions or issuesProvide input into the design of future product releases, working with Product, R&D, and other groups

Education: Bachelors or Graduate University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Computational Linguistics or equivalent
Minimum years of work experience: 2 years + of experience

Required skills:
Demonstrated experience in large vocabulary natural language speech recognitionStrong programming skills with fluency in one or more scripting languages (Python, Perl).An inherent drive for perfection and creativityAbility to think both technically and creatively to help solve challenging technical problemsExcellent written and verbal English communications skills and well organizedAbility to qualify, triage, and resolve recognition issues raised by customersHighly independent and capable of fulfilling multiple project commitments concurrentlyWork well in team settings in fast-paced environmentInitiative and perseverance to deliver high quality work

Preferred skills:
Strong candidates will also have the following:
Fluency in a second European or Asian language(s)Knowledge of a software development process (e.g. Agile)
Experience in Data Science, or related fieldsExperience with linguisticsKnowledge of machine learning algorithms
Additional Information / Informations additionnelles:
In Montreal:
What we offer !
Unique environment for collaborative teamwork on cutting-edge technology:
Location is in the heart of downtown
Flexible hours
Transit reimbursement and parking
Contributing to and collaborating with international teams that drive innovation
Competitive benefit package:
4 weeks’ vacation
10 paid sick days
Bonus Plan, Group RRSP, Deferred Profit Sharing Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Award-winning Top Employer:
Canada's Top 100 Employers – 7 consecutive years
Montreal’s Top Employers – 6 consecutive years
Canada's Top Employers for Young People - 3 consecutive years

Ce que nous offrons!
Un environnement unique et collaboratif où vous travaillez avec les technologies de pointe :
Situé au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
Horaire flexible
Allocation de transport en commun et de stationnement
Travail de concert avec des équipes à l’international afin de repousser les limites de l’innovation

4 semaines de vacances
10 congés de maladies payés
Régime de bonus annuel, REER collectif, Régimes de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB), Régime de rachat d’action pour les employés

Toronto, ON161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,
At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.
Data Scientist
At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.
As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in distributed computing technologies and operating across billions and billions of customer transactions to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time, and agony in their financial lives.
On any given day, you’ll be:
Writing software to clean and investigate large, messy data sets of numerical and textual data
Integrating with internal and external data sources and APIs to discover interesting trends
Building machine learning models (Linear and Logistic regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, etc.) from development, validation, through to deployment in production
Designing rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to customers or company leaders
Investigating the impact of new technologies on the future of digital banking and the financial world of tomorrow
The Ideal Candidate will be:
Curious: You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You probably know Python, Scala, or R and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.
A Wrangler: You know how to programmatically extract data from a database and an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and model it into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, d3 visualization, Tableau, etc.).
Creative: Big, undefined problems and petabytes of data don't frighten you. You’re used to working with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in unmined territories.
Proactive: You will want to share your knowledge with your peers and contribute back to inner/open source projects which you might consume.
Benefits
Your choice of hardware - latest MacBook Pro or HP EliteBook and all the monitors you want!
Travel to a conference of your choice annually (senior+) - PyCon, PyData, AWS re:Invent, KDD, etc.
$5000/yr education budget
Flexible work hours, dress code and environment
Twenty-five years after Capital One was started it’s still led by its founder. Be ready to join a community of the smartest people you’ve ever met, who see the customer first, and want to use their data skills to make a difference.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field
At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis (Python, R, or Scala)
At least 1 year of experience with version control system like Git and GitHub.
At least 1 year of experience with machine learning or predictive modeling (scikit-learn, H2O, xgboost, or TensorFlow)
At least 1 year of experience with relational databases (Postgres, Redshift, MySQL) and programming in SQL
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree or PhD
Experience working with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.)
Experience working with advanced Git Workflows (Pull Requests, Code Reviews, Issues, and Branching)
Experience writing unit tests and integrating with CICD tools (Jenkins, CircleCI, etc.)
At least 3 years’ experience in Python or R
At least 3 years’ experience with machine learning / predictive modeling (scikit-learn, H2O, xgboost, TensorFlow, etc.)
At least 3 years’ experience with SQL

Toronto, ONThe Vector Institute is seeking a talented and experienced VP of AI Engineering to lead our engineering and staff scientist team working alongside machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other AI researchers and on applications projects working with a growing number of sponsor companies and partner organizations in academia, industry, healthcare, and government.
PROFILE OF IDEAL CANDIDATE
You are a strong technical visionary, comfortable with and respected by scientists and business leaders, with extensive experience managing groups of highly skilled individual contributors. A results-driven, customer-centric thinker, you deliver operationally-efficient, cost-effective and innovative technology services and solutions to the research institute.
You have a track record of setting budgets and timelines that are met and are constantly on the lookout for ways to further improve technical processes and adoption of new technology, within the budgets and committed timelines. You are familiar with and have a track record of achieving compliance with audit-friendly processes and highly effective security practices. You are a pragmatic resource manager with appreciation for the expediency needed for agile prototype experimentation and dependable artifact maintenance.
An effective team leader, with demonstrated group facilitation and presentation skills, you have a knack for inspiring highly qualified diverse technical staff to work together on common goals and are a developer of people who successfully meet business and professional developmental objectives.
You have experience in start-ups, especially at the early stages of staffing and organizing a software R&D team from scratch, and with cloud-computing based software development or service offerings.
You are likely currently a VP or Director of Engineering in a small to medium sized software technology firm using data analytics or machine learning, or a project lead or senior manager in a large information technology firm developing algorithms or machine learning tools or workflow systems, who is ready for and looking for exactly this kind of exciting opportunity to play a key leadership role in contributing to Vector’s success in helping Ontario and Canada realize the potential of machine learning.
Reporting to the President and CEO of the Vector Institute, you are a member of the senior leadership team and in this key role you will contribute to Vector’s success in realizing our vision, mission, and strategic objectives.
SELECT KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Scope out and staff for Vector’s cutting-edge AI developments, transfer AI technology to sponsor and partner organizations and operate a leadership class machine learning computing facility;
Execute on and ensure successful completion of projects, AI developments, technology transfers to sponsor and partner organizations, and AI computing facility initiatives on time and within budget;
Effectively build and lead a diverse team of highly skilled technical staff who are engaged and who deliver on commitments to researchers, sponsors, and partners;
Manage a portfolio which includes prototype, platform and infrastructure software development, upskilling developers and researchers on recent open source and proprietary AI system developments, R&D support services for small and large projects with researchers and/or partner professionals, and procurement and operations of large-scale computer clusters with hybrid utilization of cloud computing services;
Act as a trusted and credible spokesperson for Vector, performing public speaking engagements on behalf of Vector on AI technologies, Vector’s accomplishments and directions;
Recognize, capture and develop intellectual property for the benefit of its inventors, Vector resources & partner organizations; and
Perform other technical and leadership functions, as requested by the CEO, which contribute to Vector achieving its vision, mission, and strategic objectives.
KEY SUCCESS MEASURES


The Engineering team at Vector is fully staffed, effective, and successful in fulfilling commitments to our stakeholders
Internal and external clients understand and are proficient achieving conditions and expectations under which the engineering team can be expected to succeed
Budgetary and other commitments are respected and delivered on
Qualitative client feedback on projects assigned by Industry, Academic, Healthcare, and Research leaders at Vector is uniformly positive and reflective of great value provided
Overall allocation of technical resources by portfolio (Academic, Healthcare, Industry, and Research) is appropriate and in line with guidance provided
Vector sponsors renew sponsorship agreements expressing positive feedback on AI projects and teams
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE


You have a PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent field and/or many years of technical leadership in R&D for innovative information technology software firms, and more recently, machine learning applications for AI industry labs
You are a highly effective communicator and relationship manager with demonstrated proficiency in collaborating successfully with diverse stakeholders.
You are familiar with the operations, design, utility and weaknesses in the popular ML/DL/RL systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, Scikit, Matlab, R and popular analytics systems such as Tableau, Spark and Hadoop, and with popular cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenStack
You have proven experience with open source development, community decision-making, project management, maintenance, and encouraging deployment of large software artifacts, especially ML/DL/RL/AI cutting-edge systems
You have strong direct, if not necessarily recent, programming experience in modern languages such as Python, Rust, Scala, C++ and Linux shell scripts
You have experience in start-ups, especially in the early stages of staffing and organizing a software R&D team from scratch
You have experience in leading, funding or collaborating with academic research projects, graduate student interns, or university sponsored research
You have strong time management and organizational skills
You have experience inventing or commercializing intellectual property
You are comfortable working with a diverse range of clients (e.g., leadership teams, operations staff, graduate students, and external partners), maintaining confidentiality and providing all with a trusted, respectful point of contact
You possess a positive attitude, integrity, a sense of humour, and bring a positive energy and outlook to a not-for-profit corporate culture
You are motivated by continuous learning and the opportunity to make a difference and a real contribution to the AI ecosystem
Please address applications to Kailyn Burke, Assistant Talent Specialist. We thank all applicants for their interest in this exciting opportunity and will be in touch with those whose qualifications most closely match with our needs.

We provide services in environmental site assessment (ESA), remediation, reclamation, spill response, liability assessment, environmental auditing, GIS, regulatory advisory, and facility decommissioning. Our Vision is to be the most respected specialized environmental consulting firm in Western Canada and our Mission is to be safe and be the best. Our Core Values are safety, excellence, and balance.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Due to continued growth, we are seeking an Intermediate Environmental Scientist based out of our Calgary, Alberta office.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITY
Project manage and lead field work relating to Phase 1 and Phase 2 ESAs, groundwater monitoring, and soil and groundwater remediation projects.
Manage the use of assessment and remediation contractors.

Participate in, and coordinate, field-based projects (primarily in Central and Southern Alberta).
Foster relationships with clients and manage a portfolio for key clients.
YOUR PROFILE
University degree(s) in environmental science.
Eligible for membership as a Professional Agrologist (P.Ag.), Professional Engineer (P.Eng.), Professional Geologist or Hydrogeologist (P.Geol.), Professional Biologist (P.Biol.), Professional Forester (RPF), or other relevant professional association.
A Master’s degree and agricultural background are considered assets; however, not required.
An enthusiastic attitude, ability to multi-task, and a passion for consistently delivering outstanding work.
An eagerness to work with a dynamic team and a growth oriented company.
Reclamation experience is an asset and could be part of the position, if reclamation is an interest.
For further information or to apply, quote position no. CAN-AB-CAL-0100-28 and email your resume to info@traceassociates.ca. We thank all those who apply; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Toronto, ONFreshBooks has an ambitious vision. We launched in 2003 but we're just getting started and there's a lot left to do. We're a high-performing team working towards a common goal: building an elite online accounting application to help small businesses better handle their finances. Known for extraordinary product and customer service experiences and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries.

The Opportunity – Data Analyst, Digital Acquisition

The Analyst will enable FreshBooks to derive insights from website, event, campaign and customer interaction data to improve the volume and quality of trial customers. Most of our customers start their experience on our website, and we need to understand how they found us, and optimize that journey.

The right person for the job will love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with managers and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.

What you'll do:

Complete regular ad-hoc analyses by translating raw data into useable information and insights:
Conduct A/B testing for campaign treatments
Content / Webpage reviews and analyses
GTM tagging, maintenance and general organization
Changes in usage behaviors (organically and due to marketing)
Profiling and trending of customer segments
Cohort based investigations tied to performance gains and losses
Channel level reporting on trends in acquisition performance
Performance evaluations of various trial customer segments
Consult with internal clients to gather requirements, scope & execute:
Dashboards for core performance metrics / KPI's
Complex, long-term analyses on visitor trends and performance impacts
Communicate results and recommended analyses / approaches to stakeholders
Assist with forecasting, finance and strategic planning

What you bring:

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL or Python (both is a strong asset)
Minimum 2-3 years in data analytics, business intelligence or finance related roles
Knowledge of Google Analytics, Data Studio and / or a similar web analytics tools
Experience in forecasting and results projections
Excellent Excel, Sheets or related tools for ad-hoc analysis assembly
Experience using a dashboarding tool such as Periscope, Tableau, Looker etc
Quantitative background with strong analytical skillset
Experience in calculating and tracking website and acquisition KPI's
CAC, CAC payback, CPT, CPA, Conversion %

Why Join Us

We're a motivated bunch, with our eyes laser-focused on shipping extraordinary experiences to businesses. You will be surrounded by hardworking team members who share a common vision for what an amazing software company could be, and have the opportunity to help build an elite one, right here in downtown Toronto.

Apply Now

Have we got your attention? Submit your application today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch with you shortly!

FreshBooks is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, religion, race, mental disability, sexual orientation, age, or any other status. All applicants are considered based on their qualifications and merits. At FreshBooks, we inspire an environment of mutual respect and we believe diversity and inclusion are crucial to our success.

job_title: Post Doctoral Fellow / Research Associate - Immunology
job_description:
Hamilton, ONTurnstone Biologics is a clinical-stage, immuno-oncology company focused on the development of next-generation oncolytic viral immunotherapies for patients with a broad range of solid tumors. Turnstone’s unique, first-in-class oncolytic viral immunotherapies harness anti-tumor immunity by combining the potent tumor-killing effects of an oncolytic virus with a tumor-targeted T-cell vaccine. Our robust pipeline of early-stage biologics, based on our MG1 oncolytic virus platform, are in development for multiple solid tumors and are being evaluated in combination with other immunotherapies, including checkpoint inhibitors, to drive unprecedented, durable T-cell immune responses. Turnstone continues to build a world-class, high-performing company that embraces being a learning organization with a sense of urgency. Turnstone has a seasoned board of directors and venture capital partners, and highly active R&D efforts led by a world-class scientific management team. Turnstone is co-located in Ottawa, and Hamilton, Canada and New York, USA.
Position Overview:
Under the direction of the Sr. Scientist in Hamilton, the Post-Doctoral Fellow/Research Associate will play key roles in the design, execution, and analysis of experiments to further the development of Turnstone Biologics’ growing pipeline. This is an exciting opportunity to work along side senior researchers and project teams to perform discovery and development research that will ultimately inform clinical development.
Our company’s technology is based around replicating oncolytic virus vaccines engineered to target tumours and launch massive tumour targeting immune responses. Your role will be to join a dynamic team of immunologists and molecular biologists who strive to further understand, and improve, the oncolytic vaccine platform. If you are interested in translating your immunology/oncology experience into next-generation cancer therapies, and are meticulous and driven to achieve; then this opportunity may be just what you are looking for.
Responsibilities:
Lead various aspects of in vitro and in vivo studies including but not limited to: organizing teams, scheduling and executing experiments, collecting, interpreting and communicating results
Prepare data/figures to present to senior research staff
Generate study reports in a timely manner
Contribute to a team-centric culture that embraces scientific excellence, integrity, and urgency
Qualifications & Experience:
PhD in immunology/biology/oncology or related field, with 0-2 years experience in an academic or industrial laboratory
Robust understanding of innate and adaptive immune system is required
Hands-on experience using multi-colour flow cytometry to assess T cell phenotype/function/activation
Experienced in mammalian cell culture. Work with viruses or other BSL-2 agents is preferrable
Working knowledge of common molecular techniques is an asset (e.g. PCR, western blot, sequencing)
Must have good analytical and problem-solving abilities
Self-starter with a strong work ethic, and attention to detail
Ability to quickly adapt to shifting priorities
Knowledge and experience with standard software (e.g. FlowJo, Microsoft Office Suite, Graphpad Prism)
Knowledge and commitment to Occupational Health and Safety Procedures in a laboratory
Turnstone Biologics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected will be invited for an interview.

Vancouver, BCJob Description Summary
As a member of the Customer Success Team, the Customer Success Associate successfully supports STEMSOFT clients through their software implementation and supports clients in production while collaborating with our multidisciplinary team. This role executes training and technical projects to support clients and STEMSOFT customer success operations and facilitates tier 1 support.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
As a member of the Customer success team you will be accountable to your teammates in Product and Customer Success, working to support and advocate for our clients. You will:
Deliver live, online training programs following a script
Create, review and import customer configuration under the supervision of a Customer Success Manager or Consulting Subject Matter expert
Take the lead in process improvement projects and work with the customer success team to implement changes
Filter support calls and provide basic support and troubleshooting, routing and escalating issues to tier 2 support as needed.
Resolve operational concerns through collaboration with upstream and downstream colleagues including clients, client IT, corporate IT, external partners, Product and Customer Success teammates.
Contribute to the steady improvement of our existing service offerings
Collaborate with the other members of the team to provide just enough documentation to support the operational need
Attend and contribute to meetings including standup, retrospective, and iteration planning
Document tasks, cases, project activities, and billable hours using STEMSOFT customer success CRM and ECM systems.
Focus on consistently delivering functional services to the standards we expect
Raise and remove impediments raised by the team and department
Adhere to the practices and principles the team and department have committed to
Ensure deliverables meet the acceptance criteria given
Help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them
Assist in and support the delivery of our products and services to our customers
Help the team improve their skillsets and understanding in areas where you have particular expertise
Troubleshoot production issues to address technical commitments and boost sustainability
Where required, consent to a background check before accessing patient data
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
The qualifications of the Customer Success Associate include:
Degree in Medical laboratory technology, Biology, or equivalent experience
Possession of excellent analytical and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
Strong work ethic and excellent interpersonal skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to solve problems under time pressure with frequent interruptions, and work effectively in a variety of roles with both technical and non-technical individuals
Passion for quality, end-user satisfaction, and continuous improvement
Curiosity about healthcare, cell therapy, and biological manufacturing
Proficient in Excel, Word and PowerPoint or Google Suite
Desire to work on something that makes a meaningful contribution to people's lives
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.
To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

Plastic Mobile is a digital firm dedicated to helping our clients create and launch successful mobile experiences.
