Are you obsessed with building world class shopping experiences that delight customers? Do you want to reinvent the end-to-end shopping experience for reorders, from front-end to supply chain and everything in between? If so, come join us as Software Development Engineer to build an innovative consumer experience from the ground up.

We are looking for a passionate and innovative Software Development Engineer who loves solving hard problems to be a part of a highly skilled team in building up services and front end experiences that make reordering easier at Amazon.

Our technical challenges involve a combination of back-end software engineering, user interface development, and applied science. As a software engineer on the team:

You will build a customer facing product across the whole software development life cycle from ground-up in an entrepreneurial, start-up like environment
You will design and build distributed systems, building front end applications and backend services that can scale to millions of requests and deployed globally delivering an exceptional customer experience.
You will build software that scales effortlessly, has low latency, is robust and extensible.
You will work with cross-functional teams including UI/UX designers, machine learning scientists, product managers, and other software engineers.

Toronto, ONWhat We Are Building:
At Rubikloud, we are on a mission to bring “Intelligent Decision Automation” to the world’s largest enterprise retailers. Our platform unifies the latest in distributed systems, artificial intelligence, cloud architecture and some of the brightest minds to fulfill our mission. Over the past three years, we have been able to connect with over 150,000 retail point of sales location in 10 countries and create a database of over $100 billion in first party retail transactional data. And the numbers are only growing!
Who we are looking for:

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our team. Reporting into VP of People and partnering closely with the rest of the organization, you are someone who loves creating and building meaningful relationships.
What You Will Do:
Full cycle sourcing and recruitment in both technical and non-technical areas across product development discipline including but not limited to: Product Managers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Engineers.
Own the candidate experience from initial engagement to interview coordination to offer.
Develop and foster strong relationships with hiring managers and interviewers to understand hiring requirements and gaps.
Build a balance between active hiring and pipelining across the Product discipline.
Evolve our recruitment offering, capture the authentic employee experience to aid in growing our brand, and coach hiring managers on recruitment best practices.
Be a career coach for the internal and external talent you connect with. Understand their career goals and motivations to help guide them towards their next great opportunity.
Requirements
Who You Are:
3+ years of recruitment experience with a focus on recruiting for start-ups and/or agency environments.
 Stellar communication skills - remember, you are the person managing expectations with both the candidates and hiring managers. Experience working for fast paced, growth-oriented, technology companies. You get excited about building and being a part of a growing a business.
Strong, full-cycle recruitment experience from candidate engagement to interview coordination to contract negotiation and then into the onboarding experience.
Collaborative nature and entrepreneurial mindset.
Proven ability to build strong and effective relationships with all levels across an organization.
Strong sense of urgency and ability to handle multiple priorities.
Proven ability to work independently to achieve results including taking ownership of deliverables and being accountable for the results.
Benefits
We are a group of intellectually curious people who are passionate about making a big splash in the world of retail. We offer competitive compensation including equity options - we want all the members of Rubikrew to own part of the Company. You will have a full health benefits package including extended health care, dental, vision etc. Lunch is catered Monday to Thursday so you won’t have to worry about packing a lunch! Healthy snacks and drinks are also provided to keep you energized. We want our employees to feel like they’re always developing personally and professionally so we offer a a personal development budget that you are free to use for knowledge expansion or as a fitness allowance.

Thank you to all who apply. We are only contacting applicants who is moving on to the next stage of the process. If you don’t hear from us, please check back for any future opportunities! Rubikloud welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_title: Senior Scientist, Process Development (Process Analytical Technologies)
job_description:
Senior Scientist, Process Development (Process Analytical Technologies)
BlueRock Therapeutics is an engineered cell therapy company with a mission to develop regenerative medicines for intractable diseases. BlueRock’s Cell+Gene platform harnesses the power of cells for new medicines across Neurology, Cardiology and Autoimmunity. BlueRock’s cell differentiation technology recapitulates the cell’s developmental biology to produce native cell therapies, which can be further engineered for additional function. Utilizing these cell therapies to replace damaged or degenerated tissue brings the potential to restore or regenerate lost function. The company was founded in 2016 by Versant Ventures and capitalized with one of the largest-ever Series A financings in biotech history by Bayer AG and Versant.
BlueRock`s ambition is to have an R&D team of dynamic and highly engaged top scientists who are inspired to take project ownership and further develop themselves in one of the most rapidly growing scientific fields. At BlueRock we value open communication, collaboration and a positive and fun working environment in which both individual and team contributions are recognized. Our world-class management team is committed to fostering the growth and career development of employees.
The Toronto, Canada site is seeking a Senior Scientist to join our Process Development team. The incumbent will be a key scientific leader in a dynamic and progressive team manufacturing therapeutic cells from cells from pluripotent stem cells. This is a cross-functional role, leading the evolution of our process analytical capabilities to improve process understanding and performance across multiple programs. The ideal candidate is a rigorous, data driven individual with expertise in an assortment of analytical technologies, metabolic analysis, and experimental design. Familiarity with mammalian cell culture bioprocess development is a requirement, cell therapy development experience a strong plus.
This is an outstanding opportunity for a talented scientific leader to contribute to bringing a new class of medicines to patients and gain valuable career experience in translational medicine. Collaboration with a highly-motivated, world-class team of scientists and engineers promises an exciting and engaging work environment for motivated, self-starting candidates.
Position Description:
Provide cross-functional scientific leadership to a team of scientists, and associates
Design and lead multifaceted projects to quantitively characterise process performance and deepen understanding across multiple programs
Evaluate and effectively deploy new and emerging analytical technologies, act as a champion for innovation
Co-ordinate and interact with other functions to resource projects, synergising with ongoing activities
Act as a subject matter expert across a range of analytical technologies and experimental methodologies, and mentor junior team members
Analyze experimental data to draw conclusions that support decision making and next steps within and across projects
Assist and train others as necessary
Prepare and present project plans and regular project progress updates and recommendations

job_title: Superviseur(e) des ressources humaines// Human Resources Supervisor
job_description:
Saint-Laurent, QCContractCroyez-vous à la force du travail d’équipe et du partage d’idées ? Mettez-vous un point d’honneur à assurer un service impeccable et une qualité exceptionnelle dans tout ce que vous entreprenez ? Êtes-vous à l’affût d’idées pour faire évoluer votre environnement ? Si vous souhaitez réellement faire avancer les choses et si votre plus grand bonheur est de travailler avec l’élite, Maxxam est sans doute l’entreprise qu’il vous faut !

Imaginez-vous évoluer parmi l’élite du secteur.
Maxxam Analytique est à la recherche

SUPERVISEUR(E) RÉGIONAL(E) DES RESSOURCES HUMAINES
Remplacement de congé de maternité (14-15 mois)
** Veuillez faire parvenir votre CV en français et en anglais
Intégrez notre talentueuse équipe d’experts dans le domaine scientifique afin d’affiner vos connaissances techniques tout en donnant une véritable impulsion à votre carrière. Nous nous surpassons chaque jour afin de proposer des solutions innovantes qui permettent à nos clients de prendre des décisions majeures qui se répercuteront directement sur la collectivité et sur notre environnement. Nous sommes à la recherche d’un ou d’une gestionnaire de compte passionné qui veut offrir des conseils et des services de qualité à nos clients du secteur de l’évaluation et la restauration des sites. Le candidat ou la candidate doit être parfaitement bilingue, anglais et français, et avoir un permis de conduire valide.
Les principales tâches d’un(e) SUPERVISEUR(E) DES RESSOURCES HUMAINES consistent à :
Superviser, orienter et conseiller les employés et employées des ressources humaines qui lui sont affectés.
Fournir des conseils professionnels en matière de ressources humaines à une équipe précise des opérations.
S’occuper du recrutement et offrir des services d’orientation à la direction et au personnel.
Assurer la liaison entre le personnel et la direction sur les questions relatives aux relations de travail, au recrutement, à la classification et à la rémunération.
Établir et entretenir des relations étroites avec les subordonnés directs et subordonnées directes des ressources humaines. Anticiper leurs besoins et répondre à leurs attentes, voir les dépasser.
Agir à titre de « champion » ou « championne » de la communication pour veiller à ce que tout le personnel soit tenu au courant de tout changement ou nouvelle information.
S’engager à respecter la confidentialité de manière à établir et maintenir des relations de confiance avec le personnel.
Assurer la liaison entre le personnel et les superviseurs, superviseures et gestionnaires en ce qui a trait au travail ou à la résolution personnelle des problèmes.
Renforcer la présence et la visibilité des ressources humaines, y compris dans l’équipe de gestion.
Servir de personne-ressource pour les autres divisions de l’entreprise comme les TI, les finances, etc.
Assurer l’adhésion aux politiques de Maxxam.
Se porter responsable de projets et tâches ponctuelles selon les besoins.

Recrutement
Orienter et guider l’équipe des ressources humaines dans les procédures de recrutement.
Obtenir les approbations appropriées des équipes assignées pour le recrutement.
Préparer et afficher les offres d’emploi, à l’interne et à l’externe.
S’occuper de la présélection et de l’évaluation des candidates et des candidates et faire des recommandations sur les personnes à passer en entrevue.
Travailler de concert avec la direction pour les entrevues et, au besoin, pour choisir les questions qui seront posées pour un poste précis.
Vérifier les références des candidats et des candidates et en faire un résumé aux directeurs et directrices qui embauchent.
Écrire la première ébauche des lettres d’offre d’emploi.
Établir et maintenir de bonnes relations avec les universités, les services de placement et tout autre service d’aide au recrutement.
Présenter le programme d’orientation des personnes nouvellement embauchées.
Mener les entrevues de départ.

Rémunération et avantages sociaux
Administrer les avantages sociaux et les expliquer aux membres du personnel et assurer la liaison avec l’assureur.
Répondre aux questions concernant la rémunération et la classification, s’il y a lieu.
Assurer la communication avec l’équipe de la paie pour toute question du personnel, y compris sur ADP.
S’occuper de la gestion des demandes de règlement d’invalidité de courte durée et d’invalidité de longue durée en collaboration avec notre compagnie d’assurance et la direction, au besoin.
Formation
Recommander et élaborer des activités de développement et des formations et créer un calendrier.
Élaborer et donner des formations aux directeurs, directrices, superviseurs, superviseures et membres du personnel de l’entreprise.
Administration
Fournir des données de recherche et des statistiques au personnel pour la collecte, la préparation et l’analyse de l’information à utiliser dans la mise en œuvre des procédures et des politiques.
Faire un sommaire mensuel des statistiques en ressources humaines et analyser et utiliser les données pour formuler des recommandations en vue d’une amélioration continue.
Créer des rapports mensuels et ponctuels avec SIRH.
Coordonner le programme de retour au travail anticipé et sécuritaire en collaboration avec les divisions de SST et les organes ministériels concernés (WSIB, WCB, CNESST, etc.).

Relation avec le personnel
Faciliter la mise en place de mesures pour aider les membres du personnel à régler certains problèmes et veiller à transmettre les renseignements à l’équipe de la direction concernée.
Étudier les plaintes des employés et employées et veille à ce que toute la documentation concernant les inquiétudes et les problèmes soit exacte et rapidement remplie.
Répondre aux demandes de renseignements relativement aux politiques, aux procédures et aux programmes.
Offrir du mentorat et donner des directives à l’équipe de direction relativement à l’embauche, à la présence et à la gestion de la performance.
Travailler étroitement avec la direction pour résoudre les relationnels avec les employés, pour répondre aux inquiétudes et pour préparer les documents sur les mesures disciplinaires.
Coordonner des programmes qui aident à trouver le leader ou la leader de demain, élaborer des cheminements de carrière et mettre en œuvre des outils de gestion du rendement axés sur la compétence.
Participer aux projets locaux et nationaux liés aux ressources humaines et soutenir les projets à grandeur de l’entreprise.
Écrire les lettres de licenciement et mener les entrevues de départ.
Rester au fait des exigences juridiques des gouvernements en matière de création de rapports pour les ressources humaines et veiller à ce que les politiques, les procédures et les rapports à l’interne soient conformes.
Vous êtes le/la SUPERVISEUR(E) DES RESSOURCES HUMAINES idéal(e) si :
Avoir un certificat en ressources humaines ou un diplôme équivalent.
Détenir le titre de CRHA (conseiller ou conseillère en ressources humaines agréé) du CCARH ou être en voie de l’obtenir, serait ou atout.
Avoir trois à cinq ans d’expérience dans la prestation de services en ressources humaines.
Être bilingue
Connaître les lois provinciales et fédérales.
Démontrer de bonnes compétences en organisation, analyse, recherche et médiation.
Faire preuve de leadership (compétence intermédiaire) : encadrement, formation et mentorat.
Avoir de bonnes compétences en communication écrite et orale (être entre autres capable de donner des présentations).
Avoir une bonne gestion du changement.
Bien connaître le SIRH (entrée de données et production de rapports).
Avoir des compétences en informatique, surtout avec Microsoft Office et la recherche sur Internet.

Maxxam est le leader du marché canadien en services et solutions d’analyse pour les secteurs de l’énergie, de l’environnement, de l’alimentation et de l’ADN et appartient au Groupe Bureau Veritas, un chef de file mondial des tests, de l’inspection et de la certification.
Rejoignez notre talentueuse équipe de scientifiques et d’experts en postulant dès aujourd’hui !
Nous voulons que notre équipe à Maxxam soit le reflet des communautés dans lesquelles nous travaillons. L’inclusion, c’est avant tout d’encourager tous les employés et toutes les employées à partager leurs idées, leurs connaissances, leurs perspectives, leurs approches et leurs styles pour contribuer au succès de notre entreprise. L’inclusion, c’est d’attirer de nouveaux talents et d’intégrer leur culture, leurs croyances et leurs connaissances professionnelles pour une meilleure diversité.
Apprendre des meilleurs. Devenir le meilleur.
 *************************************************************************************

Do you believe in the power of teamwork and sharing ideas? Do you take pride in delivering exceptional quality and service with everything you do? Do you seek out ideas for improving the status quo? If you want to make a difference and love being surrounded by the best and the brightest, Maxxam might be the place for you!
Imagine being surrounded by the brightest minds in the industry.
Maxxam is looking for a
REGIONAL HUMAN RESOURCES SUPERVISOR
Maternity Leave replacement (14-15 months)
*** Please send your resume in French and English
Join our talented team of experts in the scientific field to advance your technical knowledge and advance your career. Every day we go above and beyond to deliver innovative solutions to help our clients make important decisions that directly impact the community and the environment. We are seeking a passionate customer-focused account manager to provide business and service excellence to our environmental site assessment and remediation client sector. Candidate must be fully bilingual and must possess a valid driver’s licence.
As a HUMAN RESOURCES SUPERVISOR, your main responsibilities are to:
To oversee the HR function and provide direction and guidance to HR staff as assigned
To provide professional Human Resources advice to a dedicated client group within the operation
Provide Excellent Recruitment services/guidance to management and staff
To act as liaison between staff and management for issues regarding employee relations, recruitment, classification and compensation
Develop and nurture ongoing relationship with HR direct reports. Work to anticipate their needs and meet and exceed their expectations
To act as “communication champion” to ensure that all staff are kept informed of new information
To develop and maintain trust with employees by ensuring that all information deemed confidential remains so
To act as liaison between employees and supervisors/managers in dealing with work or personal resolution of issues
To increase the profile and visibility of Human Resources and as a part of the Corporate Team
To act as a resource for others sections of the company e.g. Finance, IT, etc.
Ensure adherence to Maxxam’s policies
Ad hoc projects and duties as required
Recruitment
Provides direction and guidance for HR team on recruitment processes
Obtains appropriate approvals for all assigned client group recruitment
Prepares and posts internal/external job advertisements, as needed
Screens evaluates and recommends applicants for interviews, as needed
Partners with Management in interviews as required and in identifying and creating job related interview questions
Checks applicant references and provides feedback to hiring managers
Drafts offer letters
Develops and maintains good relationships with universities, employment agencies and other recruitment resources
Conducts all new employee orientations
Conducts exit interviews
Compensation and Benefits
Administers and explains benefits to employees, serving as a liaison between insurance carriers and employees
Assists with compensation and classification inquiries, as appropriate
Liaise with payroll for all employee inquiries, including ADP
Coordinates and facilitates the short term disability and long term disability claims management process in collaboration with our third party provider and management, as required
Training
Recommends, develops and schedules development and training courses as required
Develops and conducts training to instruct organization managers, supervisors and employees
Administration
Provides research and statistical information to staff in collecting, preparing and analyzing the information for use in implementation of procedures and policies
Maintains monthly human resources scorecard, analyzing and utilizing the data to assist with recommendations for continuous improvement
Generates monthly and ad hoc reports using HRIS
Coordinates and facilitates the Early and Safe Return to Work process in collaboration with the OH&S department and the WSIB/WCB/CNESST, as required
Employee Relations
Facilitates actions to resolve employee issues and escalating them to the appropriate level of senior management
Reviews employee complaints and ensures accurate and timely documentation/resolution of concerns
Responds to inquiries regarding policies, procedures and programs
Provides mentoring and guidance to the Leadership team regarding recruitment, attendance, and performance management
Works closely with senior management to resolve employee relations issues and concerns and prepares all disciplinary documentation
Facilitates programs to identify future leaders, set career paths and implement competency based performance management tools
Engages in HR projects locally or nationally; champions company led initiatives
Prepares termination letters and conducts termination meetings
Maintains knowledge of legal requirements and government reporting regulations affecting human resources functions and ensures policies, procedures and reporting are in compliance
You are the ideal HUMAN RESOURCES SUPERVISOR if:
Human Resources Certificate or equivalent education
CHRP designation is an asset
3 to 5 years of experience in direct provision of Human Resources services
Bilingual (QC only)
Knowledge of Provincial and Federal Legislation
Strong organizational, analytical, research and mediation skills
Leadership skill at the intermediate level: coaching, training, mentoring
Open communication skills (written, oral presentation)
Change management skills
HRIS capabilities (data entry & report production)
Computer skills in Microsoft Office & Internet research ability
Maxxam is the Canadian market leader in analytical services and solutions to the energy, environmental, food and DNA industries and a member of the Bureau Veritas Group of companies – a world leader in testing, inspection and certification services.
Join our talented community of scientists and experts and apply today!
When we look at Maxxam, we want to see a reflection of the communities in which we work. Inclusion is about actively involving every employee’s ideas, knowledge, perspectives, approaches and styles to maximize business success. Inclusion is about attracting new talent who will bring more diversity to our workforce, with differences in culture, professional backgrounds and beliefs.
Learn from the best. Be the best.

Job Description
IBM Watson Health is looking for talented applicants destined to usher in the next era of healthcare. We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. The convergence of data and technology is transforming healthcare and life sciences organizations today. New opportunities are being created that never existed before to meet the demands of this transformation.

Change the world at IBM. There aren’t many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation.

Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress.

Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available – the sky is the limit!

This position resides in Mississauga, ON and is a 4 (co-op) month work term commencing May 2019. It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.

What IBM Offers You?
Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology
Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding
A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance
Access to the Future Blue Community - IBM’s large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.

It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

The Rapid Development is a team of Scientists and Cognitive Software Developers within IBM Watson Health Imaging. In collaboration with cross-functional Watson Health teams, IBM Research and external partners, the team develops cognitive solutions that combine imaging and clinical data to enhance clinical decision making. The team is responsible for developing and validating robust and scalable cognitive services (text analytics and image analytics) and applications, including validation and evaluation of technologies. The team follows Agile and DevOps methodologies to enable rapid iteration and responsiveness.

We are looking for self-motivated and driven candidates that are passionate about working on cutting edge technologies and that thrive in a highly collaborative environment.

This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Must be currently enrolled in and pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Applied Math
At least 2 years of Image Processing or Computer Vision or NLP background (course work, or thesis work)
Strong programming skills with Python and experience with Deep Learning and Computer Vision packages such as Keras, Tensorflow and OpenCV

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Educaton : Master or PHD

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About the role
Our Data Science team provides reporting, monitoring, and strategic advice to all areas of Shopify. They are the voice of data and support all aspects of our business, enabling them to make better informed decisions. We have dedicated groups of data scientists that work with finance, marketing, product, support, platform and human resources. Our data science teams are completely full-stack, both in how they participate in decision-making at the leadership level, and in their technical competencies.

Required experience for the role:
You have worked on a Data Science team at scale where analytics on top of massive data sets drives product and business decisions
Working knowledge of Python or other programming language
You are equal parts technical and functional (and both are strong), and you are equally comfortable and effective at presenting to technical or business leaders
Understanding the many uses of regression and inferential statistics
Extensive experience analyzing data using SQL
Great organizational and interpersonal skills, with proven success building relationships across all levels
Projects you could work on:
Working in a highly collaborative fashion as a core member of the Data Science Team to prioritize data collection, transformation, and advanced statistical techniques
Alongside Shopify’s finance team, you'll work closely with senior leadership to define and measure key metrics, promote new analytical techniques, question assumptions, and tell the story behind the numbers
As someone who thrives in a rapidly changing environment, you will develop a deep understanding of our data, tools, and processes
Using ML to help develop forecasting models to assist with financial planning
You’ll be an integral part of Shopify’s wider Data Science and Engineering organization where we’ve built out a petabyte scale Data Warehouse to make sure that every Shopifier can access the data they need to make better decisions. This includes empowering the 800,000+ merchants on our platform as well. With our goal of making commerce better for everyone, being a data-informed company includes enabling data-informed merchants!
If you're interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, click the "Apply Now" button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Phil Rossi.

Job Description Summary
The QC Analyst is responsible for testing of finished products, in-process products and raw materials, including all analysis and documentation. May also perform experiments related to troubleshooting, customer complaint investigations and other product-related problems.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Perform QC tests on Cell Separation, Media, and Antibody products according to approved
procedures, including data analysis and report preparation
Participation in and compliance to QMS
Participate in the development of QC testing procedures
Cell culture and processing for various applications
Operation of specialized lab equipment as required (eg. Flow cytometer)
Perform non-routine analysis and testing with direction (eg. troubleshooting, customer
complaint investigations, process development, research and development projects)
General laboratory and equipment maintenance and monitoring
Communicate with supervisors and coworkers to promote a safe and cooperative
working environment

Qualifications
BSc or technical degree with 0-2 years related laboratory experience.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.
To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

job_title: Senior Data Scientist // Scientifique des données principal
job_description:
Montréal, QCReporting to the Analytics Manager, the Senior Data Scientist is responsible for answering sophisticated business questions using complex data patterns. He/She will advocate, evangelize and build innovative data-fuelled models that support our success. The ideal candidate demonstrates a strong passion for producing new, creative and leading-edge analytics solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Translate complex analytical results into actionable business initiatives
Develop a deep understanding of the business, its data, and patterns
Extract data from multiple sources to uncover opportunities or detect issues
Research and develop learning models, perform statistical analysis and deliver data reviews and optimization to internal teams and executives
Partner with strategic business stakeholders to provide evidence-based guidance
Contribute to data mining architecture, modeling standards and data analysis methodologies
Design and implement accessible, high-impact visualizations that clearly communicate conservation results, elucidate patterns, promote accountability, generate actionable insights, and facilitate decision making
Work iteratively in collaboration with different teams to refine initial concepts and prototypes that can be presented to stakeholders for feedback
Develop and continuously improve processes, tools, and techniques
Stay abreast of emerging tools and technologies

REQUIREMENTS


Master’s or PhD degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Methods, or a related field
A minimum of 5 years experience in analytics / data science with a focus on driving business impact
Strong understanding of advanced modeling techniques, such as Machine Learning, nonparametric approaches and neural networks
Excellent programming skills using SQL, Python, and statistical softwares (eg. R, SAS)
Experience with data manipulation technologies and knowledge of programming languages
Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Experience using Spark or similar languages, an asset
Experience with e-Commerce, an asset
Experience in econometric models, an asset
Understanding of web analytics, an asset

SKILLS


Highly analytical and detail oriented
Capacity to synthesize, simplify and present complex information to technical and business stakeholders at various levels of the organization
Ability to design and present complex data sets in a variety of visually compelling formats
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment
Team player with solid interpersonal skills

----------

Relevant du Gestionnaire des analyses, le Scientifique des données principal est chargé de répondre aux questions d’affaires sophistiquées à l’aide de schémas de données complexes. Il/Elle va promouvoir, evangelizer et bâtir des modèles de données novateurs qui soutiennent notre succès. Le candidat idéal est passionné par la production de solutions d’analyse nouvelles, créatives et avant-gardistes.

RESPONSABILITÉS


Traduire des résultats analytiques complexes en initiatives d’affaires actionnables
Développer une compréhension approfondie des affaires, des données et des schémas de l’entreprise
Extraire les données de plusieures sources pour découvrir des opportunités ou détecter des problèmes
Développer des modèles d’apprentissage, effectuer des analyses statistiques et fournir des examens de données et l’optimisation des données aux équipes et aux directeurs internes
Travailler étroitement avec les intervenants stratégiques afin d’offrir une orientation basée sur les preuves
Contribuer à l’exploration des données, l’architecture, les normes de modèles et les méthodologies d’analyse des données
Concevoir et mettre en oeuvre des visualisations accessibles à impact élevé qui communiquent clairement les résultats de conservation, éclaircissent les schémas, favorisent la responsabilisation, génèrent des observations actionnables et facilitent la prise de décisions
Travailler de façon itérative en collaboration avec différentes équipes pour raffiner les concepts et prototypes originaux qui peuvent être présentés aux parties prenantes pour leur rétroaction
Développer et continuellement améliorer les processus, les outils et les techniques
Rester à l’affût des technologies et outils émergents

EXIGENCES


Maîtrise ou Doctorat en Statistiques, Mathématiques, Méthodes quantitatives, ou un domaine connexe
Un minimum de 5 années d’expérience en analyse / science des données visant à faire un impact sur les affaires
Solide compréhension des techniques de modélisation avancées telles que l’apprentissage machine, les techniques non paramétriques et les réseaux neutres
Excellentes compétences de programmation avec SQL, Python et logiciels statistiques (ex. R, SAS)
Expérience avec les technologies de manipulation des données et connaissance des langages de programmation
Vaste expérience en résolution de problèmes analytiques avec approches quantitatives
Expérience avec Spark ou langages similaires, un atout
Expérience e-commerce, un atout
Expérience avec les modèles économétriques, un atout
Compréhension de l’analytique Web, un atout

COMPÉTENCES


Solides aptitudes analytiques et soucieux du détail
Capacité à synthétiser, simplifier et présenter de l’information complexe aux parties prenantes techniques et d’affaires à tous les niveaux de l’entreprise
Capacité à concevoir et présenter des ensembles de données complexes dans une variété de formats visuellement attrayants
Habileté à réussir dans un environnement orienté sur la performance et au rythme rapide
Esprit d’équipe et fortes compétences relationnelles

The quantitative research team is looking for an entry/mid level Data Scientist in the field of time series analysis and pattern recognition to help with modelling work related to infrastructure optimization. You will be working with team of data scientists responsible for providing insights into client device management for cost savings and performance management. This is a fantastic opportunity to rapidly learn and advance in a growing company.
REQUIREMENTS
2+ years practical data science or engineering work experience out of school, in quantitative domains.
Strong quantitative background: B.Sc. or M.Sc. preferred.
Familiarity with technical tools for analysis: Python, R, SQL, Spark.
Experience with software design concepts. Previous software engineering background is a plus.
Ability to structure a project from idea to experimentation to prototype to implementation.
WHAT WE EXPECT?
Enthusiastically tackling problems with a love for teaching and celebrating the successes of others.
Ability to synthesize information and consider problems from new perspectives.
Desire to share information with others and contribute to our top notch learning environment.
Self-starter that is focused and driven with amazing follow-through.
Driven to delivery quality solutions.

At Interaxon, we develop engaging experiences using brain sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centered innovation. Our Muse and Muse 2 headbands are designed to make meditation easier and provide real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app.

As a Principal Developer at Interaxon, you’ll help us with all of our work by keeping an eye on the Big Picture, and occasionally diving into the weeds when necessary. We have a lot of software components in our ecosystem: cross-platform mobile apps, revenue-generating web apps, data connectors to manage marketing and supply chain operations, and big data infrastructure that enables our neuroscientists to comb through our enormous brain data set. You are someone who can own the technical design of individual components and interactions with the overall system. You can communicate effectively to keep tech alignment between teams.


What you‘ll be doing:

Design the end-to-end architecture of our ecosystem, ensuring alignment to the product road-map delivering technical excellence for an industry-leading user experience
Collaborate with product and development team members to ensure solutions that work well in our interconnected environment and help us achieve our strategy
Actively contribute to the development process, participating in sprint rituals, code reviews, and sometimes rolling up your sleeves and contributing code
Communicate the technical vision and specifications of the technical landscape, ensuring understanding and building alignment across the organization
Lead the building of the cloud architecture, guiding the team with solid mentorship, technical expertise, and deep knowledge of best practices and emerging technologies.
Evaluate new technologies and Cloud tools, identifying ones that we can leverage to accomplish the technical vision and requirements
Your skills and experience:

10+ years of relevant experience in software engineering, preferably building integrated Cloud micro-service architectures on AWS, GCP or MS Azure
Design expertise - the ability to understand, build and deploy complex systems and navigate technical challenges in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to quickly learn any new technology or language as appropriate for the task
Expert in Unit Testing, CI and CD systems, and end-to-end testing methodologies
Technical expertise that goes wide and deep - you can understand and communicate the big picture of how our system works and what it needs, but you can also dive deep into the weeds on any one particular component
Exceptional leadership and mentorship skills
Interpersonal communication skills, ability to establish alignment around technical initiatives
Ability to drive technical vision within an Agile/Scrum environment
Computer Science degree or similar degree
What we offer:

Our collaborative culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, great benefits package, meditation space, onsite gym with subsidized membership, a kitchen full of snacks, a variety of food nearby on King Street / Queen Street, onsite bicycle parking and easy access to the TTC. Join a team passionate about making a difference.

Interaxon is a company fueled on innovation and inclusion. We believe that diversity is an essential part of our workplace culture, and we continue to grow our team through equal opportunity and barrier-free recruitment. Additionally, if you require any accommodations during the selection process, please let us know!

We are seeking an experienced and results oriented researcher to take on a role as Research Scientist. This is a hands-on position and a significant amount of bench time is expected.
Rapid Novor Inc is a Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario based start up biotech company dedicated to developing unparalleled analytical technologies to significantly improve early stage drug research and development in the bio-pharmaceutical sector. Specializing in the field of mass spectrometry-based proteomics, the Novor team provides antibody protein sequencing solutions to researchers in pharmaceutical companies, contract research organizations and academic research institutions around the globe. We efficiently deliver accurate, comprehensive results, allowing researchers to rapidly make decisions that move their science forward.

Opportunities for Learning

Our office is located in the Waterloo Accelerator Centre. Our team members have the opportunities to work with an array of experts in Sales, Marketing, PR, etc, who will provide mentorship and coaching to help us succeed.
The core technology of Rapid Novor radiates from the purposefully built de novo protein sequencing program suite developed by the founders. The team also includes renowned experts in the field of mass spec proteomics. You will have the opportunities to discuss and learn directly from those experts to sharpen your technical skills.
Requirements
PhD in biochemistry, analytical chemistry or related field, or MSc with at least 2 years post-degree experience in a protein chemistry related field
Good theoretical understanding of protein biochemistry and strong practical knowledge of sample preparation and separation chemistry for peptides and proteins
Experiences in targeted proteomics (PRM, SRM and DIA) method development and data analysis is a plus
Knowledge and experience in immunology or immune oncology is desirable but not essential
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to conduct and manage projects with minimal supervision
Ability to collaborate with other team members
Can legally work in Canada

Reponsibilities
Conduct research and method development aligned with the company goals
Targeted quantitative proteomics – Develop and implement new and existing methods for highly sensitive quantitation in biofluids
Sample preparation – optimize target enrichment strategies, refine enzyme digestion and develop new high throughput assay formats
Quality control – ensure all developed assays are accurate, reproducible and robust
Operate, maintain and troubleshoot mass spectrometers and ancillary peptide/protein separation equipment
Maintain good laboratory records
Data analysis, interpretation, and visualization of data
Review relevant proteomics literature and remain current with technological advancements in the field
Present data and findings to senior management
Work both independently and collaboratively with other R&D members in a team setting

Do you want to advance machine learning in new spaces and applications? Do you like working with a smart and driven team? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments with challenging problems to solve and take ownership of your work?
If so, CryptoNumerics is for you! We’re building an innovative machine learning solution that helps organizations reap the benefits of sharing data while protecting people’s privacy. We’re a venture-backed team of mathematicians and developers with extensive startup experience in Silicon Valley and Toronto, and are looking for star developers to join our small team to make a huge impact.
What you'll work on:
Build the interface for an innovative enterprise platform that analysts and data scientists can use for collaborative data management, feature engineering, and machine learning.
Work closely with Product, UX, and Engineering to iterate quickly.
Build the orchestration layer for an innovative enterprise platform that addresses the industry challenge of sharing data without loss of privacy or intellectual property.
Requirements
Hands-on development experience building web apps with Javascript/Node.js (3+ years) and CSS.
Hands-on development experience with Python (1+ years), Java, and SQL.
Experience building data modelling, data visualization, and visual programming interfaces using modern Javascript frameworks such as React, D3 and Crossfilter a plus.
Demonstrated ability to deliver new products in fast-paced environment.
Resourceful. Can work independently and in small teams. Learn new things quickly.
Nice to have: Solid understanding of Machine Learning and Data Science concepts and workflows. Familiarity with enterprise architectures.
Benefits
We offer competitive salary, equity, and benefits to work with a venture-backed team of mathematicians and developers with extensive startup experience in Silicon Valley and Toronto. Come join us to make a huge impact!

$80,000 a yearOur mission at Acerta is to make cars safer and enable autonomous vehicles. We are building a machine learning platform that detects and predicts failures through vehicle data. With Acerta, car manufacturers and tier 1 suppliers can improve quality and monitor the health of their vehicle systems on the road. We are looking for good people to join our venture-backed company of engineers and data geeks. We are looking for people who are excited about the future of automotive and mobility, machine learning, saving lives, and looking for a fun working environment. A love for ping pong is appreciated (not mandatory).

Come join our data science team, and help build our platform to detect and predict failures through vehicle data. If you have experience in developing novel analysis approaches, and have planned, developed and managed data science or research projects, and have knowledge of statistics, python, R and machine learning - let’s grab a coffee/beer and chat!

Qualifications:
experience independently planning, developing, and managing data science or research projectsexperience developing novel analysis approachesknowledge of statistics, python, R, and machine learningunderstanding of the practical problems of data analysis, i.e., the bias-variance problem, how much data is enough, managing degrees of freedom, etc.the curiosity to pursue new solutions, and an open mind to recognize them

Are you someone who makes things happen and does what you say you will do? Are you a problem solver who can connect the dots? Are you creative and can drive amazing results that can help us beat out the competition and get higher business results? If you answered yes to the above, then we’d love to talk to you about the SaaS Product Manager opening.
Espial is transforming viewing experiences worldwide by enabling video services at web speed and web scale. From immersive user experience and discovery solutions to advanced cloud-based platforms, Espial solutions help service providers manage, deliver and monetize video and entertainment services. Espial’s customers span six continents, have deployed tens of million devices, and are serviced through Espial’s global sales, support, and innovation centers across North America, Europe, and Asia.

The Elevate SaaS platform radically changes the economic paradigm for the deployment of video services and is already deployed to forty operators across US and Canada. We are now growing this business aggressively and are seeking an exceptional Product Manager to help drive this growth. This role offers the opportunity for the successful applicant to grow with this business.
Requirements
Key Responsibilities
Define and shape Espials Elevate TV-as-a-Service (TVaaS) product - setting TVaaS revenue growth targets and defining the plans to achieve these targets with a focus on the AARRR framework (acquisition, activation, retention, referral and revenue).
Manage/champion voice of the customer input; Understand and mange to the user personas and their needs; Understand the buyer journey and how to address the needs of the buyer at each point of their journey; Map these back to the key metrics driving the TVaaS business.
Develop business cases for each new feature / enhancement to demonstrate viability of the capability, including market fit, target pricing and margin, addressable and realizable market, SWOT analysis, estimated development, implementation and support costs etc.
Competitive Intelligence – research and understand competitive offerings in your marketplaces and how Espial competes successfully against these offerings
Partnering – identify key partners and develop appropriate partner relationships to achieve business objectives
Sales enablement – help define the value proposition of the products for the sales team and help develop the sales tools that support the selling process of your products
Content - Help define tailored content for presentations, demonstrations, etc. that highlight the value proposition of your product portfolio
Assist with Demand generation – Contribute to marketing programs that will drive awareness and demand for your products.
Preferred Experience:
5+ years of Product Management experience, with a focus on scalable platform solutions, B2B software leveraging SaaS solutions.
Familiarity with Software as a Service products and solutions, associated cost models and tradeoffs, scale-out architectural concepts, Cloud services development technology stacks.
Experience in product rollouts across SaaS customer portfolio.
Exceptional communication skills across stakeholders, technologists, data scientists, senior management, and third-party partners.
Benefits
Great downtown location, onsite fitness, competitive benefits package, RRSP matching, paid parking or bus pass

Qualifications
Strong experience with at least two of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java
Commercial client-facing project experience is beneficial, including working in close-knit teams
The ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets • Good experience in multiple database technologies such as: Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR) Traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL) MPP (AWS Redshift, Teradata) NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, Titan)
Proven ability in clearly communicating complex solutions
Strong understanding of Information Security principles to ensure compliant handling and management of client data
Experience and interest in Cloud platforms such as: AWS, Azure, Goole Platform or Databricks
Strong experience in traditional data warehousing / ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)
Strong experience with at least two of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java
Commercial client-facing project experience is beneficial, including working in close-knit teams
Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets
Good experience in multiple database technologies such as: Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR) Traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL) MPP (AWS Redshift, Teradata) NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, Titan)
Strong understanding of Information Security principles to ensure compliant handling and management of client data
Experience and interest in Cloud platforms such as: AWS, Azure, Goole Platform or Databricks
Strong experience in traditional data warehousing / ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)
Who You'll Work With
As a Data Engineer at QuantumBlack, you will be working on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact.

Who you are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritising impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.
What You'll Do
You will be working on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. We are passionate about life-long learning and professional development individual to each of our employees.

Role responsibilities

Work with clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts, and define secure data exchange approaches
Plan and deliver secure, good practice data integration strategies and approaches
Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms
Create and manage data environments in the Cloud
Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models
Have a strong understanding of Information Security principles to ensure compliant handling and management of client data
This is a fantastic opportunity to be involved in end-to-end data management for bleeding edge Advanced Analytics and Data Science
What you’ll learn

Influence, develop and master best-practice around modern tools that support rapid development of analytics solutions like Python, Spark, Airflow and others.
Apply cutting edge data solutions to real world problems
Learn to deeply understand the data science and data engineering process and develop impactful and reusable patterns and abstractions
Collaboratively advance the state of art in QuantumBlack’s practice and for our clients
Build products alongside the core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to handle more users, resolutions for complex problems and advanced client situations.
Work with an extensive range of technologies around big data tools.
Work with clear objectives for your Data Engineering expertise while collaborating with the Data Science, Machine Learning Engineer and Design teams
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.

Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.
Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:

Healthcare Efficiency – We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.
Environmental Impact – We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.
Product Development – We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures.
Visit our Careers site to watch our video and read about our interview processes and benefits.

job_title: Project Scientist or Engineer in Training
job_description:
SNC-Lavalin is currently seeking a junior level Project Scientist or Engineer-in-Training for our Prince George, BC office. This employment opportunity will allow the successful applicant to support SNC-Lavalin’s Site Assessment and Remediation team on a variety of projects primarily in Northern BC.
Responsibilities
Execution of field programs on local and remote sites, including monitoring and sampling of groundwater, surface water, soil vapours and air.
Calibration and operation of field instruments and equipment.
Collection, handling and shipment of environmental samples.
Collection of field data and detailed documentation (e.g., field notes, site sketches, photographs).
Submission of field data and preparation of summaries for project managers.
Working directly with Project Managers and other project team members to meet client deliverables on time and on budget.
Familiarity and compliance with all applicable Health and Safety procedures and guidelines.
Qualifications
University degree in environmental science or environmental engineering.
0-2 years of relevant project experience in contaminated sites, preferably encompassing field work (including groundwater and soil vapour sampling, surveying, environmental monitoring) and project coordination.
Willingness to work in the field in variable weather conditions, and to travel to remote locations and work away from home for periods ranging from 1 week up to 4 weeks.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Exceptional attitude toward Health and Safety awareness.
Demonstrated organizational and time management skills.
Ability to work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team.
Excellent problem solving skills.
Working knowledge of Outlook, Word and Excel.
Valid driver’s license.
Worker Type
Employee
Job Type
Contractual (Fixed Term)
At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.
By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Montréal, QCMindGeek is the largest, privately held company in our industry developing unparalleled technologies for high traffic, high volume online properties. Our exceptional team consist of experts in every functional area of business and they are the key to our position as leaders in content delivery. We strive to innovate on a daily basis to ensure we continue to grow and create new revenue opportunities and cutting edge technology. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big.
As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for analyzing complex data patterns in order to find new solutions to specific technical or business challenges within the area of web publishing and marketing. We expect you to have a solid training in computer science, software development, modeling, statistics and mathematics or any related quantitative field. You also have good business knowledge and a strong sense of initiative and adventure. You will work closely with technical and business teams to find innovative approaches to the various data processing challenges that our organization faces.
You will work on various systems like content recommendation engines, ad bidding systems, credit card fraud detection solutions, anomalous web traffic detection, and much more.
Responsibilities:
Review recent technological and research advances from the community and integrate them with existing architecture
Architect, develop and implement systems to optimize revenue, views and engagement
Meet, communicate and present findings to internal clients
Find creative solutions to current issues and identify new opportunities
Develop and implement solutions including applying algorithms, improving existing algorithms, and developing custom algorithms
Provide expert advice and assistance to other teams in the company
Requirements:
M.Sc. in Data Mining, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics or similar field - Ph.D. an asset
Strong knowledge and proficiency in data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, clustering, regression and neural networks
Research-oriented and strong passion for empirical research on hard problems
Strong programming skills in R, Java, Python or similar high-level languages
Ability to present results to non-expert people
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with database environments and functional knowledge of SQL.
Experience with Samza, Kafka, Yarn and other distributed and big data solutions
Experience with UNIX/Linux environment
Experience and ability to work with Big Data problems
Data Science side project or Kaggle competitions an asset
What we offer:
Competitive compensation
Stay sharp by taking part at one of our Hackathons, Engineering retreats, Lunch & Learns or Leadership Seminars.
Free breakfast daily as well as monthly lunches
Flex time and summer hour schedule
A 500$ fitness allowance
Epic parties throughout the year including summer BBQ, Halloween costume party, Holiday bash and 5 a 7s
Opportunity to give back to the community through our Pay it Forward Program, Ronald Macdonald House visits and supporting the MindGeek Scholarship Fund for Dans la Rue
A chance to work with a first-class team !
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. No telephone calls please. No agency calls or emails.
#LI-JFL

job_title: Coop Technical Publications Writer IP Routing
job_description:
Ottawa, ONCo-op Student Position: Summer Term (May to August 2019) 4 months.
Co-op Technical Publications Writer – IP Routing.
Number of openings: 3

This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-op or internship program at a Canadian College or University.

Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.

When collaborating with local universities, you can be certain to meet some inspiring, young talent. The relationships Nokia builds with students while offering internship opportunities are priceless, and recently was recognized when our Ottawa campus was nominated as a top co-op employer in the city. We look forward to continuing this great initiative.

The successful candidate will work in a team of technical publications writers, responsible for supporting Nokia’s IP/Optical Networks organization by designing, creating, developing, and maintaining Nokia and legacy Alcatel-Lucent technical publications.

Example duties:


Plan, research, write, and edit hardware installation and software configuration documentation for Nokia and legacy Alcatel-Lucent products.Develop schedules and plans for individual features under general guidance, as required.Gather data internally from technical staff through emails, interviews, lab tours, etc.Gather data externally from industry RFCs and international standards documentation.Work with product line management (PLM), R&D, and testers to ensure accuracy and timeliness of technical publications to coincide with product release.Coordinate review and signoff process for features.Participate in peer reviews for other writers on the team to provide feedback on content, usability, and style.Participate in fixing documentation errors raised internally and externally.Assist with documentation publishing tasks with release deadlines in mind, including quickly resolving content and format errors and providing final proofing checks.Work to continuously improve documentation content and appearance.Follow corporate style guidelines to ensure a consistent look and feel for publications.

Key skills:

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong research skills.Quick learner and self-starter; able to work individually on a feature level in coordination with the needs and actions of a larger team.Good organizational skills.Quality-minded and detail-oriented.

Desired skills:

Desire to work with new hardware and software.

Nokia Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, Aboriginal persons, and persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class

job_title: Directeur du MI / Artificial Intelligence (AI) Head - Montréal
job_description:
Date: Feb 26, 2019
ENGLISH VERSION TO FOLLOW

Ericsson permet aux fournisseurs de services de communication de saisir toute la valeur de la connectivité. Le portefeuille de la société touche les réseaux, les services numériques, les services gérés et les entreprises émergentes. Il permet d'aider nos clients à passer au numérique, à accroître leur efficacité, à trouver de nouvelles sources de revenus. Les investissements d’Ericsson dans l’innovation ont permis à des milliards de personnes du monde entier, de bénéficier des avantages de la téléphonie et du haut débit mobile. L'action Ericsson est cotée au Nasdaq de Stockholm et au Nasdaq de New York. www.ericsson.com

Le site d’Ericsson de Montréal compte plus de 1 200 professionnels travaillant dans notre centre de R & D et de services.

Nombreux sont les experts de classe mondiale opérant dans la création et l’installation de systèmes sans fil, évolués et de la nouvelle génération,
pour nos nombreux clients au Canada, en Amérique du Nord et dans le monde.

Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l’homme de comprendre comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil. La combinaison de réseaux sans fil 5G, de l'Edge computing réparti et de l'accès aux données en temps réel dans un environnement d’appareils portatifs, orientera les réseaux et les produits de la prochaine génération vers une évolution économique et sociale de tous les aspects de la société. Les techniques d'Intelligence Artificielle (acronyme « AI » en anglais) et de l'Apprentissage Automatique (acronyme « ML » en anglais) seront essentielles pour nous-mêmes et nos clients, si nous voulons tirer parti de ces opportunités. À cette fin, nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée. L’équipe canadienne, située à Montréal, comptera plus de 30 employés.

L'Intelligence automatisée (acronyme « MI » en anglais), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres techniques liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une administration réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions pour simplifier et automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.

Ericsson recherche actuellement un dirigeant expérimenté pour diriger son équipe de MI à Montréal. Le poste relèvera de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Directeur du MI à Montréal, vous devez très bien connaitre la Science des données (DS), l’apprentissage automatique et la programmation, ainsi qu’être compétent en direction afin de constituer une solide équipe locale. Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour diriger une équipe de professionnels, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et internationale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et les idées, dans le cadre d'initiatives très influentes dans le domaine de l’Intelligence automatisée, afin de stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en décuplant ce que propose actuellement Ericsson. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G dirigés par MI, du cloud réparti, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités.

Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.

Diriger une équipe pour créer rapidement et répétitivement un système viable et sûr répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique.

Participer à des études et trouver une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler en utilisant des données.

Établir une équipe MI à Montréal et diriger son travail afin qu'il corresponde aux objectifs, plans et tâches de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Collaborer avec les équipes de création de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux.

Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.

Aider les entreprises et les services à la clientèle d’Ericsson, à accumuler des compétences en MI.

Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et techniques consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants.

Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
