MindGeek is the largest, privately held company in our industry developing unparalleled technologies for high traffic, high volume online properties. Our exceptional team consist of experts in every functional area of business and they are the key to our position as leaders in content delivery. We strive to innovate on a daily basis to ensure we continue to grow and create new revenue opportunities and cutting edge technology. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big.

The Product Manager – Data, Analytics and UX will work with business stakeholders to understand user behaviors, attitudes and experiences applying technical and analytical knowledge to transform these insights into actionable items that drive the business forward.

You are the ideal candidate if you are passionate improving user experience through a data-driven approach.

The role involves engaging with UX researchers, data scientists, product managers, sales teams and technology partners to leverage enterprise data and present clear, actionable recommendations/analyses.

Our team is fast-paced and focused, but we maintain a healthy work/life balance and have fun. We value integrity, flexibility, accountability, drive, and collaboration.

As the Data, Analytics and UX PM you will:

Work with product, UX and analytics teams to understand and identify user behaviors and the key metrics that will guide our product roadmaps.
Take ownership of internal testing and business intelligence tools and provide the vision for the roadmap for these tools
Build business cases to help drive portfolio decisions
Manage a team of analysts, researchers and data scientists
Seek to understand customer needs and market trends through experiments, customer interaction and other market research
Define, manage and monitor product and business KPIs, such as: revenue growth, cost savings, traffic growth, etc.
Work closely with team of analysts on delivering standard and advanced dashboards and reports

Your background likely includes:

Proven track record of improving website performance and revenue based on data-driven strategy
Minimum 4 years' experience in product management or UX research
Highly motivated, self-starter, extremely curious about data and how it can help solve business problems
Experience working in JIRA
Strong experience with data extraction, manipulation and blending across different data sources (Google Analytics, MixPanel and proprietary tools).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational skills while managing multiple projects
Knowledge of the Internet landscape, including a comprehension of display advertising, consumer-facing websites, web traffic sources.
Experience working on large consumer-facing, ad-supported websites focused on audience engagement and growth.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.
Excellent Excel skills
Collaborates closely with all areas of the business (Product, Marketing, Sales and Editorial) to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders
Partners with product team to develop business cases to support new and existing product development, understands objectives and helps determine key performance indicators
Ensures data integrity across all performance-based metrics, tracking and reporting.
Previous involvement in the development of internal testing and analytics tools is an asset

What we offer:

Competitive compensation
Stay sharp by taking part at one of our Hackathons, Engineering retreats, Lunch & Learns or Leadership Seminars.
Free breakfast daily as well as monthly lunches
Flex time and summer hour schedule
A 500$ fitness allowance
Epic parties throughout the year including summer BBQ, Halloween costume party, Holiday bash and 5 a 7s
Opportunity to give back to the community through our Pay it Forward Program, Ronald Macdonald House visits and supporting the MindGeek Scholarship Fund for Dans la Rue
A chance to work with a first-class team !

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. No telephone calls please. No agency calls or emails.

job_title: Senior Manager, Analytics and BI, Digital Factory
job_description:
Requisition ID: 56857
At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.
We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.
If you’d like to learn more about the Digital Factory workspace, our Digital Banking career opportunities, Communities of Practice, and open source projects, check out our microsite: https://digitalfactory.scotiabank.com/
As the Senior Manager, Analytics, you will be leading a high performing team of Data Analysts and Data Scientists who are responsible for delivering data and analytics projects at a global scale.
Is this role right for you?
Lead, coach and mentor a team of data analysts and scientists who are responsible for delivering on global initiatives across 4 major business streams; business intelligence, performance marketing enablement and, engineering
Work closely with cross-functional teams such as Product and Marketing, as well as our Analytics partners in Latin America and the Caribbean.
Identify and support business development initiatives; participate in and lead all aspects of the proposal development process.
Maintain an understanding of advancements in technology and innovations which are happening across digital and analytics.
Lead project management delivery and related software/systems development using various methodologies such as Agile and DataOps.
Traveling to our Latin American counterparts in Mexico, Chile, Colombia and, Peru about 20% of the time
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?
You have at least 5 years of consulting experience managing relevant BI or analytics projects
You have proven success in leading high performing teams
You hold a Bachelor’s degree in the Analytics discipline
You’re experienced with Agile project methodologies
You have experience implementing large projects
It would be preferred if you are bilingual in Spanish
What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
Free shuttle service to and from Union station
Onsite cafeteria with a chef!
Onsite fitness center
This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun!
We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, personal development funding, maternity leave top-up, parental leave and much more.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Cambium is a successful consulting and engineering company built on quality people doing great work in a
rewarding environment. It’s our team that makes us unique.
And…our team is growing! We are currently seeking an Air Quality Scientist/Engineer to join our team and
support projects related to air quality assessments, Emission Summary and Dispersion Modelling, EASR
Applications, and GHG emission and verification reporting.
JOB DUTIES
 Planning and coordination of the technical activities for air emission and dispersion modelling.
 Complete site inspections; identify and collect data from emission points.
 Conduct atmospheric dispersion modelling and associated report preparation.
 Review, summarize, and interpret data to provide conclusions and mitigation recommendations.
 Preparation of Emission Summary and Dispersion Modelling Reports for ECA Applications.
 Completing EASR Applications.
 Air dispersion modelling using AERMOD, SCREEN3, and other atmospheric dispersion models.
 Coordinate and implement field work to conduct emissions data collection.
 Assist with the design of emission controls.
 Estimation of GHG emissions and/or verification of GHG reports.
 Write or review detailed technical documents including spreadsheet calculations.
 Write or contribute technically to scopes of work for projects and proposals.
 Adherence to health and safety protocols for self and support staff.
 Field work in all seasons; travel and overtime may be required.
QUALIFICATIONS
 Bachelor of Applied Science or Engineering in Environmental Engineering or related field of study.
 Professional Engineer accreditation or ability to acquire (i.e. P.Eng.).
 5 or more years of relevant employment experience (preferably in consulting environment).
 Outstanding organisational, communication, and technical skills, and attention to detail.
 Desire to succeed in a dynamic, progressive organization.
 Works well independently as well as a part of a team.
 Familiarity with relevant federal and provincial legislation and regulations.
 Proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite, AERMOD, SCREEN3, and other atmospheric dispersion models is
essential.
 Written and verbal communication skills are essential. Ability to communicate well with others and engage in
technical conversations.
 Valid Driver’s License and access to a reliable vehicle.

AIR QUALITY ENGINEER

Cambium welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available
on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
If you’re interested, send us some information that helps us understand how you are the right fit for this role and
for our team. Kindly forward your documents, in electronic format only, to hr@cambium-inc.com.

Job Description Summary
The Marketing Leads Coordinator identifies and qualifies marketing leads, in addition to managing and maintaining the marketing leads database using STEMCELL’s Customer Relationship Management software. This entry-level position is well-suited for an individual who has gained some work experience upon graduating from school and is looking to build their career from the ground up.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities:
Identify new leads based on scientific knowledge primarily in the areas of immunology and stem cell research.
Qualify leads and accurately enter the data into STEMCELL’s central customer relationship management software as well as monitor the leads pipeline within the system.
Maintain data accuracy and cleanliness.
Track and report on metrics.
Learn STEMCELL’s central customer relationship management software and email marketing software to support effective dataset management and use.
Respond to the needs of all departments, teams, and geographies with respect to lead generation.
Perform other projects and tasks as required.
Qualifications:
Degree in the biological sciences (BSc).
Minimum 1 year of experience in a life sciences environment, or relevant experience in a similar Sales/Marketing role. Co-op experience is considered relevant.
Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
Demonstrated exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to prioritize and work independently.
Proficient in both Microsoft Word & Excel.
Minimum typing speed of 50 wpm.
A keen interest in contributing to and growing within an innovative, fast-paced, growth company in the biotechnology field.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Experience communicating and working with engineers, product managers and business stakeholders alike

Bachelor's degree from a top university or equivalent

Equity and performance bonuses. Every employee is a stakeholder in our success
Boundless snacks and drinks

Job Description Summary
The Building Systems Specialist is responsible for supporting the repair, maintenance and improvements of building infrastructure systems of the STEMCELL premises (manufacturing, laboratories, distribution and offices) under the Building Systems Maintenance Program.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the maintenance program activities including but not limited to: inspecting, monitoring and maintaining the building systems according to the maintenance program specifications and simultaneously record all work performed on controlled documentation. Building-related operations include clean room operation and maintenance, water systems, compressed gas systems, compressors, boilers, fume hoods, exhaust fans, chillers, pumps, HVAC and humidifier.
Troubleshoot and resolve equipment performance issues; respond to after hour calls.
Coordinate scheduled maintenance work with user groups and contractors, including working during non-business hours when required to minimize operation downtime.
Collaborate with user groups and Quality Control/Assurance teams to ensure building programs are aligned with STEMCELL’s standard operating procedures (SOPs).
Ensure that building-related operations and maintenance are conducted in accordance to STEMCELL’s Quality Management System (QMS), including ISO13485 and good manufacturing practices (GMP). Conduct, document commissioning and qualification. Document deficiencies and complete reports as required.
May write operational SOPs with guidance.
Perform work on equipment based on documented training material. Participate in required training and read relevant SOPs as required.
Ensure utility, electrical and mechanical rooms are maintained, kept clean and free of debris. Coordinate with building owner management on any maintenance activities that are covered by the lease agreement.
Oversee and ensure proper inventory levels of facilities equipment, spare parts, and supplies are maintained at the required levels.
Coordinate and supervise third-party maintenance activities and service contracts.
Resolve user comfort issues involving work with HVAC and DDC (direct digital control system).
Contribute to the ongoing development of the Preventive Maintenance program, including scheduling adjustments, contractor reviews, and recommendations.
Contribute to design projects by creating technical drawings and specifications.
Provide clean room trend analysis data and reports.

Qualifications
Minimum 5 to 7 years experience in mechanical/electrical maintenance or related work. Experience in an industrial/production facility is preferred.
Degree/diploma in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering and certificate in a trade or technology.
4th class Power Engineering is required.
Good mechanical and electrical aptitude and experience with steam, compressed air, chillers, hydronic, water systems, process equipment and HVAC.
Possess a safety oriented mindset.
Highly organized with strong time management and documentation skills.
Mechanically inclined with good problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Effective communicator in responding to demanding situations.
Proficiency using MS Office Suite.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both in one-on-one and in a group setting.
Team oriented yet self-motivated and mature to work independently, detail-oriented and proficient at time management.
Experience in compressed gases and process piping is an asset.
Building/system automation is an asset.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Toronto, ONWho We Are

At Receptiviti, we’re redefining the way companies support and grow their organizations. Leveraging our unique language psychology science, NLP and ML/AI technologies, we’re building tools for employers to foster healthy employee cultures, improve team dynamics, identify human capital risks, and much more.
Over the past year, we’ve landed phenomenal clients including some of North America's top financial institutions, entertainment providers, and major league sports teams. We’ve tripled in size, we’re still growing fast, and looking to add an experienced Software Developer to the team.

Who You Are
You excel in a collaborative team environment, eager to work with high experience and high potential individuals to build new products and product iterations. You pride yourself on quality and are keen to partner with team members to deliver a reliable, scalable software.

No stranger to rapidly changing priorities and a fast pace environment, you can handle multiple projects with a cool head and a strategic approach to solving problems with efficiency.

One step further, versatility is your middle name. You’re not afraid to get in the mix of front-end or server-side development, and learning a new language, tool, or framework is a challenge you’re excited to sink your teeth into. You’re no stranger to the importance of strong infrastructure, and willing to be part of production from metal to software. You embrace agility, above any one methodology (what does AGILE even mean anyway?).

What You’ll Be Doing
Working in collaboration with our Data Scientists and Product team, you’ll apply our core science to a wide variety of customer challenges.

You’ll be involved in taking an idea from concept to cash. This means prototyping (if required), writing code/tests in Clojure/Python/Java, making the necessary changes in ansible/terraform and shepherding it through various environments all the way to production.

You’ll play a valuable role in cross-functional team discussions and improving productivity.

You’ll build the software and solutions to ingest language data from various channels, analyze the data and visualize the results
You’ll help build prototypes to test out new product ideas, always looking for new ways to enhance the team and the potential of our products.

The Skill Set
You’re a polyglot programmer, comfortable working with several different languages

You’re an advocate for best practices in development, all the way through to production

You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and a strong sense of customer commitment
You have knowledge or experience in Unit Testing, Continuous Integration (CI) and deploying software in production environments using automation

You have a passion for the user’s experience and a commitment to the customer

Bonus points for…

Interest or experience in contributing to the open source community
An active interest in data engineering and NLP

Not quite the right fit?

If this role doesn’t quite line up with your experience or objectives, but you would love to be part of this growing team, please consider sharing your resume with us regardless! Above all else, Receptiviti is a culture of learning- a blend of unique strengths and aptitudes go a long way, and you may have something we’re missing from this description.

At this time, we are not accepting applications via recruitment agencies.

About Receptiviti

Committed to making diversity and inclusivity part of our culture, Receptiviti is an equal opportunity employer. We are passionate about providing a safe workplace where everyone is accepted and has the opportunity to grow with us.

Think you have what it takes to join an elite team of software developers, engineers, and data scientists? If you want to make your mark on a national brand’s industry-leading technology, Skip’s Engineering Team is the place for you. They drive the innovation of Skip’s platform by improving the reliability, performance, and scalability of the network. GPS tracking, real-time order processing, scheduling, and balancing are just a few of the pieces the Engineering Team integrates into Skip’s world-class service.

As a member of our Data team, you will be responsible for design and implementation of infrastructure components and software for systems that power Skip’s Business Intelligence and Machine Learning applications. Your experience with cloud infrastructure and big data provides you with the background to quickly implement changes. Your experience in data management and SQL allows you to contribute to the expanding expertise of the team and keep data components current as product feature change.

How we work:
We take ownership of our work, and work closely with our team
We move quickly, take risks, and know how to manage the risks
Regularly refactoring to improve our existing systems — technical debt isn’t an excuse
Unit tests and code reviews are at our core — confidence in our pull request is the result
We constantly push our app’s technology, design, and architecture forward to meet new challenges
We face challenges no one can predict — we meet them head on as a team
When we have an idea that serves a need, we run with it
Our teams are kept tight and efficient
What you'll be doing:
Implementing a scalable system for managing data flows at SkipTheDishes
Creating data pipeline components and semantic models to accommodate changes in source systems and new business requirements
Acting as a technical resource and contributing to overall solution design
Supporting production data systems in a fast-paced business environment
Trace through core system source code to identify how and when data are created and used in order to ensure accurate interpretation by non-technical data users
What will help you succeed:
Computer science or software engineering degree
Experience working with both large and real-time data
Mastery of SQL development and performance tuning
Experience working with tools, languages and protocols such as Kinesis, PySpark, Redshift, and/or columnar databases
Familiarity with Tableau, or other BI tools and/or data infrastructure
What it’s like to work at Skip:

At Skip, you have the opportunity to work with industry-leading technology in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. You can take part in building a major Canadian tech company that is growing every day — and you can grow with it. We will work with you to find your limits, and then help you surpass them. The more you contribute, the further you’ll go. Since establishing our Winnipeg headquarters in 2012, Skip has grown from less than 20 staff to a national brand with more than 1800 employees and processing millions of orders each month.

Vancouver, BC1QBit is dedicated to solving the world's most intractable challenges by recasting problems to harness the power of quantum computing. We identify intractable industry problems and apply breakthroughs in computation to machine intelligence and optimization science to build software that allows applications to continually benefit from advances in both quantum and classical hardware.

We believe that quantum technologies will form the next pillar of computational progress. We research, benchmark and build software development kits, online platforms, and applications that make the power of quantum computers accessible to researchers, developers and industry-leading organizations so they can solve their most difficult problems in fields such as optimization, simulation, and machine learning.

As an interdisciplinary team of world-class mathematicians, physicists, operations research scientists, computer scientists, software developers, computational chemists, and quantum computing experts, we share a curiosity and drive to uncover new ways of solving currently intractable problems using advanced classical and quantum systems.

Our work is guided by a shared set of values focused on five fundamental principles:


Audacity – A drive to pioneer and apply new methods. To dream without limit and then do the hard work of bringing your ideas into reality.
Open Thinking – A belief in the sharing of ideas. To approach each exploration with a receptive mindset and collaborate openly to produce the best possible results.
Interdisciplinary Collaboration – A respect for the diversity of people, backgrounds, and skills. A wide range of perspectives reveals a more complete landscape and yields deeper insights.
Ownership – A feeling of pride in the work of the team and a deep sense of purpose and accomplishment from your contribution.
Beginner's Mindset – A desire to improve as an expert while retaining the curiosity and openness that inspired you to begin.

Your Role

This is a unique opportunity for someone with a passion for working at the frontier of new technologies. As a Software Developer on our Machine Learning infrastructure team, you will have the opportunity to develop the computational platform and the in-house infrastructure of quantum and quantum-inspired machine learning tools created by this team. At the core of this role, you will be responsible for the following:


Integrating software solutions with both classical and quantum hardware
Collaborating with researchers to implement state-of-the-art algorithms in optimization theory, machine learning, and artificial intelligence
Collaborating with researchers on benchmarking hardware and software solvers
Working with 1QBit's internal teams as well as customers to build machine-learning powered APIs

What You'll Bring

Members of our team bring a confluence of personality, skills, and intent that contributes to their individual development and our collective growth as an organization. Here is the complementary knowledge and mindset you will bring to our team:


3+ years' experience with the full software lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and maintenance
A master's degree in computer science/engineering, or equivalent experience
Advanced proficiency and technical expertise with C++ and Python
Ability to provide highly scalable distributed implementations from a set of requirements arriving from research and professional services
Familiarity with software architecture and design, including design patterns
Knowledge of computational complexity and data structures
Knowledge of design and analysis of algorithms
Development experience in Unix-based environments and proficiency in Unix shell scripting
Experience with Git and related source control concepts
Experience contributing to the design and implementation of scientific software or in collaborating with researchers
A demonstrated proficiency writing software interfaces to be used by both internal and external clients
A demonstrated ability to successfully guide small projects from conception to completion
Self-motivation and the ability to take initiative and follow through reliably
A drive to proactively seek out opportunities to help move projects forward and contribute to their improvement
An openness to soliciting feedback to improve your performance and, in turn, continually providing input to team members to elevate team performance and contribute to 1QBit's culture
An eagerness to learn about new trends, tools, and technologies, and to continually consider how these will influence our projects, including the implications and opportunities that they will bring
A dedication to maintaining team unity success through open communication
A commitment to challenge the status quo, take smart risks, and be open to possible failure

Nice to haves:

Machine learning frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, Theano, Keras, PyTorch)
High performance computing platforms (GPU programming, FPGAs, etc.)
Experience setting up/operating distributed execution environments
Experience with Infrastructure as Code
Experience with containerized deployment technologies (specifically Docker)

Who You Are

You share our belief that principles, not policies, enable individuals and teams to apply their unique lens in making decisions. Like all 1QBit team members, you thrive in our flat hierarchy of empowered individuals. You embrace the rigorous examination of thoughts and work of diverse minds from multiple disciplines because you know it uncovers deeper insights and produces robust results. You believe there is no failure in exploration because new breakthroughs often require rigorous examination of multiple paths before a conclusion is reached. You have a desire to apply yourself to purposeful work that is inspiring, meaningful, and fun, to create value for the world by advancing the ability to solve complex problems. You have a relentless curiosity for exploring new methodologies and you have an intrinsic drive to architect the foundation of the quantum ecosystem because you love the challenges and understand the rewards that the next paradigm of computation will bring.

Toronto, ONJob Description
Sr. Research Scientist - NLP
Thomson Reuters is the Answer Company™. We provide authoritative content, advanced technologies and human expertise to help our customers find trusted answers. We enable professionals in the legal, tax and accounting, and media markets to make the decisions that matter most, all powered by the world's most trusted news organization.
Thomson Reuters is at the forefront of developing technology that will revolutionize how people access and use information by interacting with intelligent machines. The Cognitive Computing Center of Excellence is a newly-formed branch of Thomson Reuters R&D dedicated to advancing the state of the art in machine perception, reasoning, knowledge management and human-computer interfaces.
We are looking for candidates with innovative approaches and the expertise to combine and improve existing technologies into Cognitive Computing products that will help our professional customers find the answers they are looking for. Do you want to be part of a creative smart team working on leading edge problems along side other research scientists and engineers?
We are looking for a passionate Research Scientist with a proven record of applied innovation, who is interested in taking Artificial Intelligence technologies to the next level. We are looking for a creative individual who can understand complex business problems, and who can develop scalable algorithms and prototypes to demonstrate the art of possible.
Applicants should have significant experience in one or more of the following areas: Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Question Answering, Text Mining, Information Retrieval, Distributional Semantics, and/or Discourse Modeling.
Key Responsibilities
Design, implement and validate algorithms at scale to solve challenging real world problems
Collaborate with technologists and business stakeholders to drive innovation from conception to production
Qualifications and Experience:
PhD in Computational Linguistics, Computer Science, or related field, with 2+ years of relevant industry experience; Lead position will be considered commensurate with additional experience
Proficient programming skills in a high-level language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python, C/C++, Perl, Matlab, R)
Experience with statistical data analysis, experimental design, and hypotheses validation
Familiarity with probabilistic models and an understanding of the mathematical concepts underlying machine learning methods
Project-based experience with some of the following tools:
Applied machine learning (e.g. libSVM, Shogun, Scikit-learn or similar)
Natural Language Processing (e.g., ClearTK, ScalaNLP/Breeze, ClearNLP, OpenNLP, NLTK, or similar)
Statistical data analysis and experimental design (e.g., using R, Matlab, iPython, etc.)
Information retrieval and search engines, e.g. Solr/Lucene
Distributed computing platforms, such as Hadoop (Hive, HBase, Pig), Spark, GraphLab
Databases (traditional and noSQL)
Must be a self-motivated, lifelong learner, who is passionate about turning new ideas into solutions for our customers
Results-driven focus with the ability to prioritize deliverables that have the most significant, measurable impact
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Regina, SKExplore a different kind of company - one that offers exciting challenges and fulfilling rewards. We provide world-class engineering and scientific solutions to our clients in the Mining, Energy, Transportation and Development sectors. Our people come from a wide range of backgrounds and fields of study. They represent the best in their respective disciplines and specializations. Together, they make it possible to assemble multidisciplinary teams that provide clients with a full-service approach to their unique needs.


From our roots (as EBA Engineering Consultants), and now Tetra Tech Canada, we have progressively expanded since our inception in 1966 and, today, clients are served by more than 1000 engineers, scientists, technologists, and support staff from offices across Canada. We are a values-based consulting engineering and sciences company that offers exciting challenges and fulfilling rewards to our employees. Since 2010, we are part of the Canadian family of Tetra Tech (NASDAQ: TTEK) companies, with over 16,000 employees worldwide.


We are currently looking for a Laboratory Manager / Supervisor to join our Regina office. This position will involve working with Tetra Tech's project managers, technical experts and technologists in a laboratory environment performing testing for asphalt concrete, soils, concrete, aggregates and geotechnical investigations.


Responsibilities

Conducting and coordinating of a wide variety of materials testing programs and geotechnical investigations
Manage, organize and coordinate all incoming samples, including proper documentation.
Completing field and laboratory records for all asphalt concrete, soils, concrete, aggregate tests and geotechnical investigations as well as daily testing reports which detail the daily project materials testing activities
Managing the day-to-day operations of the lab in a safe and efficient manner
Ensuring that all laboratory data is entered and reports are prepared within project timelines and within budget
Supervising Laboratory Testing technicians including scheduling, mentoring, training, and developing internal resources
Preparing technical proposals and reports as required
Maintain, inspect and service all lab equipment.
Assist with the preparation of cost estimates.
Provide field-level support for civil works projects as required.
Maintain annual Canadian Council of Independent Laboratories (CCIL) certification in asphalt concrete, soils and aggregates, and concrete.


Qualifications
Graduation from a Civil Engineering College or University with a minimum of 5 years of experience or an engineering technology diploma with a minimum of 7 years of experience or a suitable combination of education and experience, a valid driver's license, and physically capable of carrying out the required work.
Candidates should have several years of related experience in laboratory testing on a variety of projects (transportation, civil municipal, commercial development, resource industries, utilities, building structures) with asphalt concrete, concrete, soils and aggregate.
Demonstrated supervisory/management experience, knowledge of regional market, local terrain/geotechnical conditions
Above average level of verbal communication and written skills (English) are required
Excellent time management skills, the ability to work with minimal supervision and manage and prioritize several assignments at one time, delivering on time and on budget
Must be proficient with MS Office and Excel
Certifications – CCIL certifications would be an asset.
Experience with asphalt plant calibrations and preparation of asphalt concrete mix designs would be an asset.
Applicants with experience in the equipping, set-up, programming and operating a material testing laboratory will be given preference
Membership or eligibility to be associated with SASTT or APEGS is preferred

Additional Information

All qualified candidates will be considered for the role and will be eligible for relocation allowance if selected (and are located outside of Regina).

A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.)

Job Description Summary
This position will work as part of the Procurement team. Overall duties will include supporting the team, reviewing purchase orders and working with external vendors. Other tasks will be performed as needed.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Process Purchase Orders in ERP system and vendors web portals
Extract information about Vendors, Purchase Orders, Lead Times etc. from the ERP system to perform data analysis
Prepare regular reports such as open Purchase Orders, overdue Purchase Orders, incomplete purchase orders
Obtain price quotes and validate pricing with suppliers. Contribute to team cost savings goals and document cost savings when appropriate
Complete entry of all data fields to create POs, correct/edit existing POs as needed, update and maintain Vendor information
Manage all aspects of the purchase from requisition to delivery. Follow-up with suppliers on any/all issues in a timely manner. Ensure on-time delivery by expediting orders, shipment tracking, resolving custom clearance issues, etc.
Assist internal customers on general inquiries, deliverables pertaining to placed orders, invoice reconciliation, and, general procurement related issues. Act as a partner and maintain open communication.
Communicate with supplier base to ensure that Stemcell’s purchasing and quality requirements are clearly understood
Acquire and maintain a general technical understanding of products and services purchased
May assist in performance of cost analysis and volume planning for blanket or standing orders
Provide support to other members of the Procurement group and Supply Chain Operations division in completing various procurement and cross-functional projects and deliverables
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Science, preferably in a discipline of Life Sciences
2- 4 years’ experience in Purchasing/Procurement, preferably in Biotech or Life Sciences Industry
Strong team player with excellent communication skills (within procurement and in cross-functional teams)
Customer Service focus to serve our internal customers and exceed their expectations
Excellent organizational and computer skills - experience with an ERP system such as VISUAL is a plus
Ability to meet deadlines in fast paced environment
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Research Assistant
The Sunnybrook Research Institute, fully affiliated with the University of Toronto, is seeking an applicant to fulfill a temporary, full-time position as Research Assistant under the supervision of Dr. Marc Jeschke. The position will be available for a one -year contract with expectation for renewal based on performance.
Dr. Marc Jeschke is a Senior Scientist, division of Biological Sciences at Sunnybrook Research Institute, and the director of the Ross Tilley Burn Centre (RTBC). This exiting research project links basic science with translational research in our cGMP facility. Hence, the applicant has to have a strong interest in advancing science for burn patients.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working under the direction of the Principal Investigator, the Research Technician will perform routine and moderately complex laboratory functions and experiments regarding to a clinical trial project. Duties include:
Have effective communications working with clinicians, clinical coordinator, research leaders, and GMP facility manager
Compiling data from related and/or unrelated sources
Conduct a variety of experimental tasks using wet-lab laboratory techniques
Help develop and edit relevant documents and SOP for Health Canada
Characterize cells using flow cytometer
Culture cell lines and mammalian primary cells with high aseptic techniques
Develop, optimize and extract cells from skin tissue samples
Supporting the day-to-day operations of the laboratory and collecting and processing of patient’s specimen
Give weekly presentations and updates regarding clinical trial project
QUALIFICATIONS:
At minimum, completion of a Master’s degree or equivalent in a health or science-related discipline
At minimum, -1 to 2 years of work experience in a laboratory setting in Academia and/or Industry
Ability to effectively work independently and as part of a team
Attention to detail and multi-task. Ability to handle multiple priorities.
Strong organizational skills
Problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Technical knowledge and skills to perform routine and standardized laboratory research techniques and procedures are required (e.g. media preparation, manual pipetting, preparation of samples for downstream experiments, nucleic acids extraction and evaluation)
Experienced in cell culture techniques and flow cytometry.
Strong understanding and interest in molecular biology and stem cell therapy
Competency in computer skills including data analysis software and developing high quality figures.
Qualified candidates are invited to submit a cover letter (brief description of research experience and interests) and CV to: Susan Kurtz
Email: susan.kurtz@sunnybrook.ca (with Research Assistant– cGMP in the subject line). We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Posting closing date: April 7 2019

If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Research Institute is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Good team player contributing to a strong and supportive team culture

job_title: Manager, Research Science, Smart Home SLU
job_description:
Vancouver, BCBasic Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a closely related field
5+ years of experience building and managing development teams that design and deliver machine learning capabilities
5+ years’ experience in delivering projects using Agile / Scrum methodologies
3+ years of direct people management experience including duties such as performance evaluation and career development
Experience as leader of a science team and developing junior members from academia/industry to a business environment.
Experience in managing and quantifying improvement in multiple business areas resulting from business analytics, optimization techniques, and/or statistical modeling.
Knowledge of various machine learning techniques and key parameters that affect their performance
Knowledge of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets, etc.

The Smart Home team is looking for a Research Science Manager who combines exceptional technical, research and analytical capabilities to lead a team that will be integral to the continued improvement of Amazon Alexa's features in customer's homes. As a Research Science Manager, you will be responsible for data-driven improvements and evaluation for our spoken language understanding (SLU) models. You will be responsible for leading a team of research scientists and data experts to build ML models for assessing Alexa’s success at Natural Understanding with accuracy, reliability, scalability to new languages & devices, low latency and limited dependence on manually annotated data. Your work will directly impact our customers in the form of products and services that make use of speech and language technology, particularly in developing predictive analytics models for user in continuously improving the Alexa experience for our customers.

This involves:

Conducting and coordinating process development leading to improved and streamlined processes for model development.
Ensuring data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including such areas as data sourcing/collection, ground truth generation, normalization, transformation, cross-lingual alignment/mapping, etc.
Providing technical and scientific guidance to your team members.
Presenting proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions
Communicating effectively with senior management as well as with colleagues from science, engineering and business backgrounds, in written and verbal forms
Supporting the career development of your team members.

The successful candidate will have an established background in defining metrics, building ML models, a strong technical ability, demonstrated experience in people management, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and the motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.

Software Engineer, CUDA

Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide retailers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.

Duration: Permanent

Location: Keele and Steeles (TTC Accessible, free parking)

Job Description

You will work with the lead scientist at Daisy Intelligence and act as a valued member of the Research & Development team. You will be conducting applied research in the areas of parallel computing, optimization, biomimicry, statistics, machine learning, reinforcement learning, visualization and numerical methods.

Daisy Intelligence solutions involve modeling vast volumes of our clients' data, which requires leading edge computing and machine learning methods. You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.

Key Accountabilities

Parallelization of existing Daisy artificial intelligence software
Software solution design, programming development and testing
Documenting and co-authoring internal technical specifications, and patents
Commercialization of successful applied research into software products that will be used by Daisy Intelligence delivery teams to service clients in the Retail, Insurance
Technical Skills

You possess a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, with a minimum three years experience
You have strong programming skills with a minimum of 1000 hours experience developing in C
Experience using CUDA in a GPU development environment is an asset
You have a working knowledge of database technologies with very strong SQL skills or ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data
Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++
Strong mathematical skills with knowledge/interest in machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced statistics, parallel computing and operations research
Knowledge of or interest in data visualization methods and technologies
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel
General skills and Attitude

You are an excellent learner who can quickly adopt to new technologies
You have an interest in solving complex business problems
You love collaborating in the creation of new and leading-edge technology
You possess strong English written and oral communication skills
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines
You desire to advance the world of machine learning and artificial intelligence
Skills & Qualifications:

Strong work ethic, and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery
Ability to find creative solutions to complex leading-edge problems
Comfortable with working in small, high performance teams
Ability to adapt new capabilities and grow your expertise
Perks

Annual performance bonus
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
Skills development
Flexibility
Start-up culture

Who We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.
BEworks is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are proud to be in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005 and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment (if applicable) process as required under BEworks' policies and procedures. Applicants must make their accommodation needs known when first contacted by the recruitment team.

Our Department of Paediatric Laboratory Medicine (DPLM) is currently seeking a Test Development Technologist to join the team. In collaboration with Scientists and Lab Directors, you will perform and be responsible for a variety of complex and independent tasks involving the planning, organizing, data analysis and implementation of laboratory test development activities. You will also provide technical support functions to assist medical laboratory technologists and other laboratory staff with laboratory operations as required. The Test Development Technologist will work in Molecular Genetics within Genome Diagnostics.
Here’s What You’ll Get To Do
Laboratory Test Development
Be part of a team that is using cutting-edge genomics technologies to improve the care for children with cancer and other diseases.
Develop new laboratory procedures/methods as assigned.

Burnaby, BCTitle: Research Associate - Chemistry

Location: Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada


Advance your career with a growing pharmaceutical company!
Use your science background to make a positive impact in the lives of others!
Competitive remuneration and benefits package!
About Medipure

Medipure’s mission is to revolutionize drug discovery and bring innovative and safe medication for the treatment of pain, anxiety and skin disorders. We bring novel prescription medicines to market, providing patients with serious conditions valuable solutions that improve quality of life through the development of safe and effective endocannabinoid-based therapeutics.

Through rapid cost-effective product development, by addressing market needs, and establishing strategic partnerships, we seek to maximize the value of our products and provide innovative treatments for targeted diseases. For information, please visit our website.

About the Opportunity

Medipure is rapidly growing and we have an exciting opportunity for a Research Associate - Chemistry to join our team at our lab in Burnaby (B.C., Canada) on a full-time basis. Considering the experience and satisfactory performance, this position may be fast-tracked to a Research Scientist position.

This position is ideal for someone who has experience in organic synthesis and wishes to learn new and advanced techniques in synthesis related to heterocyclic chemistry. He/She will also gain hands-on experience working with other scientists in organic synthesis, chromatography, and analysis.

Note: ONLY Applications submitted through our website will be considered for this position http://medipurepharmaceuticals.com/careers

Responsibilities:

You will,

Design and Perform organic synthesis and analysis as directed by the supervisor.
Execute the synthesis protocols and characterization of small molecules efficiently using NMR and LC/MS techniques
Synthesize key intermediates, final reagents, and starting materials to be used in R&D projects.
Optimize and validate synthetic routes and process development of the steps.
Scale-up (mg to gm scale) of the reagents/small molecules, and building an inventory of research-grade reagents/supplies to support R&D activities
Provide all documents necessary for Product Transfer to manufacturing.
Calibrate, validate and maintain equipment
Perform routine lab maintenance and assisting other scientists
Maintain an orderly laboratory environment in compliance with safety regulations and internal SOPs
Document information by maintaining daily logs and equipment record books.
Complete projects by assisting project team; attending and participating in group and project meetings
Follow corporate and laboratory standards and SOPs
Work under direct supervision of team leads and lab managers
Write scientific reports and present scientific data in weekly team meetings
The Ideal Candidate

In order to qualify for this role, you will have

MSc or Ph.D. degree in Organic or Medicinal Chemistry with a minimum of 3 to 5 years of relevant professional experience or BSc degree with relevant extensive industry experience and skills comparable to an MSc
Demonstrated ability to formulate and execute a medicinal chemistry research project
Strong academic and practical background in modern synthetic, organic or medicinal chemistry design and methodology
Experience in characterizing and purifying new molecules using various equipment and techniques
Experience in using spectroscopic methods (NMR, MS, IR, UV-Vis), titration, chromatography (Column/flash, TLC, UHPLC), distillation, extraction, and recrystallization techniques
Previous working experience in drug discovery R&D in the pharmaceutical industry is preferred
Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills
You will do well in this role if you have the ability to work independently and with limited supervision. Strong problem solving, troubleshooting, multitasking, and decision-making skills are essential, as is good time management and prioritization skills. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

Above all, you will have excellent written and verbal communications skills and the ability to give presentations as required. Strong team building, training, and coaching skills will be the key to your success in this role.

If you want to further develop your skills and build a long-term career with a growing company – Apply Today!

About the Benefits

Upon joining Medipure you will be welcomed into a dynamic and multicultural team. In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you will receive a competitive annual salary plus a comprehensive benefits package.

And that's not all! When you join Medipure, you will have the ability to define your own career path while working with an engaged and excited team.

help bring new products to market by working collaboratively with both R&D and Operations. The ideal
candidate will have experience in both scientific research and business, being able to analyze product
formats and formulations in order to improve efficiency and reduce waste. This position is an exciting
opportunity for a motivated candidate to join a rapidly growing team and contribute to a number of big
initiatives at STEMCELL.
Job Description
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Contribute to efficient product commercialization by working to reduce product cost and improve product design during development
Identify resource impacts of new products with the relevant designates, including cost analysis and format
Interact with cross-departmental team members to ensure projects or activities are progressing, including identifying and reporting roadblocks to ensure resolution in a speed-to-market environment

Product development work in biotech/pharma an asset

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Toronto, ONWattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 70 million people around the world spend over 15 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us!

We are looking for a Data/ML Engineer to join our Story DNA team. Our team includes engineers, data scientists, and a product manager. You will spend your time enhancing our existing product, or building new products to meet our moonshot goals. Our business is fast-paced, dynamic and evolves quickly, so you are versatile, adaptable, and are able to decompose complex problems.
What you'll be doing
Evolve Wattpad’s data infrastructureImplement scalable, robust data pipelines

Working collaboratively, and driving innovation within a multi-functional team
Communicate with technical and non-technical audiences alike

Practice agile principles, delivering experiences to our users continuously

Understanding of software engineering fundamentals and principles

Familiarity with data and ML tools including: TensorFlow, Hive, Spark, Kafka, scikit-learn, Keras, AirFlow, Luigi, RedShift, EMR
Strong debugging skills and not afraid to seek help when you get stuck
Obsessed about our users and how software impacts their lives
Grow and learn continuously, and amplifying those around you
Eager and take initiatives, leaving the campgrounds cleaner than you found it

Meaningful equity (stock options)

Hackathons
Health benefits, fully covered on us!

A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit
And a whole lot more!

About Wattpad

Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world.
What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse.
What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks.
How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time.


Culture and Diversity

Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period.

We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. Our team is as diverse and eclectic as the global Wattpad community. In case it’s not clear: we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

company_name: Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry
job_description:
$1,152 a weekTemporaryThe Wildlife Research & Monitoring Section (WRMS) of Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry in Peterborough is involved in all aspects of wildlife research. The city of Peterborough and surroundings offer a full range of facilities, amenities and services, retail stores, community centers, sports arenas, and outdoor activities. Housing is available for sale or rent.

What can I expect to do in this role?
Working with a wildlife research scientist on research activities including large mammal ecology, the intern will contribute to wildlife research and monitoring initiatives by managing data, performing statistical analyses and modelling, writing scientific reports and providing written and oral briefings to scientists, partners, and senior managers, conducting field work in remote locations and reviewing published literature.

How do I qualify?
Technical Knowledge:Knowledge of the theory, principles, and practices of the management of wildlife populations and habitat; population and habitat ecology of terrestrial vertebrate wildlife species; forest ecology and management; knowledge of survey design, field sampling methods and techniques associated with monitoring the status and trends of wildlife populations and habitat.Knowledge of sound data management principles to manage, process and analyse scientific data.Knowledge of statistical methods and tools, and the interpretation of analytical outputs to support monitoring and research objectives using wildlife population and habitat data to perform statistical analysis.Knowledge of safe working practices in field and laboratory settings and worker responsibilities under the OH&S Act.

Analytical and Research Skills:Analytical skills and experience conducting quantitative analysis of ecological data, including statistical and spatial analyses and modelling.Experience writing scientific papers and/or reports for publication.Strong organizational and interpersonal, skills to manage multiple projects, solve problems, and work with other staff and partners.Project management skills to develop project terms of reference and establish and meet required deliverablesDemonstrated ability to communicate scientific information clearly and concisely orally and in writing.Ability to work independently with periodic direction.

Computer SkillsExperience using databases to enter, manage, query, and manipulate data, including experience working with GPS radio collar data and population survey data.Demonstrated ability to use of personal computers and software, including word processing, spreadsheet and database applications (e.g. MS Word, Excel, Access), geographic information systems (e.g. ArcGIS), statistical analysis software (e.g. SPSS, R, Systat) to assess and analyze information for reports and presentations.

Additional Requirements:Valid Class G Driver's Licence or equivalent as recognized by the Province of Ontario.Ability to travel to remote field locations frequently and for multiple days.Physical ability to handle heavy equipment and work under adverse weather conditions.

Note
Successful candidates may be required to undergo an employment screening check in accordance with the Ontario Employment Screening Checks Policy.

EligibilityProof of eligibility to work in Canada;Has graduated or will graduate from an approved or legally authorized college or university with a degree, postgraduate certificate or diploma within the last four years;Candidates are only eligible to participate in one MNRF 12-month placement and must not have participated in the MNRF internship program in the past.

GALE is a business agency that brings together an equal balance of business consulting expertise & agency creativity to solve the world’s most complex marketing challenges.
