job_title: Senior Actuarial Manager, Personal Insurance Monitoring & Insights
job_description:
At Aviva, we are on a mission to rethink how we collect, review, and analyze data, by investing and building our teams to ensure we make the most of our data science assets. We aspire to be best in market, and we need bright and innovative actuaries and data scientists to help us think differently about our business and deliver on that ambition!
PURPOSE
Reporting to the VP Technical Pricing the Sr. Manager Personal Insurance Monitoring & Insights will provide forward looking insights into the personal insurance book of business and competitive position which will enable stakeholders to rapidly adapt and will drive actions to inform business decisions, improve profitability, growth and retention. This individual will challenge the business to outperform based on data driven insights and a deep understanding of our business
This individual is accountable for monitoring the quality of all Personal Insurance business and will deliver regular insights into any trends, changes or challenges which may impact future performance and position in the market. Activities will include:
Provide Senior Management a view on the quality of the book of business and any emerging trends which will impact business quality going forward
Providing Senior Management ongoing insight as to the competitiveness of Aviva’s book of business and any emerging trends which will impact key performance indicators going forward.
Monitoring the impact of business decisions including rate or underwriting changes to ensure the impact is in line with expectations
Analyzing changes or new initiatives made in the market and provide insight as to the impact on the Personal Insurance book of business
Work with analytics group to develop robust and automated monitoring framework
Support regional pricing and business development teams in understanding their mix of business and competitive position and advising on adjustments as needed
Support regional pricing and business development teams in analyzing retention, growth and profitability with an objective to improve business quality
Lead regular meetings with senior leadership highlighting insights observed during the reporting period, root causes and stimulating active discussion and debate
Partner with Segment Managers and Regional Pricing Managers and challenge the business to outperform against targets and deliver on its strategic imperatives
Provide ad hoc analysis for deep dives into key areas where additional insight is required
Support VP Technical Pricing and Personal Insurance Leadership in providing insights and transparency in to the quality of the personal insurance book of business to other senior leaders within the organization.
Customer Centric:
Foster strong relationships with Actuarial Pricing, Segment Managers, Business Development and Performance Management to ensure understanding and effective and efficient delivery of stakeholder needs.
Promote high performance culture built on joint accountability, collaboration, work ethic, positive attitude and desire to challenge for greater goals and continuous improvement.
QUALIFICATIONS
Post-secondary education in Mathematics, Statistics or Actuarial Science
ACAS designation
5-7 years Actuarial experience
 Minimum of 3 years pricing experience including leading a mix of actuary and non-actuary teams
 At least 2 years management experience preferred
Strong negotiation skills with the ability to build consensus and influence effectively.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to communicate clear, concise and on the mark analysis and commentary to target audiences.
Ability to distil large amounts of data into key insights and areas of opportunity
Hands-on as well as managerial experience in scripting/coding including in modern languages like Python and R
Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships with business functions and executive business partners.
Superior analytical skills with an insatiable desire to probe, question, validate and challenge to ensure accurate and insightful analysis.
Superior change agent skills with the ability and appetite to drive continuous improvement in cross functional finance processes and insights to better support the business.
Superior organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently in a fast paced environment, while adhering to strict deadlines.
Deep understanding of the Property & Casualty Insurance business
* This position is available in either Markham or Toronto locations *
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Hiring Manager: Kristen Gill
Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. Multiple Positions and Levels
BlueRock Therapeutics is a next-generation regenerative medicine company focused on breakthrough treatments and new horizons in medicine. BlueRock Therapeutics’ platform is based on state-of-the-art pluripotent stem cell engineering tools and expansion technology. The company represents a strategic partnership between Bayer and Versant Ventures, and has been granted access to one of the largest-ever Series A financings in biotech.
Our vision at BlueRock is to cure cardiovascular, neurologic and other diseases with significant unmet need and diminished self-repair potential. Our platform is enabled by strategic partnerships with leading academic and industry collaborators in the U.S., Canada and Japan.
BlueRock`s ambition is to have an R&D team of dynamic and highly engaged top scientists who are inspired to take project ownership and further develop themselves in one of the most rapidly growing scientific fields. At BlueRock we value open communication, collaboration and a positive and fun working environment in which both individual and team contributions are recognized. Our world-class management team is committed to fostering the growth and career development of employees.
The Toronto, Canada site is seeking to fill multiple Research Associate (Stem Cell Biology) positions in the Process Development team. The incumbent will be a key laboratory member in a dynamic and progressive team pioneering scaled manufacturing processes for the generation of therapeutic cells from pluripotent stem cells. Hands on experience with mammalian cell culture and corresponding analytical techniques are essential. Preferably, you have experience with pluripotent stem cell culture and differentiation, and/or primary cell culture. Familiarity with bioreactor technologies, cell culture process development, and cGMP manufacturing requirements are a plus.
This is an outstanding opportunity to contribute to bringing a new class of cell-based medicines to patients. Collaboration with a highly-motivated, world-class team of scientists and engineers promises an exciting and engaging work environment for motivated, self-starting candidates.
Position Description:
Participate in design and execution in vitro experiments to develop and characterise scalable processes for cultivation of pluripotent stem cells and derivatives.
Identify and determine appropriate ranges for (critical) process parameters for cell culture and downstream processing to optimize product yield and quality.
Develop and optimize processes and systems to scale production of PSCs and derivatives in a cGMP compliant manner.
Analyze and document experimental data in electronic laboratory notebooks in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with the company quality management system.
Prepare and follow standard operating procedures, batch records and other process documentation.
Present scientific data to colleagues at internal meetings.
Minimum Requirements:
MSc. In biological sciences, biological engineering, or similar.
Extensive mammalian cell culture and cell characterisation experience. Preferably, human pluripotent stem cell culture and differentiation, and/or primary cell culture experience.
Experience with, and functional understanding of cell characterisation methods and technologies (e.g., flow cytometery, qPCR, immunoassays, microscopy).
Demonstrated ability to plan experiments and independently execute complex tasks.
Excellent data recording and analysis skills, including statistical treatment of data.
Strong English written and verbal communications skills.

Design, develop, test, advocate, evangelize and build data-driven products that help our customers improve business decisions. You will provide insight into analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles.
Responsibilities
Understanding and worked with database systems.
Understanding and worked with machine learning algorithms.
Perform feature analysis.
Develop ontology for key market segments.
Develop outcome/event taxonomy for key business models.
Build utility code and handle miscellaneous support tasks.
Documenting software projects and maintaining project documentation.
Working in a team environment as well as working alone.

Experience with Big Data, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, machine learning and/or deep learning.
Python programming skills with two (2) years or more of Python experience.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary
The Research Assistant will report to the Principal Investigator (PI). Dr. Rennick is a Nurse Scientist at the Montreal Children’s Hospital, and holds cross-appointment at the Ingram School of Nursing and the Department of Pediatrics, Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. Dr. Rennick’s research focuses on the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) hospitalization experience, and includes studies measuring children’s psychological outcomes, and using mixed methods approaches to improve PICU experiences in collaboration with parents, health care staff, and children.

The Research Assistant will assist the PI with a variety of research-related and administrative tasks. The Research Assistant will be involved at various times in development and implementation of research studies, writing of reports, academic papers, and presentations, and other administrative and research support functions as needed. The successful candidate will become familiar with the PI’s overall program of research, and will have a flexible approach to involvement across multiple projects. There may be opportunities for joint authorship of academic papers or presentation, this will be negotiated based on the successful candidate’s contributions on an ongoing basis.

General Duties

Conducting literature searches, preparing literature reviews and summaries,
Maintain Endnote databases and manage references in various documents,
Contribute to drafting and editing of study protocols and procedures,
Assist with preparation of ethics submissions, updates, and renewals,
Assist with organization and implementation of research projects,
Assist with data analysis with direction from the PI,
Drafting and editing papers, and preparing manuscripts for publication,
Drafting abstracts, posters, and presentations,
Liaise with health care professionals and investigators,
Work with student Research Assistants as required, including providing orientation and training, and collaborating with student Research Assistants to accomplish research tasks as above,
Manage and update project timelines, maintain record of ongoing projects,
Draft annual reports, contribute to maintaining the PI’s CV and related records,
Maintain and organize filing,
Monitor research budgets,
Translate, edit, and format documents,
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.

Website of the organization
https://rimuhc.ca/en

Education / Experience
Education

Preference will be given to candidates with a graduate degree in nursing, or an undergraduate degree in nursing and an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Candidates with a graduate degree in a relevant health or social science, or with an undergraduate degree and an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience, will also be considered.

Skills and Experience

Research,
Experience in a health research environment,
Excellent literature search skills,
Training and experience in qualitative methods and analysis,
Training and/or experience in quantitative analysis and/or mixed methods an asset,
A publication record including peer reviewed health research publications an asset,
Communication,
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills,
Excellent writing skills,
Fluency in written and spoken English and French,
Interpersonal,
Experience, sensitivity, comfort, and attention to confidentiality in dealing with issues faced by children and families in a complex health care setting or similarly high stress/intensity environment,
The ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team,
Organizational,
The ability to multi-task and manage concurrent involvement in multiple projects,
The ability to plan and manage workload within tight deadlines,
The ability to work autonomously,
Technical,
Excellent computer skills (Microsoft Office and Endnote required, SPSS, NVivo an asset).

Interested candidates should send a cover letter, CV, a list of three (3) references, and one or two examples of their writing.
Additional information
Status : Temporary, twelve (12) month renewable contract, part-time
Pay Scale : Salary to be determined based on experience and qualifications.
Work Shift : 8-12 hours/week, flexible schedule
Work Site : Montreal Children’s Hospital and Centre for Outcomes Research and Evaluation (adjacent to Glen site).

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

job_title: Senior Cloud Application Architect, Privacy Analytics
job_description:
Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.
Headquartered downtown in the heart of the National Capital region (Ottawa), Privacy Analytics is a one-of-a-kind health data analytics company. Privacy Analytics is a world leader setting the bar of data de‐identification, and we have translated this patented research into an amazing offering of products and services that enables researchers around the world to access and analyze healthcare data while ensuring that individuals’ identities are protected.

Even though our customers include 7 of the top 10 Fortune 500 healthcare organizations, we’ve remained loyal to the entrepreneurial and innovate spirit that drove the founding of the company and continues to permeate our office and culture. And, with our parent company IQVIA, the world leader in human data science, we’re getting the extra clout to further our leadership position in the data privacy space.

Our Java and Scala-based flagship product sits on the cutting edge of technology. It’s a scalable, distributed enterprise engine built on Apache Spark that processes terabytes of data to conduct both mathematical calculations and data transformations. The work we do spans the entire spectrum of enterprise feature development, data analytics at scale, UI design and development, statistical modelling, and algorithm design all the way down to low-level algorithmic optimizations. We tackle technical problems that will engage and challenge the brightest minds, and we have very big ambitions ahead of us for which we’re expanding our team.

The role:

Our Engineering team is growing fast, and with this growth comes opportunity for a strong Cloud Application Architect to make a real difference. You will be working in a team of highly talented Engineers and Data Scientists. Your main responsibility will be to help shape the cloud architecture and product implementation, as well as overall cloud strategy. In addition, you will:
Drive cloud application design, development, deployment, management and monitoring, following best-practices
Develop reliable, scalable and high-performing application code in one of the following languages/frameworks: Java, OSGI, Spring Cloud, JavaScript / Angular / Node.js
Work in a cross-functional team alongside talented Software Engineers, and in close collaboration with DevOps and QA engineers
Stay up-to-date with evolving cloud technologies and development best-practices including open source software.
Oversee coding standards and best practices for Cloud
Mentor colleagues within the team
Work in an Agile Environment

Our ideal candidate:

BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field
15+ years in the SW Engineering industry, proficient in Java and SQL
Minimum of 3 years extensive working knowledge in a major cloud environment (AWS or Azure) and SaaS Enterprise Application development
Strong hands-on technical and architectural experience with cloud technologies, including private and public platforms
Deep knowledge of Security requirements for Cloud environments and applications is key as we operate in the privacy field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience working in an Agile environment using Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) •
Proven ability to drive automation at all levels from testing to deployment.
Capable of navigating technical and functional ambiguity and making progress with under-defined requirements
Experience refactoring code with high-availability, scale and production in mind.
Familiar with Python, Unix/Linux, Git, Jenkins, Junit.
Knowledge of these technologies would be considered a strong asset:
Databricks, HDFS, Azure DW, Redshift, Hadoop Cloudera/MapR/Hortonworks, Elastic MapReduce on AWS, Apache Spark, Hive/Impala and HDFS, NoSQL databases
Privacy Analytics is an equal opportunity employer and accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.
Please note, we thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Unfortunately, we do not accept phone calls.
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled'
We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! We invite you to join IQVIA™

job_title: Scientifique en recherche de matériel informatique / Hardware Research Scientist
Research Scientist / Software Engineer, Department of Computer Science, Faculty of Science
job_description:
Position Overview
The Department of Computer Science in the Faculty of Science invites applications for a Research Scientist/Software Engineer. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 2 years (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.
The Interactive Graphics, Visualization & Analytics (illustrares) research group (Department of Computer Science, University of Calgary, Canada) is currently seeking a Research Scientist / Software Engineer.

The illustrares group is a multi-disciplinary team working on fundamental and applied research of Interactive Visual Computing technologies (Computer Graphics, Visualization, Visual Analytics, and Human-Data & Computer Interaction) and Applied Mathematics to problems and data from multi-disciplines in science and engineering.
This position of Research Scientist / Software Engineer is intended to contribute to the Rapid Reservoir Modelling (RRM) Joint Industry Project (JIP) www.rapidreservoir.org. The RRM-JIP is a multi-disciplinary, multi-national project to develop rapid reservoir modelling algorithms and software for prototyping complex reservoir geoscience & engineering models, using novel, interactive, modelling techniques, exploratory visualization, and numerical analysis. The RRM-JIP has teams from academia here at the University of Calgary and the UK and industry partners from Canada, Brazil, USA, Norway, and the Netherlands.
Position Description
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
Work closely with our current team and other RRM-JIP teams from academia and industry to design, implement and integrate new ideas, feedback received from earlier software prototypes released.
Provide skilled technical procedures to conduct research and development on topics ranging from visualization, computer graphics (modelling and rendering), human-data and computer interaction, and application of these skills to geoscience and petroleum engineering.
Provide training and guidance to postdoctoral fellows and graduate students in Computer Science on the specific aspects of interactive visualization and software engineering practices that are necessary for the correct development of the RRM JIP.
Bridge the gap between the faculty and Reservoir Geoscience & Engineering in partner institutions to address the complexities that arise with the inherent multidisciplinary aspects of the RRM JIP.
Liaise with industry sponsors and other team members, as well as, integrate software developed by the RRM JIP partners (from industry and academia) into the main software deliverables.
Report research contributions via writing and presenting research achievements at peer-reviewed computer science (either as graphics, visualization, human-computer interaction) and other applied venues.
Apply software engineering and code integration methods in multiplatform programming languages and tools framework including C++, Qt, and OpenGL.
Break that work down into suitable software designs and system architectures;
Iteratively implement the solution as part of a team;
Deliver high-quality through rigorous software testing and continuous integration;
Provide suitable documentation so our peers, academic collaborators and industry partners can understand your solutions;
Refine our software practices based on what we learn.
Help drive our team towards excellence in how we build and manage software applications.
Advocate for new software technologies and techniques that help solve our RRM problems.
Execute all aspects of software development (requirements, design, implementation, testing) on both short and long-term aspects of the RRM.
Make technical decisions that balance the needs of existing RRM prototypes and releases with those of new ones
Qualifications / Requirements:
Ph.D. (preferred) or M.Sc. in Computer Science or Mathematics, with specialization in Visualization and Computer Graphics and 5+ years of experience, including industrial and/or postdoctoral experience in Computer Science and/or Mathematics,
Minimum of 5 years experience and strong skills with multiplatform programming languages and tools such as C++, Qt, and OpenGL.
Proven experience with distributed source control system (i.e., git) and project build systems (i.e., cmake)
Proven experience in the development and code integration in medium to large software projects in science/engineering, with a preference towards Earth Sciences and/or Petroleum Engineering.
Demonstrated experience in interacting directly with researchers and professionals from both industry and academia.
Demonstrated communication, presentation, organization, problem solving and interpersonal skills.
Plan, design, develop, manage, document, test, deploy, and support new and existing modules (i.e., experience with the full software development lifecycle)
Excellent understanding of object-oriented design and coding
Provide code review, debugging, troubleshooting and optimizations
Identify and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions
Liaise with sponsors, team members and collaborators to collect documentation of user's requirements
Create and implement new deliverables from the collected user requirements
Coordinate implementation, tests, and integration with multi-disciplinary teams (i.e., computer science, geologists and petroleum engineers)
Resolve issues proactively to deliver high quality features
Proven experience with on designing graphical user interfaces.
Proficiency in 3D visualization and GPU programming methods.
Familiarity with research and development toward interactive modelling, visualization, visual analytics, and human-data & computer interaction projects in science/engineering/content creation, with a preference towards the applied domains of Earth Sciences and/or Petroleum Engineering.
Knowledge of sketch-based interfaces and modelling (SBIM) and geometric modelling techniques.
Understand the state of the art of interactive visualization techniques that appear in geoscience and petroleum engineering to bridge the gap between the modelling requirements of the RRM JIP and its use in numerical analysis for computational flow dynamics.
Publication record in leading, peer-reviewed computer graphics, visualization, mathematics conferences, and journals, including in the domains of geoscience and petroleum engineering.
Experience on presenting software topics (training, conference talks, etc.)
Application Deadline: April 23, 2019
We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
Additional Information
This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the Technical Job Family, Phase II.
To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website. For more information about the Faculty of Science visit Careers in the Faculty of Science.
About the University of Calgary
The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

Regular-Full time

Job Description

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer.
In this role, you will work in a client project environment with an AI-Agile Team composed of a Product Manager, consultant, Delivery Team Lead and Data Scientist and contribute to the translation of complex AI/data science algorithms into scalable software. Core duties are:
Design, code, create tests, and integrate new features and functionality

Duties
The successful candidate will advance the science of predicting, measuring and improving naval ship structural vibrations and the resulting acoustic noise associated with onboard machinery, hydrodynamic excitation, and propeller operation. They will implement those techniques within more holistic simulations of naval platform signatures and performance. They will also advance the science of acoustic signature measurement and suppression within the broader context of onboard naval ship signature management systems.
The successful candidate will develop expertise, create knowledge and conduct research in support of the Canadian Armed Forces. This includes planning and executing experimental research activities, such as laboratory tests and field or sea trials, as well as developing and applying custom and commercial hardware and/or software for scientific modeling, data collection and analysis. In addition to the execution of longer term research projects, they will provide scientific consulting services and recommendations to the Canadian Armed Forces.

The successful candidate will report their research results through reports, peer-reviewed journal and conference papers, verbal presentations and briefings. They will monitor worldwide developments in science and technology in order to identify and assess trends in their field of research. They will also be involved in formulating, implementing and managing large research projects, often involving international partners, industry, academia and consortia.

In carrying out the research program, the successful candidate will supervise and provide guidance to technical staff, contractors and students. They will also participate in national and international scientific meetings and conferences.
Intent of the process
The immediate need will be to staff one position for a specified period of one year.

A pool of qualified or partially qualified candidates may be established from this process and may be used to staff similar positions where tenure, language requirements and security requirements may vary according to the position to be staffed
Positions to be filled: 1
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
A covering letter in 500 words (maximum)
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
Education

Master’s degree (or graduating with a Master’s degree by August 30, 2019), from a recognized post-secondary institution in engineering, naval architecture, physics, or engineering physics, with concentration on acoustics and structural vibration. Grade point average (GPA) must be at least 80%.
Degree equivalency
Experience:

Experience developing and executing a research project to completion.Experience writing and having published peer-reviewed scientific publications, such as a master’s or doctorate thesis, journal papers, or conference papers.Experience in the application of analytical, numerical or experimental methods to predict the structural vibrations or radiated noise of structural or mechanical systems.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)

Grade point average (GPA) must be at least 80%.
Degree equivalency

At Plenty of Fish we are designing new features and redesigning our applications to make the experience of our millions of active users even better.

We are searching for a data-driven Technical Product Manager to facilitate the design, development, and strategy for a key part of our core product experience in our mobile and web applications. We are looking for someone who can understand complex social dynamics and ecosystems, identify new opportunities to deliver great value and excite our users, who is adept at defining and executing a product roadmap, and who will inspire key stakeholders to work towards a common vision.

Above all else, we are looking for someone who is passionate about relationships, who can empathize with our users, and create the best experience possible for them.

Sound like you? Great. We want to hear from you.

What will you do?

You create and define the "What" and the "Why" as you consume information, both qualitative and quantitative, processing it into a vision and communicating and championing it, while working with the development and design teams who focus on the "how" and "when".

This includes:

End-to-end ownership of your product domain
Leading your cross-functional team to discover and write the job stories, specs, and acceptance criteria for new features and improvements
Conducting rapid iteration, starting with prototyping, all the way through to production A/B experiments then full roll out
Prioritizing the backlog and day to day work for your cross-functional team (Design, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Engineers, and Ops) to deliver business and customer value on a regular cadence
Monitoring key benchmarks, analytics, and experiment results every day to ensure the health of your product

What does our ideal candidate look like?


Commercial experience as a Product Manager
Proven history of making data-driven decisions to prioritize and ship products
Experience leading a cross-functional/agile team
Self-starter and independent decision maker
A natural communicator and active listener, who can inspire a team and share a vision to execs
Advanced technical acumen with the ability to dive deep into technology with the Software Engineering team
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills

Bonus Points:

Computer Science Degree or equivalent experience as an Engineer
Experience with a B2C or marketplace platform product
Experience with Design Thinking
Engineering Management experience
Startup experience

Why POF?

At Plenty of Fish, the foundation of our success has always been our people, and their dedication to making connections and conversations happen for our users.

Since 2003, we've been growing a team of passionate, driven individuals to build and enhance our platform that's used by millions of people all over the world, every single day.

We've gotten to where we are by cultivating a high-performance culture, operating responsibly, and investing in our technology and our people. At Plenty of Fish, we embrace our work and relish a cause for celebration.

Alentic Microscience Inc.

Located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Alentic Microscience Inc. (Alentic) is developing a revolutionary new approach to medical diagnostics.

The Developer, Machine Vision Learning (Developer) works with scientists, engineers and other technical team members to advance the design of an embedded system which applies machine learning and computer vision to in-vitro diagnostics. This position will include responsibility for development team oversight and mentorship of junior developers as the team grows. The Developer is responsible for designing fully functioning, debugged code with required documentation that meets development goals.

Required Competencies

Quality Orientation
Time Management
Creative and Innovative Thinking
Development and Continual Learning
Problem Solving
Accountability and Dependability
Decision Making and Judgement
Providing Consultation
Planning and Organizing
Mathematical Reasoning
Communication
Team Work
Job Requirements

Responsibilities

Work with scientists and other technical team members to solve challenging, multidisciplinary problems.
Cross-validate hyper-parameters of neural network models on image data on a graphics processing unit GPU.
Implement efficient image processing pipelines.
Design, code, and test major features in collaboration with Team Members, Design Engineers, Documentation Specialists, Application Scientists, and other members of the development and technical team to deliver complex changes.
Maintain and modify existing applications.
Provide design documents and documentation to ensure efficient maintenance and code reuse.
Ensure the functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, realistic implementation schedules and system architecture for each assignment.
Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.
Provide recommendations for improvements in the overall development process.
Implement software modules, on the embedded platform and analysis workstation.
Ensure work progress to schedule and keep (internal) customers informed of the project's progress.
Stay current with trends, techniques, technology and other factors impacting the job.
Actively participate in team meetings and offer recommendations /ideas on design projects.
Ideal Skills, Experience, and Attributes

Non-trivial exposure to machine learning and/or computer vision.
Bachelor's degree, Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent job experience.
Interact with scientists to solve challenging, multidisciplinary problems.
Minimum 2 years' experience as a Developer working with hardware devices in military or medical applications or equivalent products.
Minimum of 2 years' experience in a technical software development role.
Ability to develop and understand and / or experience with Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) / connectionist systems, ideally when working with image data.
An understanding of and ideally experience with the implementations of an image processing pipeline (e.g. software, FPGA or other).
Able to work in a Linux based environment.
Strong coder in C and C++.
Ability to decipher, analyze and amend existing code.
Minimum 2 years' experience in requirements analysis, design, coding and unit testing of scalable, distributed, fault-tolerant applications.
Knows how to create efficient image processing pipelines.
Able to cross-validate hyper-parameters of neural network models on image data on a GPU.
Ability to write a Linux kernel driver for an image sensor.
Can create an embedded Linux environment on an ARM board.
Able to modify a microcontroller firmware to control sensors and actuators.
Able to effectively communicate technical concepts to other technical staff members.
Able to effectively communicate with non-technical members of the organization.
Demonstrated aptitude for learning new technologies.
Effective written and verbal communication skills as well as presentation skills.
Able to work well under pressure and meet set deadlines.
Ability to follow through and complete overlapping projects.
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts.
Compensation

Alentic offers a competitive salary and benefits package.

About Halifax

Halifax, capital of Nova Scotia and the largest Canadian city east of Quebec, offers an unparalleled standard of living, with a thriving cultural scene, easy access to recreational opportunities including the unspoiled Atlantic coast, low cost of living and superb educational resources.

If this opportunity sounds like you please submit your resume and cover letter. This posting will remain open until filled.

Please note that we will not be responding to all candidates expressing interest in the position.

Vancouver, BCMastercard's Cyber & Intelligence organization develops and delivers world-class security products and services for customers across the globe. NuData Security predicts fraudulent transactions by identifying good users from bad, based on their online behavior. By analyzing over 38 billion behaviors annually, NuData harnesses the power of behavioral and biometric analysis to empower its clients to predict fraud and verify the user behind the device. This allows clients to predict fraud before a critical decision, reduce customer insult, and investigate bad actors efficiently.



Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in our Vancouver office. This is a key role within the team responsible for developing NuData’s Biometrics and Behavioural modelling, and you’ll have exciting responsibilities, including:


Developing machine learning models in collaboration with an agile, high-functioning team.
Spotting new opportunities in data collection, feature creation, feature selection, model tuning and evaluation practices, then taking those ideas from first concepts to live product integrations.
Implementing effective monitoring and benchmarking for models and identifying gains from detailed analysis of massively parallel model deployments.
Incubating new research in data modelling to identify opportunities, pioneering the algorithms and systems that become key commercial products.




All About You

Ideally, you’re:

Experienced in deploying machine learning models to solve real problems and generate competitive edge. Ideally you have successfully developed, deployed, monitored and iterated over production models in business contexts.
An innovative solution architect – we’re looking for someone who can design an effective machine learning solution and who has the vision to see what the next generation model might look like.
A capable coder, able to write well-abstracted, reusable code in Python, R or Java. You’re experienced with web services (e.g. EC2, EMR, Lambda, Sagemaker, Glue, Kinesis, Redshift), and machine learning tools (e.g. Tensorflow, Keras, MXNet, Gluon).
Statistically adept. You have the depth of knowledge required to identify appropriate techniques, follow and create formal proofs, define apt performance measures and adeptly explore or transform data. Ideally you have studied in a quantitative field at a Doctoral or Masters level.
Experienced working with large data sets. You understand the benefits of batch processing and parallelization and know how to design a pipeline to scale out machine learning workflows. Ideally you have experience working with Spark.
An effective communicator in visual, verbal and spoken channels, able to identify a narrative in complex data and produce clear, actionable findings.
It also helps if you are:

Collaborative. We do our best work as a team, which means sharing, being open to support and giving constructive input.
Evidence-based. We work to eliminate assumptions and test our hypotheses, and we value rigor.
Responsible. We offer the opportunity to drive major projects that protect consumers every day, internationally. We are looking for colleagues who care about that.
Motivated. We’re a team of data scientists with personal and collaborative side projects, and we’re looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.

AECOM is a premier, fully integrated professional and technical services firm positioned to design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets around the world for public- and private-sector clients. With nearly 100,000 employees — including architects, engineers, designers, planners, scientists and management and construction services professionals — serving clients in over 150 countries around the world, AECOM is ranked as the #1 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine’s annual industry rankings, and has been recognized by Fortune magazine as a World’s Most Admired Company. The firm is a leader in all of the key markets that it serves, including transportation, facilities, environmental, energy, oil and gas, water, high-rise buildings and government. ACNO was established and incorporated as a Canadian business in April 2017 for the sole purpose to be AECOM’s nuclear business leader and integrator of AECOM’s broad base of offerings for the primary Nuclear Clients in Canada. ACNO integrates resources from the AECOM internal services groups represented in the organization (Construction Services, Management (Government) Services and Design and Consulting Services), which allows us to offer a broader base of nuclear expertise and subject matter experts over a project’s duration.

Imagine working on rewarding projects within a diverse culture, and having access to exceptional training and career development opportunities. Responsibilities:
Support the Vice President of Engineering by providing Engineering Products, including but not limited to Designs, Analyses, and other Technical Products. The position is accountable to:

+ Able to learn and use basic CAD sketching tools.

+ Has an advanced level of knowledge of discipline’s material costs and of cost analysis and forecasting.

+ Fully understands and assists with the planning and scheduling of engineering tasks within a specific discipline.

+ Fully versed in the project change control process and can identify a potential change.

+ Has an advanced level of knowledge of discipline’s equipment and material lists, and has the ability to instruct others in understanding their use and requirements.

+ Maximizes the integration of all project functional requirements into a complete project plan.

+ Maintains positive working relationships with peer leaders.

+ Builds productive relationships with organizations in and external to Engineering.

Minimum Requirements

The skills and knowledge to execute this role are usually acquired through 15+ years of experience in a Design Engineering environment. The individual would possess good written and verbal skills and an ability to influence and interact with all Management Levels. Specifically the individual would have a:

+ Demonstrated an ability to manage a technical group of 20 or more, with some lower levels of supervision as direct reports.

+ Demonstrated a good technical understanding of Nuclear Power Plant Operation

+ Demonstrated a good understanding of the Canadian Regulatory Environment and its requirements pertaining to Power Plant Operation ,

+ Demonstrated in depth understanding of the practical application of engineering principles in their discipline and the general application of Engineering Principles in other disciplines.

+ Specific understanding of the Codes and Standards in their specific discipline and a general knowledge of codes in other disciplines

+ Completed and maintained ASME Section III Appendix XXIII qualifications (Mechanical)A 4 year degree in Engineering and be a registered and practicing Professional Engineer.

+ An advanced degree is desirable

job_title: Head of Data Solutions and Analytics
job_description:
Head of Data Solutions and Analytics-014190
Description
Siemens Canada is building tomorrow’s talent. That’s Ingenuity for life.

For more than 100 years in Canada, Siemens has been offering engaging and sustainable employment opportunities to those shaping our future. It’s our tradition to promote lifelong learning, develop talent and recognize success.

Siemens is proud to be one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers 2018 (eight times total), one of Canada’s Greenest Employers 2018 (six times total) and one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2018 (two times total).

Approximately 4,300 employees across Canada work together to deliver solutions for sustainable energy, intelligent infrastructure, healthcare, and the future of manufacturing. We stand for engineering excellence, innovation, reliability and responsibility.

Enlighted has built the leading Building IoT platform with 200 million square feet of installations. These installations were initially sold on an Energy ROI with a promise of future applications. Enlighted is looking to develop applications to leverage its installed base and create customer value utilizing the available data. The candidate will collaborate with partners and end customers to develop SaaS value propositions and implement and deploy proof of concepts.

The Head of Data Solutions and Analytics will report to the CTO. S/he will lead and build a global team of technical marketing engineers and data scientists . S/he will define Enlighted’s strategy and technology direction for the data analytics and solutions, execute on that strategy, grow and develop the team, and influence and collaborate with stakeholders throughout the company. This leader will be expected to learn about existing building technologies and interfaces (Fire, Life-safety, BMS, Asset Tracking) and be current on a variety of big data technologies, and exercise excellent judgment in whether, when and how to adopt these technologies for Enlighted and our customer needs. S/he should be able to recommend Build, Buy vs Partner options for going to market.

Responsibilities:
Driving Results: Sets dramatic, compelling goals and aggressive schedules for improvement. Pursues long-term goals while delivering positive growth in the short-term. Translates the vision of the organization into actionable, quantitative plans. Conveys a sense of urgency, drives issues to closure, and relentlessly executes.
Strategic and Analytical Thinking: Can take a long-term view of the opportunity beyond the tactical and assess disparate data streams and distill them into meaningful and, ultimately, actionable strategic recommendations. Translates data into focused insights and strategies. Poses questions that provoke different thinking about the business. Quickly sees hidden value and how to unlock it. Navigates confidently in ambiguous situations. Makes rapid course corrections when business conditions change; cuts losing initiatives. Able to “deep dive” into the details of the business while staying focused on the big picture and not suffering from “analysis paralysis.”
Managing Teams and Performance: Translates overarching business goals into specific objectives for each member of the team. Holds people accountable for agreed-to results. Identifies and keeps others focused on the most important metrics that drive the business. Follows through on commitments despite difficulties or complications. Proven ability to hire and manage strong teams, and to provide appropriate leadership, structure, coaching, training and development.
Qualifications
Influencing & Communication Skills: Highly articulate and has excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Well-honed influencing skills that will enable him/her to persuade minds, handle conflict and get things done across organizations and external partners. Low ego, confident and comfortable working in a collaborative environment. Takes the time to assess “how things are done here” before making changes. Excellent listening and cognitive skills and the ability to influence and drive dialogue by building “buy-in” across the organization on topics related to the consumer, the market, and business strategy. Able to interact effectively across all functions and leverages relationships to move the agenda forward.
Culture Fit: Entrepreneurial, proactive and productive; “rolls up sleeves” and gets things done. Strategic, insightful, with strong problem-solving skills with a practical “real-world” sense of what is actually do-able. Exceptional internal and external collaboration & partnership skills. A brand ambassador – must be a champion of the brand.
Start challenging yourself today in an environment that embraces diversity and rewards innovation with competitive pay, great benefits, and a global network offering real opportunity for growth and advancement.

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Innovate. Collaborate. Shine. We're Left, ranked one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, voted Best Place to Work in BC, and a certified B Corp. Left Travel Inc. ( http://www.lefttravel.com/ ), a subsidiary of Left ( http://left.io/ ), is made up of a team that believes the search for the perfect vacation rental should be easy. Our Data Science Co-Op's primary goal will be working with our Data Scientist to help solve the most complex prediction and algorithm problems currently confronted at Left Travel. This co-op opportunity will give you the chance to get involved in real-world problem solving using data from various sources.

We value and believe that the relationship between travelers and their hosts should be simple, comfortable, and direct. We have an extensive travel brand portfolio that includes RentByOwner.com ( http://www.rentbyowner.com/ ), RentalHomes.com ( https://www.rentalhomes.com/ ), SellOffRentals.com ( https://www.selloffrentals.com/ ), Stays.io ( https://www.stays.io/ ), and others. Work with Left Travel's Data Scientist to collect, clean and analyse data sets from various sources.
Assist in implementing machine learning and/or optimization algorithms
Exploring and understanding our data set, and working with our Data Scientist to develop our demand forecasting and web automated bidding.
Working with others to create data visualizations, design data pipelines, and determine the efficacy of new data

Currently enrolled in MSc. program for Computer Sciences, Mathematics, or Statistics
Experience in Python

Familiarity with data processing and analysis tools such as Numpy, Pandas, Spark, Matplotlib
Familiarity with cloud based solutions (Amazon AWS)
Proficiency in business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlikview an asset.

You find yourself dissecting the progression, monetization, and/or gameplay systems for great action RPGs. You’re intrigued by seeing how the modifications you’ve made change the way people play. You see the world of gaming as so much more than a hobby. Working on a new project, you’re excited by working cross-functionally, partnering closely with Engineers, Designers and others.

Kabam is looking for skilled Systems Designers to elevate our Design team on some exciting new projects.

We don’t just design games, we play them and love them, and are fans of the IP’s we work on.

As a Systems Designer, you will:

Collaborate with an extremely talented team of Engineers, UI/UX artists, Data Scientists, QA and LiveOps to create addictive, compelling player experiences that will delight users for years
Provide input on the game’s vision and help champion that vision to other team members
Design rules and parameters for features and systems
Design, implement, tune, and balance game systems, economies, and progression
Create design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other necessary documents to communicate design functionality and vision
Continually iterate, balance and tune features and gameplay based on feedback from the game teams, user testing and the broader player community
Build free-to-play mobile games that the world loves to play
At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in…

Your background includes:

3+ years of game design experience on commercially successful properties
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with an emphasis on game design, economics, math, or psychology
Ultimate problem solving, critical thinking, logical, and analytical skills
Spreadsheet wizardry
Deep familiarity with RPG, BCG, and action genres on mobile, PC, console, and pen-and-paper platforms
Interested? Tell us what you’re looking for - in your application, tell what games have influenced you?

Apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create some of the best games ever made.

About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

Edmonton, ABMatrix Solutions Inc. is a Canadian, employee-owned environmental and engineering consulting company. Strategically located across Canada, we help our clients, employees, environment and communities thrive. With our ability to collaborate across services, disciplines, and geographies, we deliver responsive, locally connected, and scalable solutions customized to our clients project and environmental challenges.

Our integrated approach is supported by talented professionals focused on three key areas of service: assessment, remediation, reclamation and monitoring; environmental planning, assessment and approvals; and water resources. Join our team of passionate professionals and work with us to create a lasting impact.

Our Edmonton, Alberta office is seeking a Hydrogeologist with extensive contaminated sites experience to join our growing team. As the successful candidate, you will work with industry leading professionals within a dynamic multi-disciplinary team across multiple Matrix offices to delivering high quality environmental services.

You will be directly responsible for project delivery from inception to completion, including health safety, proposal writing, scope of work definition, field program planning, execution and management, conceptual model development, managing client relationships, resource management, scheduling, budgets, cost control, invoice preparation, and reporting.

You will provide technical and project management support for a wide range of hydrogeology projects including:


Environmental site assessments
Drilling and aquifer testing programs
Regional and local hydrogeological assessments
Regulatory groundwater monitoring programs
Water supply investigations
Soil and groundwater remediation
Risk assessment.

You will engage in both office and field-based hydrogeology work on a wide variety of projects; however this job is 50-70% field-based and will at times require travel throughout Alberta. On occasion our work schedules need to be flexible to meet client demands and business needs, and you may have to work outside of regular work hours to complete project or field work. This could involve long hours and extended time away in remote locations on short notice.

Key Responsibilities:

Active participation in maintaining Matrixs strong safety culture
Prioritize Health Safety in planning for projects
Prepare for complex ground disturbance activities including submitting One Calls, arranging for crossing and proximity agreements, reviewing ground disturbance packages, and supervising line locators and hydrovacs
Conduct hydrogeological investigations (with an emphasis on contaminated sites), monitoring programs, and studies for the evaluation of environmental risk assessment for regulatory requirements
Manage complex projects while directing multi-disciplinary teams including engineers, hydrogeologists, geologists, and other scientists
Coordinate with contractors and equipment suppliers
Supervise drilling operations (sonic, air and mud rotary, dual-rotary, solid stem auger, hollow stem auger)
Assist with, supervise, and interpret downhole geophysical logs
Supervise installation of monitoring wells including programming, installing and downloading transducers, data loggers and vibrating wire piezometers
Complete, analyze and/or interpret in-situ aquifer tests (ex. slug, bail-down, pumping or packer tests)
Show independent sound technical judgement in the field (e.g. objective-driven data collection, sample selection, monitoring well completion depths, trouble shooting)
Foster long-term relationships with our key clients and our sub-consultants, focused on being the trusted advisor to our clients
Develop work plans and detailed cost estimates for contaminated sites projects and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements
Develop detailed hydrogeological understanding of site-specific conditions that will be the foundation for conceptual site models
Compilation and interpretation of site hydrogeological conditions from geological maps, reports, survey plans, air photos as well as collected physical and chemical data
Support other projects including spill response and remediation
Mentor and train junior staff.

Education, Experience, Technical Skills:

An undergraduate or graduate degree in Geology (Hydrogeology) or Earth Sciences
8 to 10 years of experience in a similar role within a consulting environment
Professional member in good standing with APEGA
Demonstrated experience in physical and contaminant hydrogeology including conceptual site model development, groundwater monitoring well network design, groundwater-surface water interaction, drilling and aquifer testing programs
Familiar with the application of numerical groundwater flow and contaminant transport models
Familiar with databases/GIS/visualization tools and industry standard software packages including: AQTESOLV, AquiferTest, Surfer, and GeoSCOUT
Previous experience with soil classification (USC) logging and bedrock characterization, sample collection, field screening, analysis selection
Strong understanding of the Alberta Contaminated Sites Policy Framework and remediation guidelines
Exceptional oral and written communication skills in English including your experience in writing proposals, technical reports and general project communication
Ability to build long-term, successful relationships with project teams and clients
Previous project management experience including financial, schedule, and budget management and controls
Current/Valid H2S Alive, First Aid, CPR, Ground Disturbance, and in vehicle Defensive Driving certifications is preferred
A valid class 5 drivers licence with no restrictions and a clean driving record.

Are you the one we're looking for? Apply now by clicking the Apply button below.

Please bookmark our careers page and visit often to learn more about what we do. Also, follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter (at Matrix Solutions Inc. @ITweetMatrix respectively) for ongoing updates about our people and business. For more information about Matrix Solutions, please visit our website at www.matrix-solutions.com

Matrix is committed to providing a safe and productive work environment and to promoting the health, safety and well-being of our employees. In keeping with our Health Safety Policy, individuals in safety sensitive positions are subject to pre-employment, pre-access (and in some client cases, random) alcohol drug testing as well as drivers abstract reviews.

Matrix Solutions offers a comprehensive compensation package. We are also committed to flexible work hours and schedules, team-based work, cross-training opportunities, and rewarding our star performers.

We welcome and promote diversity and inclusion in our workplace and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Matrix provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities; including accommodation that takes into account an applicants accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources directly.

The successful candidate is required to have a valid driver's license and would have to provide proof of this upon being hired.

Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada with no restrictions.

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

job_title: Senior Software Algorithm Developer - Life Science Instrument
job_description:
Senior Software Algorithm Developer - Life Science Instrument-SCI002877

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.


Sciex offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates' and their families' lives.

Sciex is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join our winning team and Follow us on LinkedIn!

Description
You will join an outstanding bioinformatics team and be responsible for the development and maintenance of algorithms and features for industry-leading software applications from SCIEX. Your contributions will include early phase prototyping, integration of concepts into production code for commercial products that can be deployed either on-prem or in the cloud and post-launch support. You will be highly motivated to understand and satisfy challenging requirements for algorithm performance.

Deliver prototype implementations of novel algorithms given high-level descriptions
Assist and automate algorithm evaluations
Integrate new features and mature algorithm concepts into existing and new C#/C++ applications in an efficient manner with sound design and quality code
Support delivery of algorithms for cloud applications
Quickly prepare brief, accurate and relevant documentation of designs, and present to technical lead for feedback as needed to align on design before development
Follow established practices of agile methodologies to ensure high quality software
Work as a team member to maximize the success of the development team, including not just fellow developers, but the full cross-functional team including testers, scientists and project manager

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with a strong background in mathematics, statistics and algorithms, or a graduate degree in Science or Math with strong programming experience
3+ years' experience in algorithm development, ideally with a focus on life sciences and signal processing
2+ years' design/programming experience with C# and C++
Passion for sound design, coding and documentation practices to ensure long-term viability of code including test-driven development
Multi-threaded development
Experience with performance troubleshooting and optimization

Preferred Qualifications

Specific training in bioinformatics including proteomics and other ‘omics’ applications as well as data searching, mining and visualization capabilities
Experience with various parallel processing techniques including SIMD
Experience with distributed processing and storage
Experience with containerization and Docker
Experience working autonomously on diverse parts of applications (UI, data model, etc.)
General familiarity with Linux or Unix
Experience with .NET Core
Experience as an effective collaborator with team members in a geographically distributed team highly desired
Experience with any of MATLAB, R, KNIME, Python

At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.

#LI-SM1

Danaher Corporation Overview
Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $18.3B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,200% over 20 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

Duties
The Postdoctoral Research Program (PRP) provides scientists, who have recently obtained a doctoral degree in a field of natural sciences, with the opportunity to work with research groups or leaders in Canadian government laboratories and research institutions located across Canada. In turn, the Government of Canada benefits from new and emerging talent.

Federal research scientists contribute to strategic decisions, policies, regulations and programs by providing a sound scientific knowledge base through their research. Research scientists perform their work in pursuance of departmental mandates in order to attain specified outcomes and to conceptualize, identify, formulate and set in motion new outcomes in delivering programs, meeting the future needs of the department.

Calgary, ABWe are seeking Junior and Senior Data Scientists for Imperial’s Digital Accelerator's data science group who can solve business problems by leveraging machine learning, optimization and other analytical techniques in a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, strategic partners and subject domain experts

The Upstream Digital Accelerator (UDA) is a new digital accelerator within Imperial conceived to leverage the power of digital technologies (including AI) to solve highly complex problems across Imperial oil and gas operations, spanning conventional, mining, SAGD and other thermal recovery methods.

Operating within an Agile framework, with multi-disciplinary teams, ideas from the business are quickly actioned and converted into usable products (MVPs). To this end the UDA offers a fast-paced, exciting environment and access to a diverse set of problems. Strong support from the CEO and senior management, and a close working partnership with Imperial’s asset team ensure endless opportunities to create significant impact on the business.

With access to massive data sets, immense computation power and challenging, previously unsolved problems, UDA is an ideal place for Data Scientists to push the boundaries of what they know and can achieve. As an example, a recent project saw the use of 60 stacked XGBoost models feed predictions into a custom built numeric gradient descent optimization algorithm on a 100 GB dataset to significantly improve recovery rate from mining operations.
Furthermore, UDA encourages its members to showcase their work to the data science community through publications, conferences and seminars.

As a new and rapidly expanding group within Imperial, the UDA provides a unique opportunity for Data Scientists to pioneer the use of cutting edge analytics in upstream oil and gas.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Work as a member of the Imperial Digital Accelerator with a team of highly talented Data Scientists, led by a Principal Data Scientist, to unlock substantial value from operations
Work on previously unsolved, highly complex, diverse problems across Imperial upstream assets in a fast-paced Agile environment
Understand and translate business requirements into technical, end-to-end execution plans for predictive modeling
Be involved from the early stages of defining data needs and sourcing data, all-the-way through to creating production ready predictive models
Work with Principal Data Scientist to set the strategy for analytical execution
Lead efforts in data quality, consistency and correctness
Ensure your models and analytics are tested with the end users and iterate as needed
Communicate key metrics to stakeholders, as you progress through delivery
Mentor and guide junior members of the team through the modeling process
Keep up to date with the latest advances in the data science field
Publish innovative and breakthrough work in conferences and journal
Qualifications
Academic:
MS in machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, economics or related quantitative field is preferred
PhD in a quantitative field is an asset

Other:
Experience leading small teams
Experience implementing machine learning algorithms across a range of complex supervised, unsupervised learning problems
Experience working on complex, ill-defined engineering problems
Experience leading end-to-end modeling including translating the business problem into an analytical approach and delivering results
Experience with problems that involves optimization expertise
Strong programming skills in at least one object oriented programming language
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audience, excellent communication skills
Strong expertise in operations research and optimization
Previous domain expertise in energy/ industrial goods
Experience working in cross-functional teams, building production quality and large scale deployments in an Agile environment

Start date: May 1, 2019

Location: Calgary, AB
Your benefits
A company committed to career growth - we recruit those who are interested in a career with Imperial and prefer to develop and promote people from within. Our career management process means that you will likely perform a number of unique, challenging roles during your career.
Successful networking and mentoring programs - enables you to spend time with managers from across the organization to learn about other departments and opportunities. Also allows you to connect with peers at a similar experience level.
Commitment to safety, ethics & continuous improvement - these standards are the reason Imperial is an industry leader. You will work for a company that upholds safety and ethics ideals and continues to seek out ways to improve.
Exceptional benefits program - includes competitive savings, retirement, and healthcare plans that you can customize to meet your individual needs. A comprehensive relocation package is provided, if required. Educational and physical fitness financial assistance programs round out our benefits package.
Continuous learning environment - encourages you to augment your skills and capabilities.
If you are talented, driven, and want to make meaningful contributions that really impact environmental, safety and bottom line objectives, then you owe it to yourself to apply with Imperial.
Early Professional Development Program - provides you with the opportunity to specialize in a specific area of expertise or develop skills in a variety of different areas. You will quickly be given large areas of responsibility and will be encouraged to take on stretch assignments as you progress.
Competitive vacation package - provides you with three weeks of vacation (the first year is pro-rated based on your hiring date) and one scheduled Friday off per month and five floating days annually for use at your discretion with approval.
Who we are
A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. No matter what your career path, we provide the platform to elevate your goals and achieve your ambitions, while providing support through wide-ranging programs and benefits.
Other considerations
For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.
We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Eligibility to work in Canada
All applicants who receive an offer of employment must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date. Proof of eligibility shall be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence, Canadian open work permit or receipt from Immigration Canada of an application for a post-graduate work permit. Proof of eligibility must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Proof of eligibility will be required if an offer of employment is made. Failure to provide proof of eligibility at least six (6) weeks prior to the start date may result in the offer of employment being rescinded.

Application deadline: March 24, 2019
Imperial is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals.
In certain situations, Imperial may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions in the company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.

Toronto, ONProduct Manager / Associate Product Manager

Nomis is searching for a Product Manager / Associate Product Manager to join our growing Product team. Who We Are & What We Build

Nomis is a venture-backed Enterprise FinTech with the vision to transform the $150 Trillion retail financial services market for the better. And play table tennis along the way.

Our mission is to help banks and lenders understand their customers deeply, so that they can deliver products, pricing and offers that align with customers' needs, driving benefits for customers, employees and shareholders.
