job_title: Upcoming Opportunities – Senior Actuarial Analysts, Team Leads and Data Scientists – Greater Toronto
job_description:
PermanentKeeping You Moving
RSA is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.Our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. In RSA, employing positive people is how we achieve success. You will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. We believe your personality and passion will keep RSA and our business moving forward. At RSA we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. Our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader.At RSA Canada, our purpose is to Make Life Better Together and we do that every day through our commitments to our people, our customers and our partners. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, fair, and accessible environment where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential and where everyone feels comfortable being their true selves. We hire on the basis of merit and we are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, as well as equal access to training and promotion opportunities.
Position Overview:
The RSA Actuarial team is always on the lookout for top Actuarial talent. We are growing and looking for a variety of backgrounds to add to our diverse disciplined team. Our growth will be in Commercial Pricing, Personal Pricing, 17 (International Financial Reporting Standard), Economic Capital, Analytics, Data Science and Reserving. If your background and interests align to our any of areas of focus, we would love to learn a bit more about you.
Who you are
Your enthusiasm is infectious. You challenge the status quo. You find solutions to problems. You go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations. You get things done the right way. You represent our brand with passion and pride. You are a team player. You have fun and you make work fun for those working around you.
What you will achieve in this role
Commercial and Personal Lines Pricing:
Develop new predictive models and incorporate machine learning techniques to be used for pricing and underwritingCreate new and improve existing analytical tools and models;Contribute to proposals for new and innovative approaches for pricing, underwriting, portfolio management and product design based on statistical analyses, a solid understanding of P&C insurance products, and awareness of RSA business strategy;Update pricing assumptions used in rate indications, produce indicated overall rate level changes
Economic Capital:
Parameterize, calibrate and run our Internal Model to project our future balance sheet given the business we have written in the past and are writing today. Interrogate the results to understand the capital requirements of our business and what is driving these requirements.Perform key tasks such as operational plan updates, stress and scenario testing, sensitivity testing, and updating our model each quarter to reflect changes in our balance sheet.Contribute to the development of our Internal Model with objectives of increasing usability and improving efficiency such that more focus can be given to analysis, increasing business engagement and integration with business decision making.
Analytics:
Enhance analytical capabilities across the company through learning & implementing advanced analytical techniques and automationProduce and maintain existing analytical tools and reports for key business stakeholders, as well as create new and improve existing toolsCollaborate within Analytics and also with other areas of business by discussing and sharing analyses and insightsSupport the ongoing improvement of data integrity and quality used in management information
Data Science:
Develop new predictive models and incorporate machine learning techniques to be used for pricing, underwriting, portfolio management, claims analytics, and operationsAbility to visualize and communicate modelling findings with various business unitsContinuous working with cutting-edge data science technology from data manipulation to predictive modellingIncrease business and technical knowledge through frequent liaison and collaboration with colleagues in various business units
Reserving and IFRS17:
Assist in the setting and monitoring of actuarial liabilities for all legal entities in RSA Canada by performing monthly, quarterly, and annual actuarial analyses of policy liabilities including data management, identifying anomalies or trends and addressing possible issuesAssist in monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting for unpaid claim liabilities and contribute to the development of new finance processes and reporting to maintain compliance with local and international reporting standardsIncrease business and technical knowledge through frequent liaison with colleagues throughout the business and the industry and use this in combination with the actuarial analysis carried out to add insight and understanding to our businessHelp develop our current reserving and finance processes and evolve them into an IFRS17 compliant status. Keep informed of any changes and developments in the standard so we can react accordingly.
What you bring to this role
University or college degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, or related fieldExcellent analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and documentation skillsSkills range from technical computer use of Excel, Access, VBA, actuarial specialist software skills to proficiency with R and good knowledge of SQL, SAS and PythonExperience in working with large data sets from various sources and formatsStrong communication skills (both oral and written)Out-of-the-box thinker, striving for innovate solutions to business and analytic problemsUncompromising standards on technical expertise and integrityAbility and willingness to continuously expand knowledge and skills through efforts during and outside of work, with an emphasis on new technical developments as well as leadership techniquesSome roles require working towards, or already received, an ACAS designation or equivalent as well as working towards Fellowship. However Data Science/Analytics roles do not have the requirement for previously mentioned designations.
Other Information
Applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with RSA or its affiliated companies (the “Company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the Company to the contrary.We thank all applicants. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.We invite you to learn more about us at our Career Site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. RSA group of Companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, Aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the LGBT community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.RSA group of Companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.If you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email AODA@RSAGROUP.CA or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

PermanentWSP is one of the world's leading professional engineering services firms. Every day our more than 48,000 experts work to restore the natural environment and transform the built environment.

In Canada, our 8,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP, we’re proud, professional and passionate people, join our team.


Regina
WSP is looking for a motivated Intermediate Project Technician/Scientist to work with the Environmental Management Team supporting ongoing and new environmental monitoring and contaminated land assessment projects. The position is to be staffed in Regina, with work locations throughout Western Canada and will include a large field component 80% field / 20% office).


The successful candidate will work on a wide-variety of environmental projects focused on contaminated land management. Key responsibilities will include working with project leads to support our compliance monitoring programs and Phase I and II Environmental Sites Assessment projects. Ideally our candidate enjoys data collection, working outdoors, working in a team environment, and is highly organized and has a background in representative soil, water and groundwater sample collection, data analysis and results reporting. This is a key assignment for the right individual, to provide support and growth of our Environmental Management Team in Saskatchewan.


This position is important to the success of our firm and requires a commitment to promote our values, as well as achieving technical goals.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Assist project managers/leads with the development and execution of site-specific assessment, remediation and reclamation projects in various regions of western Canada
Collection and field screening of soil, water, and groundwater samples
Execution of Phased Environmental Site Assessments under the direction of Senior Technical Leads
Spill response
Liaise with laboratories, contractors, and other service providers as required
Supervision of subcontractors
Participation in, and compliance with company Health and Safety programs and policies
Safe and efficient operation of tools and machinery necessary to complete field tasks
Work with other team members to effectively complete assigned tasks
QUALIFICATIONS


Technical Diploma or University degree in environmental sciences, geology, hydrogeology or engineering
6+ years of cumulative environmental consulting experience
Experience in collecting soil, water and groundwater samples
Experience conducting Phased Environmental Site Assessments
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office & Outlook
An enthusiastic attitude and team spirit
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently
Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines within a team environment
The desire to succeed in a dynamic, progressive organization
Must possess a valid Class 5 driver’s license; Drivers abstract screening will be required by the successful candidate(s)
Enjoy working outdoors, be physically fit; able to safely lift 50+ pounds at a time; and able to work long hours
Must be able to work out of town for extended periods (typically one week or more at a time following Saskatchewan Labour Laws and issued WSP Labour permits)


Additional Experience Considered as Asset


Surfer®, gINT® software program knowledge and experience
Up to date safety training in Standard First Aid - CPR Level C, H2S Alive, and Ground Disturbance Level II
Demonstrable experience with driving 4X4’s trucks, all-terrain vehicles and watercraft or associated training certificates
Registered with a recognized professional organization in Saskatchewan
WSP Canada Inc.


Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Regina, SK

job_title: Scientifiques des données juniors / Junior Data Scientists - ML et AI, Montréal
job_description:
Montréal, QCDate: Feb 28, 2019
***ENGLISH JOB DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW***

Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.

Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.

L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.

Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques Junior en traitement des données (Senior Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.

Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.

Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Scientifique Junior en traitement des données (Junior Data Scientist), vous devez parfaitement connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .

Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.

Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
BS, MS ou Doctorat en informatique, en génie informatique, en mathématiques, en physique, en économie ou dans un domaine afférent
1 ou 2 années d'expérience professionnelle ou en recherches en Science des données.
Connaissance des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Connaissance de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Connaissances et compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation

Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.

We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.

Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.

Ericsson is now looking for Junior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.

Do you have depth of understanding of Machine Learning and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data.

Role Summary:
As a Junior Data Scientist, you will need to have good programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.

Your Roles and Responsibilities
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs

To be successful one should have:
BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or related field
1 or 2 years of real world or research experience in data science.
Statistics knowledge, e.g.: descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc.
Experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Understanding of Machine Learning, e.g.: linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Knowledge and skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability

You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence
LI-POST

Markham, ONJob Description:
At EXP, we know that great experiences start with the
right people. We believe that work should be
challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also
believe that exponential possibilities are more likely
to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering
company. We value and respect our employees - their
experience and expertise as well as their energy,
passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to
work and to life.
Your Challenge
EXP is currently searching for Junior Geo-Environmental
Scientist or Engineer-in-Training (EIT) to work in our
Geotechnical Division at the Markham Office. The ideal
candidate will be a motivated, detail-oriented
self-starter with 2 to 4 years of experience in the
environmental field to assist the Project Manager on
various projects related to geotechnical, Environmental
Site Assessment, hydrogeological investigation,
environmental remediation and Record of Site Condition,
etc. The environment is fast-paced and growth oriented,
ideally suited for individuals who like to take charge
and are driven to build on current successes.
Your Responsibilities

Carry out all aspects of Phase I Environmental Site

Assessment (ESA) in accordance with CSA Standards
Z768-01 (R2016), including historical review, visual
site reconnaissance, interviews with relevant site
representatives and preparation of Phase I ESA reports;

Knowledgeable in conducting Phase One ESAs in

accordance with Ontario Regulation 153/04;

Coordinate and conduct all field activities relating to

Phase II ESAs and geotechnical investigations, including
utility locates, borehole layout, supervision of field
drilling work, monitoring well installation, well
development as well as soil, groundwater and sediment
sampling in accordance with both CSA Standards Z769-00
and Ontario Regulation 153/04;

Oversee remediation programs on the field including

remedial excavation monitoring and collection of
verification samples, etc.;

Experienced with field work relating to hydrogeological

investigation such as single well response test and
infiltration testing is an asset;

Carry out data tabulation, prepare borehole logs and

drafting of borehole location plans using AutoCAD.
Ability to prepare geological cross-sections using
AutoCAD is a strong asset;

Prepare or assist with the preparation of Phase II ESA

and remediation reports in accordance with CSA Standards
and Ontario Regulation 153/04;

Experience in conducting geotechnical investigation and

knowledgeable in basic principles of geotechnical
engineering is beneficial but not mandatory; and,

Assist Project Manager with the coordination and

management of geo-environmental investigation projects,
including communication with clients, budget tracking
and problem solving.

Job Requirements:
The Skills, Knowledge, and Ability We Seek

2 to 4 years of progressive experience in environmental

site assessment and remediation;

University degree in a related field of study such as

Environmental or Civil Engineering as well as
Environmental Science or Hydrogeology;

Eligible for Professional Engineer (P.Eng.),

Professional Geoscientist (P.Geo) or Environmental
Professional (EP) designation in Ontario;

Understanding of Ontario Regulation 153/04 (as amended)

for conducting Environmental Site Assessments and the
filing of Record of Site Condition;

Expertise in investigation and remediation techniques;
Experienced with computer programs such as MS Word, MS

Excel and AutoCAD. Working knowledge with gINT is an
asset;

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment;
Ability to work both on the field and in the office;
Strong organization and time management skills;
Excellent oral and written communication skills;
Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as

within a team environment; and,

Valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle is

required.
What EXP Can Offer
With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and
deliver, exp provides professional, technical and
strategic services related to the world’s built and

natural environments in six key practice areas:
Buildings, Earth & Environment, Energy, Industrial,
Infrastructure, and Sustainability. Our heritage dates
back to 1906, when the earliest of exp’s predecessor
companies started its engineering infrastructure
practice in northern Ontario.
Today, close to 3,000 creative exp professionals across
North America and around the globe provide the expertise
and experience needed to deliver successful projects for
clients.
Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a
positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a
promise we take seriously.
Join a dynamic team at exp that provides you with
innovative projects, the capacity to develop your
career, a full range of benefits, flexible working
hours, and much more! When you explore what exp has to
offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.
For more information, visit www.exp.com.

Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) is the national leader in defence and security science and technology. As an agency of Canada’s Department of National Defence (DND), DRDC provides DND, the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) and other government departments as well as public safety and national security communities the knowledge and technological advantage needed to defend and protect Canada’s interests at home and abroad. Information on the preference to veterans

We are seeking a Project Manager – Drug Discovery to join our team.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage the Company’s discovery-stage Contract Research Organizations (CROs) under both FTE and fee-for-service arrangements. Perform contract-related activities (drafting, contract change control, monitoring for performance, accepting deliverables, managing invoices and tracking accruals) relating to same within the scope of the Company’s contact management systems and policies.
Coordinate project team, project sub-team, and functional group meetings for the Company’s discovery-stage programs. Track action items and timelines. Schedule internal and external studies, as required.
Manage compound logistics for outbound (e.g., preparation for shipment, tracking) and inbound (e.g., compound receipt and registration) shipments with CROs and partners.
Manage data workflows and progression of compound through program flowcharts. Ensure the timely distribution of externally-generated data and reports to appropriate stakeholders.
Serve as the point person for the Dotmatics Browser software platform, through which the Company’s compound and assay data are managed.
Manage drafting and approval of Discovery preclinical reports to support regulatory filings.
QUALIFICATIONS:
BSc or MSc in the fields of chemistry or biology
At least 3 years experience in drug development in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Highly organized with keen attention to detail
Strong desire to manage projects to timeline and budget
Ability to interface with internal and external stakeholders including scientists, executives, and members of the finance and legal departments
Extensive intermediate to advanced computer skills (Power Point, Excel, Word, MS Project, SharePoint)
Knowledge of project management methodology, including developing Gannt Charts
Ability to influence colleagues in a cross-functional team environment
Willing and able to learn new skills to meet changing needs of the organization
Experience with Dotmatics Browser and/or Electronic Lab Notebook implementation preferred
To apply for this position, please e-mail your resume and cover letter to careers@xenon-pharma.com and include “Discovery Project Manager” in the subject line. All attachments must be saved as one file and be named: “Your Full Name – Discovery Project Manager.” We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the volume of applicants, only those chosen for interview will be contacted.

job_title: Lead Data Scientist / Chef d'équipe science des données
job_description:
Montréal, QCUnity Monetization Team, a division of Unity, builds advertising, in-game purchases promotions, and other personalized content delivery solutions and technologies used in hundreds of thousands of apps. Our Monetization team builds the technology infrastructure and serving systems that manage the delivery of relevant content to hundreds of millions of users every day. Our platform process massive data sets that feed into machine learning systems that live in the core of various of our products.

Deep learning and deep reinforcement learning are revolutionizing automated decision-making systems and Unity is riding the front wave. Unity is investing in deep and deep-reinforcement learning development on multiple fronts. Specifically, Unity Monetization is investing to master these methodologies and applying them to real-world problems of game economics and monetization. We want to bring the cutting edge machine learning to help developers in Unity's vast mobile monetization ecosystem to succeed in build sustainable monetization for their games. Thus, we are looking to add a Data Science Manager to our amazing team!

Unity's vast game monetization ecosystem gives us a unique opportunity to leverage data and innovative machine learning methods to benefit the gaming and game development communities. Unity is continuously striving to build disruptive and powerful solutions to enable game developers to be more successful.

Responsibilities


Work with the world's number one content creation platform to drive data integration requirements, building representation learning and personalization of mobile gaming and advertising content
Finding and defining new ways to revolutionize how games and mobile advertising are operated with machine learning and personalization
Lead and help to build a new addition to our global data science organization
Drive the execution of the team and provide visibility to the projects and progress and grow people and their talent to perfect the team's execution

Requirements


Capability to influence people across the organization for alignment of data science and machine learning initiatives
A leader who can start and follow-through implementation of new solutions, architectures, and data science and machine learning paradigms
A natural tendency to participate in defining new business opportunities and products actively
Experience in implementing varied data and machine learning based online decision-making systems on a large scale
Experience in hiring and managing people

Bonus points


Experience in gaming industry, especially mobile f2p world
Experience in mobile advertising
Ph.D. on math, physics, computer science or equivalent degree
Experience in representation learning

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#LI-ER1 #SEN

L'équipe de monétisation de Unity, une division de Unity, conçoit des publicités, des promotions sur des achats en jeu et d'autres solutions et technologies de contenu personnalisé utilisées par des centaines de milliers d'applications. Notre équipe de monétisation bâtit l'infrastructure technologique et les systèmes de services qui gèrent quotidiennement la livraison de contenu pertinent à des centaines de millions d'utilisateurs. Notre plateforme de traitement des données de masse intègre ce flux de données aux systèmes d'apprentissage machine qui sont au cœur de nombreux de nos produits.

L'apprentissage en profondeur et l'apprentissage en profondeur par renforcement révolutionnent les systèmes de prise de décisions et Unity est à l'avant-garde de cette révolution. Unity investit dans plusieurs facettes du développement de l'apprentissage en profondeur et de l'apprentissage en profondeur par renforcement. Plus précisément, les investissements du secteur de la monétisation de Unity visent à maîtriser ces technologies et à les appliquer aux problèmes réels liés à l'économie et à la monétisation des jeux vidéo. Nous souhaitons que l'apprentissage machine à la fine pointe puisse aider les développeurs du vaste écosystème de monétisation sur appareils mobiles de Unity à mettre en place avec succès un système de monétisation durable pour leurs jeux. C'est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche d'une personne pour pourvoir au poste de chef d'équipe science des données dans notre formidable équipe!

Le vaste écosystème de monétisation des jeux vidéo de Unity nous offre l'occasion d'exploiter les données et les méthodes novatrices d'apprentissage machine afin d'en faire profiter l'industrie des jeux vidéo et les communautés de développeurs de jeux. Unity met tous les efforts pour bâtir des solutions puissantes et créatrices de marché qui favorisent la réussite des développeurs de jeux.

Responsabilités


Vous travaillerez avec la première plateforme mondiale de création de contenu et guiderez les exigences liées à l'intégration des données, afin de mettre en place l'apprentissage par représentation et la personnalisation pour les jeux mobiles et le contenu publicitaire
Vous rechercherez et établirez de nouvelles façons de révolutionner les opérations des jeux vidéo et des publicités sur appareil mobile grâce à l'apprentissage machine et à la personnalisation
Vous guiderez et aiderez à bâtir une nouvelle proposition pour notre organisation des données scientifiques à l'échelle mondiale

Compétences


Aptitude à influencer les autres membres de l'organisation afin de synchroniser les données scientifiques et les initiatives en apprentissage machine

Expérience dans l'embauche et la gestion de personnel

Qui sommes-nous

Nous sommes une entreprise orientée vers le produit, nous sommes curieux et créatifs. Afin de permettre à Unity d'évoluer avec les progrès, d'être plus conviviale et d'élargir ses marchés, nous réinvestissons continuellement dans le développement. Avec plus d'un milliard d'installations par mois, Unity rejoint autant les joueurs que les amateurs. En plus de nos jeux vidéo, nos logiciels sont utilisés dans des secteurs aussi variés que la médecine, la visualisation et le commerce. Ces logiciels contribuent à démocratiser le développement des jeux, permettent de résoudre des problèmes et favorisent la réussite d'un grand nombre de développeurs à l'échelle mondiale.

Aujourd'hui, Unity compte plus de 15 succursales dans le monde et ses employés sont répartis dans 23 pays. Les employés de Unity Technologies sont passionnés et dynamiques, il ne suffit plus de savoir faire le travail, nous sommes à la recherche de candidats qui souhaitent se dépasser, surmonter des obstacles et qui ont de grands rêves!

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs que nous pouvons faire pour vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. L'unité ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

Toronto, ONTemporaryThe Clinical Research Project Manager on the UCAN studies works closely with the Principal Investigator and Program Manger to plan and manage the overall research network, program and team. This includes developing and communicating project plans, status reports, risk and issue logs, budgets and other reports, as well as long-term planning of on-going projects, day-to-day operations of on-going studies, and development of new projects. In addition, he/she manages the personnel on the research team, comprised of clinical research coordinators and assistants, laboratory research associates and assistants, trainees and volunteers, including on-going training and supervision, conducting performance appraisals, and organizing communication strategies, and team meetings.
Finally, he/she develops close working relationships with the medical and health care professional staff who provide clinical care to the study patients, both at the SickKids and other institutions in Canada and throughout the world. The Project manager may also assume Clinical Research Coordinator responsibilities.
Here's What You Get to Do:
Awards management / Human Resouces / Financial
Coordinating all areas relating to awards management
Collecting and disseminating information to scientists regarding research grant and respond to general inquiries regarding requirements
Developing project plans and timelines for reporting, coordinating scientific staff to meet all agency requirements and deadlines
Working with scientists and research staff to coordinate, compile and submit reports
Meeting regularly with scientific project teams, discuss next steps in grants, budget concerns, completion dates, etc to ensure grant milestones are achieved
Assisting in the procurement process to ensure purchases are completed in an efficient and timely manner
Encourage and foster collaborative relationships with healthcare team at SickKids, other participating centres and government and community agencies.
Recruit, train and supervise project staff.
Actively participate in departmental/program meetings, or rounds to acquire and disseminate knowledge and to profile clinical research.
Develop, manage and forecast study budgets. Develop in-services on study requirements.
Monitor Staff performance and assist PI with annual performance appraisals.
Protocol Related:
Collaborate with Principal Investigator regarding grant applications, new research proposals, report preparation, presentations, manuscripts and development and review of study protocols.
Strong background in clinical and basic science research in the area of childhood arthritis and rheumatic disease including biomarker research and biospecimen science
Develop case report forms and/or questionnaires. Organize science reviews, and track deadlines.
Keep abreast of regulations and policies governing clinical research and communicate to staff and research team members. (e.g., Tri-council Policy Statement, ICH Guidelines, Good Clinical Practices, and Health Canada and FDA regulations). Develop policies and procedures related to the research program, ensuring external regulations and guidelines are followed.
Develop informed consent documents based on regulations, REB consent templates and institutional requirements. Submit to REB; follow up on queries and changes.
Prepare annual follow up for resubmission, make and submit changes based on protocol amendments as required.
Develop study binders for clinical program and study team use, and ensure they are kept up to date.
Participate in audits, site visits and monitoring by SickKids and other regulatory bodies.
Experience with conducting systematic reviews. Supervise literature reviews and keep current with study literature.
Supervise Database development and entry. Lock database once clean. Develop programming to produce regular database reports, with Principal Investigator and Data Analyst.
Develop and monitor timelines for existing studies, balancing the demands of multiple projects. Develop and maintain database of current studies and their status.In Multi-centre trials, you manage the overall study, including participation in selection, training, monitoring and ongoing communication with other studies, and organizing Investigator meetings.
Develop training programs.
Research Subject Related
Develop quality control guidelines for studies - eligibility confirmation, protocol compliance, scheduling of re-evaluations, etc.
Development and execution of data validation plan for study data
Design/develop promotional strategies, including newsletters and letters to parents.
Oversee and participate in recruitment and patient contacts.
Here's What You Need:
7+ years work experience, including 3+ years project management experience and research grant experience preferably with specific agency experience of the CIHR and Genome Canada
Project Management Professional designation is strongly preferred
Preference given to candidate with experience managing research projects involving development of clinician-facing and participant-facing software
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, problem solving skills, exceptional project management skills, and an ability to prioritize work in response to multiple demands in a high volume environment
Experience developing and communicating project plans, status reports, risk and issue logs, budgets and other reports
Knowledgeable in the preparation of research grants, with basic financial skills to be able to conversantly discuss budgets and variances with scientific staff
Must be self-motivated, proactive, and have demonstrated excellence in ability to collaborate effectively with others towards mutual goals.
Able to work well as a member of a team or independently
Competent in the use of MS Word, Excel, Outlook, REDCap etc
Competence in MS Project and Visio preferred
A clinical professional degree would be an asset, as would certification as a clinical research associate (e.g., SOCRA accreditation).
You have proven skills in grant writing, data and budget management, graphics.
Supervises clinical research assistants, coordinators, trainees, and volunteers.
Contact with Public
Considerable, patient recruitment, industry, sponsors, other hospitals.
Employment Type: Full-Time, Temporary contract (1 year + 1 day) with modified benefits.

ContractData. Discovery. Better Health.

We’ve got the data. Only the Institute for Clinical Evaluative Sciences holds all of Ontario’s 18 billion health related records – comprised of nearly a trillion data points!

Come discover your value.

Functional Area: Research and Data

The ICES Research and Analysis Department is seeking a motivated epidemiologist to provide epidemiological expertise and research methodology expertise, and general project oversight in the context of our health services research. The epidemiologist reports to the research program manager in their assigned program. The epidemiologist will work collaboratively with the project team and under the direction of the principal investigator (PI) or staff scientist; and will provide epidemiological expertise, analytic input and project management for their assigned projects in collaboration with investigators, students and key partners.

Responsibilities of the position include, but may not be limited to:
Research and organization related duties may include:

Develop, plan and implement study/project protocols under the direction of the PI or staff scientist. These activities may include:
Assisting in grant/project submissions including budget preparation
Completing literature searches and/or literature reviews
Assisting with study design and sampling strategies
Assisting with the production of accurate and timely data/reports including the development of data creation and analytic plans; data interpretation and presentation; and the development of procedures for data validation as appropriate.
General project management which may include:
Monitoring project timelines, risks and deliverables in collaboration with other team members
Managing project budgets and allocating funds in collaboration with the PI
Liaising with the Finance and Procurement departments.
Work effectively and efficiently according to ICES policies, procedures, standards, workflow processes, documents and requirements (e.g., complete program and project documentation according to ICES standards and guidelines)
Write reports (technical reports/working papers/ICES publications/web-based summaries), abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications and other relevant deliverables, in collaboration with the PI or staff scientist
Work with Communications, Knowledge Translation & Exchange to finalize written and graphic formats and to create report dissemination plans
Interface with internal and external stakeholders in support of the project such as expert panels, committees and team meetings
Facilitate the uptake of knowledge by local decision-makers across Ontario through the presentation of findings, education sessions and one-on-one interactions as required
May contribute to or support the development of a body of knowledge in support of ICES such as updating documentation
May contribute to other committees or activities within the department or ICES in support of ICES' business plan as required
Perform other duties as assigned within the scope of the position.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required
Master’s degree in epidemiology, public health or a related field
Knowledge generally gained through two years of related experience
Experience in managing clinical, epidemiological and/or health services research projects and/or experience in health planning and decision support
Working knowledge of common research and data presentation methodologies, bio-statistical analytic methods applied to health services research and data collection and/or management methodologies
Working knowledge of the concepts of health services research
Knowledge of primary care research and databases is an asset
Understanding of bio-statistical analytic techniques
SAS programming skills preferred
Proficient in the use of MS Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Internet Explorer), as well as the ability to work with computerized databases
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills and ability to exercise discretion and good judgment
Strong presentation skills
Ability to demonstrate time management skills to manage and prioritize work load responsibilities and timelines
Ability to work accurately and effectively under pressure, and to meet deadlines.
This position is a two year full-time contract located at ICES Central in Toronto.

ICES offers a competitive compensation package with full benefits, and participation in a defined benefit pension plan with HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan).

Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter detailing how their knowledge, skills and abilities match the scope of this position to the attention of:

Human Resources Department

Intermediate Environmental Scientist/Engineer
SUMMARY OF POSITION
SNC-Lavalin is seeking an Intermediate level Environmental Scientist/Engineer and Project Manager to join our team serving our private industry and government clients throughout Ontario. The successful candidate will be part of a team of environmental engineers/geoscientists and will lead and provide support on projects related to environmental investigation and remediation, hydrogeological investigations and construction monitoring in the industrial, oil and gas and government sectors. The successful candidate will bring demonstrated leadership skills and will be able to provide effective communication and direction when dealing with project team members, subcontractors/suppliers and clients. Liaising with regulatory agencies, networking with professionals and developing new business would be secondary duties in this role. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years experience in field execution and management of Phase I/II/III environmental site assessments and remediation projects. Experience in the execution or management of sediment assessments, risk assessment, designation substance surveys and/or air surveys would be considered an asset.
This position would be based in our Ottawa, ON location.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Management of projects of varying complexity involving soil and groundwater characterization, environmental compliance, environmental management, health and safety management, designated substances and hazardous materials, and remedial system design and implementation
Management of personnel and resources
Tracking costs and managing budgets
Satisfying client objectives
Evaluating and analyzing data using a variety of standardized and more complex methods
Executing technical tasks requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness and adherence to prescribed data testing methods
Preparing reports, proposals and other project documents of varying complexity
Liaising with clients and contacts to secure additional business
Hiring and directing contractors
Supervising less experienced staff on a project basis and in some cases, providing technical direction and mentoring
Promoting team effort and collaboration
QUALIFICATIONS
4-7 years of practical environmental consulting experience and contaminated site assessment
Must be licensed as a certified professional by one of: Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) with P.Eng.; Association of Professional Geoscientists of Ontario (APGO) with P.Geo;
Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Hydrogeology/Earth Science, Environmental Science or relate discipline
Through education or experience have demonstrable knowledge and skills in relevant disciplines including engineering design/construction management, geology/hydrogeology, environmental compliance, health and safety systems, waste management and occupational hygiene
Solid knowledge of environmental laws, regulations and guidelines as they apply to environmental and construction projects in Ontario (and other parts of Canada as applicable on a project basis)
Demonstrated expertise in contractor supervision, project management and contract administration
Strong technical understanding of environmental field methods
Sound judgment and problem solving skills with the ability to identify and manage cost-effective, practical solutions to client problems and/or potential non-compliance situations
A strong commitment to teamwork; excellent verbal and interpersonal skills are required with preference given to demonstrated aptitude for client liaison and multi-disciplinary communication
Self-motivated; must be able to manage multiple projects concurrently with strong organizational and time management skills
Commitment to excellence with a focus on quality control, quality management and attention to detail
Proven technical writing skills
English proficiency in reading and writing
Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office products
Valid Ontario Driver's license

Toronto, ONThe medtech industry is disrupting the world. Highmark Interactive is combining mobile technology, digitization of traditional diagnostics, machine learning, and the principles of gamification into a product that is having a significant impact on brain health.

Our current platform allows thousands of athletes, trainers, and doctors to make personalized, data-driven decisions about concussions. Concussions affect millions of people every year but we currently know very little about them, and diagnosis and treatment remain largely subjective. Our mobile application allow athletes and clinicians alike to perform at the top of their game.

We’ve been operating for just over 2 years. In that time, our team has created a mobile app, web platform, signed on thousands of paying customers, attracted a global medical advisory board including scientists from Harvard, UCLA, Canadian and Australian universities, and has enlisted a number of Olympic gold-medal athlete and former professional NHL players as brand ambassadors.
We are at a pivotal point in our company’s path where we are growing our platform and our team. We need talented developers who can contribute to pushing our company forward. In this position, you will be touching every level of our technology, systems, and processes and be in a position to exert influence on the direction that the company is taking. You will be responsible for collaborating with experts, designing and developing technology that will be used both externally and internally.

Highmark Interactive is dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse company culture and a multicultural workplace and strongly encourages applications from women and minorities.


You have 5 years experience in:

Designing, building, documenting and maintaining engaging apps and/or games.

Working with artists and other developers to create new features (at Highmark, this will include things ranging from gameplay to neurological tests, ideally both at once!).

Helping to implement plugins, backend connections, and API endpoints.

Maintaining and administering various data storage solutions.

Debugging issues across a full technology stack that includes Unity game engine and Native mobile languages.
You have experience/expertise in some of the following:

Developing some of these technologies: Web (React), Node.js, MySQL, MongoDB.

Creating apps that users love.

Building APIs.

Machine-learning and database management.

Being a generalist who works on the backend, frontend and everything in between.

Stitching together many different services and processes even when you are not intimately familiar with them.

Some experience in native mobile app development.

Thinking about the entire system when developing a part of it and creating high-quality code.

Working with Unity, C#, and Javascript. Experience with Objective-C or Java is a plus.

Holding yourself and others to a high standard of quality.
Developing foundational technology. In this role, your contributions will set a benchmark for the company's coding culture going forward.

Taking pride in developing projects through to completion. These projects will make a real difference in the world.

It’s not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas. Your application should indicate what specifically you consider to be your strong areas of competence.

You will be involved with:

Our customer-facing mobile application and games. It is being developed using Unity (C#) game engine primarily with some native plugins.

Our enterprise web dashboard for further analytics & user management built using React.
Work on native application plugins for Unity or apps, Obj-C, Swift, and Java.

Creating new APIs for communication between our user-facing app and our backend.

Creating and maintaining both the test and service environments.

Creating tools to help analyze data and improve our diagnosis and treatment plans.

You’ll receive:

Competitive salary

Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision)

Generous time off policies:

3 Weeks vacation

5 Sick days

5 Mental health days

Job Description Summary
The Associate Product Manager (Assoc. PM) is responsible for supporting one or more products and product lines for the Routine Diagnostic and Special Applications Team in the Research and Development (R&D) Department. With input from senior management, the Assoc. PM supports all stages of the product life-cycle by proposing, implementing and executing product management initiatives, and providing input on effective marketing strategies and tactics. This role involves a high degree of interaction and collaboration across departments, and with customers and external partners.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Product Portfolio Strategies
Manage and support the entire product life cycle for one or more product line(s) by proposing and implementing product management initiatives, in consultation with supervisor or senior management.
Communicate product management strategies to the assigned Team and provide recommendations for the one-to-two year product development plan through analysis of the market(s), the competitive landscape and customer needs.
Collaborate with the Pricing Team to make recommendations on product pricing.
Track the financial performance of the product line(s) and present financial overviews to the Team and Corporate Operations groups.
Provide revenue forecasts for new products at the New Product Proposal (NPP) and during the pre-launch stages. Provide the Sales, Inventory & Operations Planning (SIOP) forecast on a quarterly basis to set the inventory and sales projections, and provide pricing recommendations to maximize value.
Coordinate new product(s) through the NPP and technical transfer process through to product launch. Review Product Information Sheets, product manuals, labels and packaging.
Work closely with the Supply Chain Operations Team to ensure that the inventory levels of products are sufficient to meet market demand, and keep the Sales team updated on critical inventory issues.
Work closely with the Senior Scientists and the Business Development Team to perform opportunity analysis and strategic planning for in-licensing of intellectual property.
Marketing and Sales Support
With Scientific Marketing group, develop and execute marketing strategies and annual plans for assigned product portfolios, including campaign planning, lead generation, marketing collateral development and review, and conference and trade show attendance, ensuring alignment with Sales and Corporate strategies.
With Scientific Marketing group, prepare and propose the assigned Team’s online advertising budgets in accordance with the budget guidance.
Enable Sales by identifying sales strategies, writing and providing sales scripts and other sales support tools, and developing and delivering product training to the Sales and Technical Support Teams.
Work collaboratively with the Scientific Marketing and Marketing Communications groups to ensure the successful execution of approved marketing campaigns, including performing regular reviews of lead generation and campaign performance.
Work with regional Sales Managers and Marketing Teams to amend sales strategies and marketing plans as appropriate for local markets.
Identify and attend conferences, ranked by priority. Execute conference campaigns and act as conference custodian.
Leadership Development
Serve as the project lead within the assigned Team for one or more product management, marketing and data analysis projects, and lead a cross-functional team to meet deliverables as established by the Marketing Steering Committee.
May supervise a Scientific Marketing Specialist (SMS): lead, manage, coach, develop and evaluate direct reports through regular one-on-one and team meetings; ensure direct reports have the capability and capacity to meet future organizational needs.
Qualifications
PhD in cell biology or a related field.
Relevant marketing or product management experience is preferred.
Some understanding of product positioning and value proposition to suit the market is preferred.
Demonstrated developing business and financial acumen.’
Strong ability in data manipulation and interpretation skills.
Exceptional communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills, with proven experience building strong relationships with stakeholders and key opinion leaders.
Demonstrated aptitude for technical and scientific writing relevant to generation of educational and marketing materials.
Ability to translate technical documents into effective marketing collateral with appropriate language and tone, including the ability to meticulously copy edit materials.
Experience of project management and project planning, including coordinating multiple projects with varying deadlines, and adjusting flexibly to rapidly changing priorities.
Team orientated – ‘one-team’ behavior is a must.
#PhD
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

job_title: Campus Alberta Innovates Program (CAIP) Research Chair, Aquatic Ecosystem Health
job_description:
Calgary, ABPosition Description
As part of its implementation strategy, the University of Calgary is funding a Campus Alberta Innovates Program (CAIP) Research Chair in the area of Aquatic Ecosystem Health. Protecting Alberta’s river systems is critical to the sustainability of industry, and Alberta’s natural resources. Effects within watersheds are cumulative, and current management approaches are informed by a variety of poorly aligned monitoring approaches that lack a common framework, regulatory approach, philosophy, and methodology. Cumulative effects assessment needs to be better integrated through regional environmental assessment and regional environmental effects frameworks that connect to regulatory and policy assurance including regional land use planning processes.
Working with relevant government agencies, industry-based partners, and stakeholder organizations, the strategic objective of the CAIP Chair will be to:
conduct innovative research on the assessment and prediction of cumulative environmental effects;
develop and validate novel cumulative effects approaches that integrate the monitoring and assessment of ecological and environmental indicators into direct application for resource management decision-making;
create a functioning network of inter- and trans-disciplinary expertise that focuses on the analysis, interpretation and synthesis of complex environmental data.
Research under this CAIP Chair will advance adaptive monitoring approaches, programs and systems, which can underpin a regional watershed-based integrated management system. The emphasis will be on conceptualizing, designing, and operating programs that are supported by hypothesis-driven science and research aligned to adverse outcome pathways to better link monitoring systems into an assessment and management system to identify, manage and mitigate cumulative effects. The focus will be to develop approaches and strategies for mobilizing and integrating the knowledge to help transform provincial and national strategies for sustainability of aquatic systems.
The Chair will collaborate with industry, government, academic and indigenous partners throughout Alberta’s drainage basins, and will develop integrated approaches for addressing cumulative effects at a watershed scale. The Chair will link to developing and existing University of Calgary expertise in aquatic sciences (hydrology, ecotoxicology, aquatic ecology, water quality), as well as the Water and Energy, (other areas) and to other CAIP Chairs. The Chair will be contributing to a University-AEP collaborative program.
The appointment to the CAIP Chair will be for a seven (7) year period and will be at the rank of Associate Professor or Professor and salary commensurate with experience. The position will be in the Faculty of Science.
Applicants at the associate professor level must provide evidence of an established, externally funded research program, a strong publication record, evidence of successful teaching and graduate supervision, and evidence of established academic engagements in professional and other communities.
Applicants at the full professor level must provide evidence of a well-established funded research program, outstanding academic publication record, evidence of a fully established, demonstrated ability to lead research teams, outstanding teaching and graduate supervision record, and evidence of academic service and/or leadership.
As per CAIP Research Chair award requirements, this Chair position is intended for academic scholars residing outside of Alberta, however, graduate students and postdoctoral fellows that reside within Alberta may apply for the position.
Qualifications:
PhD in Aquatic Ecosystem Health.
An outstanding and externally well funded research program.
A track record of capacity-building, knowledge translation, and working collaboratively and effectively with government, academic and Indigenous partners, is an asset.
Developing monitoring frameworks and regional, provincial and national monitoring programs.
Effectively collaborating with industry, governments and stakeholders including Indigenous communities and experts.
Leading aquatic scientist with international recognition.
Familiarity with aquatic monitoring systems internationally, nationally and provincially.
Familiarity with the policy and regulatory construct in Alberta and key science and knowledge gaps associated with regulatory and policy assurance.
Knowledge of the cumulative effects assessment practice in Canada and Alberta including in the oil sands region and under the Oil Sands Monitoring Program.
Interested individuals are encouraged to submit an application online via the 'Apply Now' link. Please be aware the application process allows for only four attachments. Your four attachments should be organized to contain the following (which may require you to merge documents such as publications):
Cover letter, curriculum vitae and names and contact information of three (3) references
Statement of research interests and a description of a proposed five (5) year research plan for the Chair
Application Deadline: April 15, 2019
Questions about this position may be directed to: Marjorie Moreau mmoreau@ucalgary.ca
The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. In this connection, at the time of your application, please answer the following question: Are you a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada? (Yes/No)
Additional Information
To view a listing of all available academic opportunities and to find out more about what the University of Calgary has to offer, please visit our Academic Careers website.
About the University of Calgary
The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
About Calgary, Alberta
Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.
